loans.name: Mokpokpo

texts.fr: Agé de 21 ans, Mr A. Mokpokpo n’a pas eu la chance de poursuivre ses études par manque de moyen financier. Ainsi, il s’est lancé très tôt dans l’apprentissage de la coordonnerie qu’il a terminé très brillamment. Son dynamisme et sa perspicacité lui ont permis de s’installer à son propre compte grâce à ses petites économies. En vue d’arranger son atelier, acheter des matériels modernes de travail et assurer un meilleur service à son clientèle, il sollicite un financement. Ce qui lui permettra de se prendre convenablement en charge et aider aussi ses petits frères dans leur scolarisation.
texts.en:
Mr. Mokpokpo A., 21, did not have the good fortune to pursue his studies because he lacked the financial means to do so. For that reason, he began an apprenticeship in shoemaking at an early age and finished it with excellent results. His energy and insight have allowed him to set himself up in business using his meager savings. With the intention of setting up his workshop, buying up-to-date tools, and ensuring the best possible service for his customers, he is requesting a loan. This will permit him to support himself appropriately and also to help his younger brothers with their school fees.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furnishing his workshop and buying tools for shoemaking

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is twenty-five years old. She is single and seriously looking for her "better half". She owns and operates a Rasta hairdo salon in her neighborhood at Babiani in the Western region of Ghana with her other two siblings. Rasta hairdo is what most people call it: plaiting one's hair with mesh.

Martha is very skillful and a talented hairdresser who adds lots of beauty to the hair of her many customers, and she says that is her secret. Martha uses "weavons" and mesh extensions to plait her clients' hair to add beauty. She has been doing this for the past four years now. She believes in efficiency and effectiveness of service, therefore she wants to use this loan to buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, mesh extensions, threads etc. to avoid shortage and poor servicing. As a result of this, she has one beautiful young lady as her apprentice whom she is training for her future career. Training was organized for her, so when your help is lent to her, she will use it to achieve her business goal of increased efficiency and profitability.

Grace's picture was taken when she was busily plaiting her customer's hair. She also believes the loan will enable her to rent a better store and furnish it with ceiling fans, lights, tiles etc. She believes in physical evidence.

loans.use: To buy larger quantities of hair products such as weavons, mesh, thread, needles, etc.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa M. is a 40-year-old entrepreneur. She is married and the mother of two children who are currently in school. She sells onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc. on the top of a table in the local market of Babiani where she lives. She says that through this business, she has endeavored to support her two kids as they finish senior high school. She requests this loan to enable her to buy an increased stock of tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc. to grow her business and to scale up the business. She hopes to increase her savings to support the children’s education to give them a future and hope. Her picture was taken when she was going to the market.

Yaa is convinced that when the loan is given to her she will be better able to expand her business growth.

loans.use: to buy an increased stock of onions, tomatoes, and peppers, etc.

loans.name: Kokou Olivier

texts.fr: Né en 1967, Mr A. Kokou Olivier est marié et père d’un enfant. Couturier de formation, il assure son métier avec beaucoup de plaisir et de bonne volonté. Ce qui lui confère une grande admiration dans son milieu. En vue de réaménager son atelier et acheter de nouvelles machines à coudre et d’autres matériels de travail, il sollicite un financement. Les bénéfices tirés de ses activités lui permettront de mieux s’épanouir et prendre régulièrement soin de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Kokou Olivier A. is married and the father of one child. A tailor by training, he practices his trade with a lot of joy and goodwill. He is greatly admired among his peers. In order to renovate his workshop,and to buy new sewing machines and other work tools, he is requesting a loan. The profit gained from this activity will allow him to be fulfilled and to take care of his family consistently.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Achat de machines à coudre et de matériels de travail

loans.name: Patience

texts.en:
Patience A. is 54 years old. She is single and has four grown-up children who are independent now. She owns and operates a grocery shop and sells items such as sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, cooking spices, table salt, skimmed powdered milk, and biscuits etc. at the community market in her neighborhood.

With this loan, Patience wants to purchase more crates of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of biscuits, etc. to increase her inventory. She hopes to improve her savings to expand her business growth. Patience says your support would boost her business growth, looking at the number of customers she meets each day. Her picture was taken when she was coming from the market.

loans.use: To buy more cartons of assorted drinks, bags of sugar, cartons of bottled mineral water, and boxes of biscuits, etc.

loans.name: Dzifa

texts.en:
Dzifa A. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sends them to the market for sale at Denu near Elmina. Dzifa has received primary education. She is married and has 2 children and her husband is a fisherman.

Dzifa has been selling fish since 2001. She spends most of her income on the business since her husband takes care of the family's financial needs. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Hanna

texts.en:
Hanna T. is fifty-four years old, married, and the mother of three children. Hanna believes in hard work and dedication which is the secret of her success. She owns and operates a local restaurant and sells local foods like fufu and banku and abetie. Fufu is prepared from pounded cassava and plantain, taken with soup. Banku is prepared from milled maize grains and it is taken with hot pepper or soup.

Hanna needs the loan to enable her to inject more capital to purchase more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantains, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood. She says the cost of raw materials is very high now and also she wants to save part to venture into crop farming in the near future. Her picture was taken when she was going about her normal daily chores.

loans.use: To buy more raw materials like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables and firewood.

loans.name: Adzavouvou

texts.fr: Mme A. Adzavouvou est née en 1961, mariée et mère de deux (02) enfants, elle est revendeuse de  condiments  (tomate, piment, sel, huile) et autres ingrédients de cuisine. Mais le manque de moyens financiers la handicape sérieusement. En vue de bien se ravitailler régulièrement en marchandise et avoir une clientèle fidèle, elle sollicite un financement. Ce qui lui permettra de mieux subvenir aux besoins de sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. Adzavouvou A. was born in 1961. Married and the mother of two children, she sells condiments (tomatoes, hot peppers, salt, oil) and other cooking ingredients. The lack of financial means handicaps her significantly. With the intention of being able to stock up on merchandise regularly so as to develop a faithful clientele, she has requested a loan. This will allow her to better support her family.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of foodstuffs

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en  1970, Mlle A. Akouvi est mère d’un (01) enfant. Infirmière de formation, elle a une grande passion pour la santé et le bien être humain. Elle est toujours concentrée sur son travail et l’exerce avec beaucoup de sérieux, car pour elle « la santé n’a pas de prix ». Afin de mieux s’équiper en matériels de travail et s’approvisionner en produits pharmaceutiques, elle sollicite un financement. Les revenus tirés de ses activités lui permettront de veiller à l’éducation de son enfant et de mieux organiser sa condition de vie.
texts.en:
Miss Akouvi A., born in 1970, is the mother of one child. She is a registered nurse with a great passion for health and human welfare. She is always concentrated on her work and does it earnestly, since she realizes that "health is a pearl beyond price." So as to better equip herself with what she needs for her work and to stock up on medicines, she is requesting a loan. The income from her work will allow her to assure her child of a good education and better organize her living conditions.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: sale of pharmaceutical products

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Née en 1982 à Lomé, Mlle A. Akouvi n’a pas en la chance d’aller à l’école par manque de moyen financier. Ainsi très tôt, elle a appris la coiffure qu’elle exerce avec courage et détermination. Pour aménager un atelier de coiffure et acheter des matériels de travail nécessaires à un bon rendement, elle sollicite un financement. Les revenus lui permettront de mieux se prendre en charge.
texts.en:
Born in 1982 in Lomé, Miss Akouvi A. did not have the good fortune to go to school because she lacked the financial means to do so. Thus, at a young age she learned hairdressing, a trade she plies with courage and determination. In order to furnish a salon and buy the necessary equipment to do well in her work, she is requesting a loan. The income will allow her to support herself better.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Furnishing of her salon and purchase of equipment for her work

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca T. is married and has 2 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Rebecca sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Denu near Elmina, which she has done since 2001. Her husband is a commercial driver.

Rebecca uses her income to pay business expenses and sometimes to help her husband in paying school fees and other expenses. Rebecca will use the loan to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Rebecca plans to save towards a house she wants to build for the family.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Peace

texts.en:
Peace G. is married and has 3 children. She has received schooling through junior high. Peace sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale at Denu near Elmina, which she has done since 1992. Her husband is a mason.

Peace uses her income for taking care of the family's financial needs notably paying school fees and utility bills. Peace will use the loan to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. With the new profits from her expanded business, Peace plans to save towards a house she wants to build with her husband for the family.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary S. is thirty-seven years old. She is divorced and has two children – a boy and a girl. The boy is in the senior high school while the girl is in the basic school. Mary lives with her two children in a town called Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana. She is the sole provider for all her children’s needs.

Mary is in sales. She owns a shop in the market where she sells rubber and plastic products such as buckets, bowls, plates, and many others. She has been in business for six years. She buys her products mostly from Kumasi. Being a single parent, Mary says it has not been easy for her providing for the children and especially, paying their school fees. She wants a loan to buy rubber products on a large scale so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy rubber and plastic products in bulk

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Alice G. is single and has no children. She has received schooling through junior high. Alice sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale. She also makes fabrics popularly known as "tie & dye" for sale at Bantama near Elmina, which she has done since 1999.

Alice uses her income for supporting herself. Alice will use the loan to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. She will also invest in her fabric production business. With the new profits from her expanded business, Alice plans to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

loans.use: to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and invest in her fabric production business

loans.name: Atsina

texts.en:
Atsina D. sells fish which she buys from the fishermen, bringing them home for processing and preservation, and then sending them to the market for sale, at Bantama near Elmina. Atsina has received primary education. She is married and has one child; her husband is a fisherman.

Atsina has been selling fish since 2003. She is responsible for paying utility bills and other basic expenses of the family. Her loan will be used to increase her purchase of fresh fish for processing and sale. She hopes to use the new profits from her business to reinvest back into the business to increase her capital base.

Beside her are the fish undergoing preservation before sale.

loans.use: to purchase fresh fish for processing and sale

loans.name: Cosset Aminta

texts.es: Cosset,  una joven comerciante que comenzó su propio negocio de pulpería  hace ya cinco  años producto de una liquidación de su trabajo anterior. Tiene 24 años de edad, casada, sin hijos, residente del Barrio. Villa Venezuela en la ciudad de Managua, entre sus planes están el verse realizada como madre, el proveerle a su familia un mejor nivel de vida y poder ampliar su casa. Desde que inicio su negocio a contado con la ayuda de su esposo y juntos anhelan ampliarlo y transformarlo en una miscelánea, para llevar a cabo sus metas  con es te préstamo,  le permitirá ampliar su capital de trabajo y de esta manera surtir mas el inventario de la pulpería, gracias a la ayuda que le brindara AFODENIC, será posible el cumplimiento de este sueño.
texts.en:
Cosset is a young businesswoman who started her own grocery business five years ago with monies from a settlement from a previous job. She is 24 years old, married without children, and lives in the Villa Venezuela neighbourhood of Managua. She wants to have children and give her family a better standard of living and expand her home. Since she has started her business she has counted on her husband's help and together they yearn to expand the business and turn it into a general store. This loan will let them reach their goal; it will allow them to increase their working capital and thus increase their stock in the grocery. Thanks to AFODENIC's help, this dream can come true.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase products, supplies and staple goods to supply the grocery

loans.name: Mayra

texts.es: Mayra, es una diligente madre soltera preocupada por mejorar el nivel de vida de su familia. Comerciante de 41 años de edad, residente del Barrio. Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua. Hace seis meses se dedica a la venta de ropa usada ambulante comenzó con   su liquidación y remesas que recibe del exterior. Uno de sus mayores anhelos es poder sacar adelante en sus estudios a su hija de 15 años y que esta corone su carrera, como también poder comprar un vehiculo en el que pueda distribuir su mercadería y de esta manera desarrollarse y extender su negocio hacia el norte del país,  y así lograr una mejor estabilidad económica en su hogar. Para llevar a cabo sus metas esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá la compra de 5 pacas de ropa variada para ofertar a sus clientes y público en general sus productos que son accesibles al bolsillo bonitas y de buena calidad, con este inventario podrá obtener mejores ingresos, como ventas.
texts.en:
Mayra is a dedicated single mother focused on improving her family's quality of life. She is a 41 year old saleswoman and resident of the Laureles Norte neighborhood in the city of Managua. Six months ago she began selling used clothing starting with the distribution of liquidation supplies she received from abroad. Her main goal is to support the advanced studies of her 15 year old daughter. She also would like to purchase a vehicle to distribute her merchandise in order to expand her business to the northern part of the country which will help her gain better financial stability for her family. To reach these goals she is requesting a loan to be repaid within nine months to puchase 5 packages of clothing to make available to her customary clients and the general public. With better inventory she will be able to generate more income and sales.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase additional merchandise for sale

loans.name: Maria Esperanza

texts.es: Maria, es ejecutiva de ventas en una óptica capitalina en la ciudad de Managua , ya tiene tres años de laborar para esta empresa y sus aspiraciones son llegar a ser jefe regional de la óptica y de esta manera poder mejorar el nivel de vida en su familia. Tiene 36 años de edad, casada madre de dos niños que están estudiando la  primaria, habita en el  barrio  Laureles Norte, para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de uno de sus  planes familiares que son terminar de hacer su casa esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá comprar materiales  de construcción para reparar el techo de su casa, gracias a la ayuda que le brinda AFODENIC, lograra su anhelo. De tener una casa digna.
texts.en:
Maria is a sales representative for an eyeglass store in the city of Managua. She has been working for this company for three years and her goal is to be a regional manager of the chain so that she can improve her family's quality of life. She is 36 years old, married and has two children in primary school. She lives in the neighborhood of Laureles Norte. To focus on her goal she first needs to finish building her home and is therefore requesting a loan to be repaid within nine months. This loan will be used to purchase construction materials to finish the roof of her house. Thanks to the help provided by AFODENIC she can achieve her dream of having a proper home.

Translated from Spanish by Julie Lerch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To puchase construction materials to finish building her home

loans.name: Belen

texts.es:
La señora Belén L. y su esposo el señor Abel Valle tiene dos hijos que son pequeños de edad escolar, ellos están solicitando un préstamo, para construir la barda lateral de su casa para tener más seguridad y los acabados del interior de la recamara de los niños.
 Doña Belén y el señor Abel solicitan el crédito para comprar el material ya que Don Abel  se dedica a la construcción y el  se encargara de realizar la mejora.
texts.en:
Belén L. and her husband Abel Valle have two young school-age sons. They are requesting a loan to build a fence along the side of their house for added security and to finish the inside of the childrens´s bedroom. Belén and Abel are asking for the loan to buy materials. Abel works in construction and will be in chanrge of the home improvements.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build side fencing and finish interiors.

loans.name: Jonny

texts.es: Jonny es promotor de venta de una de la cadena de supermercados la Colonia mas reconocida de Nicaragua, ya cuenta con tres años de laborar en esa área.  Los planes que tiene para su familia es poder mejorar su nivel de vida, espera poder montar en un lapso corto de tiempo su propio negocio que consiste en una carnicería, así de esta manera mejorar e incrementar los ingresos en su hogar. Tienen  37 años de edad, Soltero, sin hijos, habitante del Barrio  Laureles Norte en la ciudad de Managua. Para llevar a cabo el cumplimiento de una de sus metas esta solicitando un préstamo con un periodo de devolución de nueve meses, que le permitirá cambiar el techo de su casa, lo cual necesita comprar materiales de construcción como zinc, perlines, golosos entre otros, para poder hacer el cambio del techo, lo cual será de  gran beneficio y logros en su vida personal.
texts.en:
Jonny is a salesman for "la Colonia", one of the best-known chains of supermarkets in Nicaragua. He has been doing this job for three years. He wants to improve his family's living standard and hopes to open his own business shortly, a butcher shop. He will then be able to make home improvements and increase his income. He is 37 years old, single and has no children. He lives in the Laureles Norte neighbourhood of Managua. In order to meet his goals, he is requesting a loan to be repaid in nine months. He will use the loan to replace the roof of his home, and will need to buy building materials such as zinc, purlins, beams and so on in order to change the roof. This will benefit him greatly and will count as an achievement in his personal life.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to fix the roof of his home.

loans.name: Martha Amalia

texts.es: La Sra. Martha tiene 50 años de edad, habita en Villa Reconciliación del puente una cuadra al este en Managua  casada y con tres hijos dos estudian y uno de ellos es enfermo con discapacidad, para ella ha sido difícil poder trabajar y ganar un salario mensual,  ya que tiene que ver por su hijo el cual es bien imperativo. Lo que hizo fue poner una  pulpería que inicio con capital propio, desde hace cuatro años, ahora hace préstamos en Afodenic el cual le ha brindado la oportunidad para reforzar su negocio y poder ofertar a sus clientes la variedad de sus productos. Su esposo es comerciante y aporta  a los gastos del hogar,  con esta solicitud de crédito es la octava la cual le va a beneficiar para poder invertir en la pulpería en la compra de granos básicos, productos enlatados y insumos diarios, y así fortalecer su inventario. Sus objetivos a corto plazo es poder ayudar a sus hijos a que sigan preparándose con los estudios para que sean buenas personas en la sociedad
texts.en:
Martha is 50 years old and lives in the neighbourhood of Villa Reconciliación in Managua. She is married and has three children, of whom two are studying and one is disabled. She has found it difficult to work and make a monthly salary as she has to care for her son, which is very demanding. Her solution was to open a grocery store four years ago with her own savings. Now she borrows from Afodenic which has given her the opportunity to improve her business and offer her clients a greater variety of goods. Her husband is a merchant and he contributes to the household expenses. This is her eighth loan, which she will use to invest in her grocery store buying staples, canned goods and foodstuffs, thus increasing her inventory. Her short-term goal is to help her children that they may continue their studies and be good citizens.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staples, canned goods, and other foodstuffs.

loans.name: Leobardo

texts.es:
El señor Leobardo C. esta agradecido por el gran apoyo que le brindaron en su anterior crédito. 
 Su negocio ha crecido mucho, en este momento el desea contar con su apoyo para otro préstamo para surtir su negocio de ropa nueva y zapatos. Ya que sus clientes se lo están pidiendo. 
Se instala en diferentes mercados de la cuidad y eso le ha ayudado para progresar y consolidarse en este ramo.
texts.en:
Leobardo C. is grateful for the help he received with his previous loan. His business has grown a lot and now he would like to count on your help for another loan to supply his business with new clothing and footwear which his customers are asking for. He sets up in different markets in the city and this helps him to grow and consolidate his line of business.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Loretta

texts.en:
Loretta C. F., 28, is married with 2 children.  She has many years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the villagers and passing tourists 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 1500 Tala (~625 USD).

SPBD loans are Loretta’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her loan will be used to purchase a freezer and goods for the shop.

loans.use: Purchase freezer, herring, milk, twisties, spaghetti, coils, and oil

loans.name: Alaine

texts.en: Alaine S., 19, is single with  children.  She has 1 year of experience in the Elei (traditional fabric printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Alaine’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase printing boards, materials, and brushes for painting

loans.name: Victor Manuel

texts.es:
El señor Víctor Manuel y su esposa tienen dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada más de un año, este negocio es la fuente de ingreso de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos estudiando y quieren que tenga una carrera profesional. 
El negocio le está haciendo falta mas mercancía de temporada pero en este instante no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder surtirlo, es por eso que solicitan un préstamo para la compra de más mercancía y así tener más ingresos para su familia.
texts.en:
Víctor Manuel and his wife have been selling used clothing for more than a year. This business is the source of the family´s income. They have three children who are studying and they want them to have professional careers. The business needs more seasonal merchandise but currently they do not have enough money to stock up. For this reason they are requesting a loan in order to buy more merchandise and to have more income for their family.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy merchandise.

loans.name: Matiliana

texts.en:
Matiliana P., 25, is single with children. She has 3 years of experience in the Elei (traditional fabric printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Matiliana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. The purpose of her loan is to purchase fabrics and painting equipment used for elei printing.

loans.use: Purchase roller, fabric paint, brushes, printing boards, glitter, and fabrics

loans.name: Tuipulotu

texts.en: Tuipulotu T., 19, is single with no children.  She has many years of experience in the Elei (traditional fabric printing) business. She sells to the general public 6 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Tuipulotu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase fabric, printing board, and paints

loans.name: Sesilia

texts.en:
Sesilia V., 28, is married with 3 children. She has 2 years of experience in selling cooked foods such as fry-rice, ice-cakes, snacks and drinks. She sells to the school, villagers and the public 5 days per week. She has had 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Sesilia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is self-employed and he also gets just enough money to help out the family and the business.

loans.use: buying sacks of rice, soy sauce, cordial, snacks and sugar: everything needed for her foodstall

loans.name: Melaia

texts.en: Melaia F., 55, is married with 3 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the sales business. She sells to the villagers 7 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 550 Tala (~229 USD).  SPBD loans are Melaia’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: re-stocking of her shop

loans.name: Asolima

texts.en: Asolima T., 31, is married with 3 children.  She has 1.5 years of experience in the taro, yam, and banana business. She sells to the village people and the public 2 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Asolima’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: expand her plantation

loans.name: Ulata

texts.en: Ulata U., 30, is married with 2 children.  She has 2 years of experience in the pancakes, noodles, taro, and banana business. She sells to the village people and the public, and school children 5 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 50 Tala.  SPBD loans are Ulata’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: expand her plantation and her canteen

loans.name: Uatimani

texts.en: Uatimani E., 18, is single with no children.  She has no experience in the elei (traditional fabric printing) \ clothes business, but she intends to start one up and sell to the village people and public 3 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  SPBD loans are Uatimani’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase materials to start up her business

loans.name: Tineimu

texts.en: Tineimu P., 20, is single with no children.  She has 1 year of experience in the puletasi (traditional long dresses), T-shirts, uniforms business. She sells to the village people and the public, and other families 3 days per week. She is a new member and this is her first loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala (~ USD).  SPBD loans are Tineimu’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase material to expand her sewing business

loans.name: Litara

texts.en: Litara M., 69, is widowed with 11 children. She has worked for three years in the banana business. She sells her bananas to the people of her village once a week. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala.  SPBD loans are Litara’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Invest and expand her banana crop

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en:
Naomi S., 39, is married with 2 children. She has many years of experience in raising and selling chickens and pigs. She sells to the general public and villagers 5 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).

SPBD loans are Naomi’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is working and helps her with financing and raising her pigs and doing her chicken farming.

loans.use: buying fences, nails, iron roofs for their pens and coconuts for their food

loans.name: Héctor

texts.es:
El señor Héctor M. tiene ya mas de once años dedicándose a la elaboración y venta de tacos este negocio es su única fuente de ingresos, su familia depende totalmente de ello.
El local es semiabierto y desea realizarle mejoras para mayor comodidad de sus comensales y así tengan una mejor atención hacia ellos, al igual quiere invertir en el producto de venta; tener lo suficiente para trabajar.
texts.en:
Héctor M. has been making and selling tacos for more than 11 years. This business is his only source of income and his family depends on it completely. His stand is partially open and he would like to make some improvements so that his customers are more comfortable and he can give them better service. He would also like to invest in his product so that he has enough supplies to work with.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Fix up his stand and buy supplies.

loans.name: Lalotoa

texts.en:
Lalotoa M., 43, is married with 4 children. She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 2 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Lalotoa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of this loan will be used to buy fishing gear for her husband; his business goes together with her plantation. Her husband is a very good fisherman who always goes fishing and can earn money from it.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals and seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Susana

texts.en:
Susana L., 60, is married with 8 children. She has 3 years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and public 2 days per week. She has 1 previous loan with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).

SPBD loans are Susana’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Her husband is a good carpenter and he earns money to help out with the business and supporting the family.

loans.use: Purchase chemicals, bush knives, and seedlings, etc.

loans.name: Seleisa

texts.en:
Seleisa S., 35, is married with 7 children. She has many years of experience in selling vegetables and fruit. She sells to the villagers, public, and families 5 days per week. She has 4 previous loans with SPBD. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 450 Tala (~187 USD).

SPBD loans are Seleisa’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used to buy cement, iron roofing, and timbers for home improvement. She also produces Samoan cocoa which is one of the Samoans' favorite drinks and sells popcorn just to back up her vegetable garden.

loans.use: buying fertilizer, vegetables seeds, chemicals, and plastic bags for selling her items

loans.name: Eliud

texts.es:
El señor Eliud R. tiene una hermosa familia y como tal desea lo mejor para sus hijos 
Con dos créditos anteriores de FVP ha construido una parte de su casa pero no ha concluido, le está faltando los acabados interiores y poner las protecciones de las puertas y ventanas.
Está solicitando un préstamo para terminar la mejora y planea pagarlo con los ingresos de su trabaja. Él y su esposa desean que sus hijos tengan su propio espacio para que les permita estar más cómodos y felices.
texts.en:
Mr. Eliud R. has a lovely family and wants the best for his children. He used his two prior FVP loans to build part of his house, but he is not done yet. He still needs to do some interior finish work and add locks to the windows and doors. He is requesting a loan so he can finish the improvements. He plans to pay it off with income from his job. He and his wife would like their children to have space of their own so they can be happier and more comfortable.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Interior finish work and iron working shop

loans.name: Faafetai

texts.en:
Faafetai U., 44, is married with three children.  She has many years of experience in the elei printing materials business.  She sells to the general public and villagers three days per week.  She expects her weekly net cash flows to be 400 Tala (~166 USD).  

She has two previous loans with SPBD.  SPBD loans are Faafetai’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.  Part of this loan will be used for building a small house for business purposes only.

loans.use: Purchase buying paintings, brushes, stencils, carving woods and materials.

loans.name: Anamaria

texts.en:
Anamaria L., 48, is married with seven children.  She has many years of experience in the elei printing and sewing clothes business.  She sells her products to villagers, friends, families and the public five days per week.  

She has four previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 500 Tala (~208 USD).  SPBD loans are Anamaria’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  In additoin to buying materials for her clothing business, part of the loan will also be used to buy cements, bricks, timbers and nails for home improvement.  Her husband is also working, and he helps out with both the business and their family.

loans.use: Purchase buying a new hand sewing machine, fabrics, needles, threads, and materials

loans.name: Sifaga

texts.en:
Sifaga T., 38, is married with six children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells her products to villagers and the public two days per week.  

She has two previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 380 Tala (~158 USD).  SPBD loans are Sifaga’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  Her husband is a good farmer, and he works very hard in their plantation, in order to earn money.

loans.use: Purchase buying fertilizers, vegetables seeds, chemicals and plastic bags for selling her items.

loans.name: Tapuotaota

texts.en:
Tapuotaota T., 59, is married with nine children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to villagers and the public two days per week.  

She has three previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 350 Tala (~145 USD).  SPBD loans are Tapuotaota’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for loans with traditional banks.  She also runs a small shop at home just to supplement her plantation business.

loans.use: Purchase buying pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals and bush knives

loans.name: Temukisa

texts.en:
Temukisa L. is married with children.  She has three years of experience in the plantation business.  She sells to villagers and the general public two days per week. 

She has one previous loan with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 320 Tala (~133 USD).  SPBD loans are Temukisa’s only access to capital because she was unable to qualify for a loan with traditional banks.  Part of the loan will be used for buying timbers and iron-roofs for home improvement

loans.use: Purchase buying pesticides, fertilizers, chemicals and bush knives

loans.name: Salepou

texts.en:
Salepou F., age 34, is married with 5 children. She has many years of experience in farming. She sells to the villagers and the public three days per week. 

She has thre previous loans from SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 400 Tala (~$166 USD).  SPBD loans are Salepou’s only access to capital, because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. 

Her husband is working and he helps the most to support the family and the business.

loans.use: To buy chemicals, pesticides, fertilizer, and vegetables seeds

loans.name: Salemalama

texts.en:
Salemalama P., age 32, is married with 2 children. She has two months of experience in the taro and banana business. She sells to the people of her village and the public one day each week. 

She is a new member of SPBD who has received only one previous SPBD loan. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 70 Tala. SPBD loans are Salemalama’s only access to capital, because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks.

loans.use: To expand her taro farm

loans.name: Tautala

texts.en:
Tautala N., age 41, is single. She she is new to the pig business. She sells to the people of her village and to the public three days per week. She is a new member of SPBD with only one previous SPBD loan. She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 40 Tala.  

SPBD loans are Tautala’s only access to capital, because she has never been able to qualify for a loan from traditional banks. Her family will help her to develop her piggery.

loans.use: She will use her first loan to start her piggery

loans.name: Brenda

texts.es: Brenda tiene 20 años, es madre de dos hijos y vive con su pareja. Ella se dedica a la venta de cerveza desde hace ya 4 años atrás en su casa, lo que le gusta de su trabajo es atender con amabilidad a sus clientes y sobre todo poder dar lo necesario a sus hijos que son la luz por la cual trabaja cada día, desea verlos en el futuro como profesionales. Debido a que estas bebidas son gran consumo, Brenda tiene muy buenas ventas diariamente, además se encuentra ubicada en una zona por donde transitan muchas personas que para refrescarse se toman un tiempo para consumir entre amigos algunas cervezas, y es ahí donde entra a tallar la amabilidad en la atención de Brenda. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP, y hasta el momento ha sido puntual con sus pagos anteriores. Con el dinero que solicita comprará sillas y mesas, además de mandar a construir un kiosco para la venta de sus bebidas.
texts.en:
Brenda is 20 years old, the mother of two children and lives with her partner. For the past 4 years she has sold beer from behind her home. What she likes about her work is serving her customers and most of all, being able to provide for her children, who are the reason she works every day; she would like to see them become professionals in the future. Since the drinks have a high rate of consumption, Brenda has good sales every day. In addition, she is in a high-traffic area where many people pass by and stop to have a beer with their friends and receive friendly service from Brenda. This is her second loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has been on time with her previous payments. With the money she requests she will buy chairs and tables as well as build a kiosk where she can sell drinks.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Build a kiosk for her business and buy tables and chairs.

loans.name: Celmit

texts.es: Celmit tiene 42 años, es madre de cuatro hijos maravillosos y vive con su conviviente quien la ayuda mucho. Ella se dedica a la preparación de distintos platos de comida y bocadillos para diferentes eventos sociales donde la contraten, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 3 años y hasta ahora está muy contenta con su negocio, que además le gusta porque se relaciona con muchas personas. Celmit trabaja solo por contratos con diferentes instituciones y persona particulares, y por ser muy conocida su buena sazón cada vez incrementa su clientela. Este es su primer préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero solicitado comprará los utensilios y vajilla, también alquilará un local que le sirva como almacén.
texts.en:
Celmit is 42 years old and the mother of four wonderful children. She lives with her common-law husband, who helps her a lot. She prepares different types of food and snacks for social events who hire her. She has been doing this for the past 3 years and so far is very happy with her business and also likes it because she deals with many people. Celmit works by contract with different organizations and individuals and because she is known as a good cook her clientele is growing. This is her first loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money she is requesting she will buy utensils and dinnerware as well as rent a storefont which can also be used for storage.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Rent a storefont and buy cooking utensils.

loans.name: Gilder

texts.es: Gilder tiene 42 años, es padre de 3 hijos que están estudiando y vive con su esposa. El se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su bote a motor, trasladándolos por los distintos caseríos de su región río abajo, ocupándole todo un día de viaje. Realizar este trabajo es muy divertido para Gilder, ya que le gusta recorrer por río todos esos bonitos lugares, además que mantiene amenas conversaciones con sus pasajeros. Este medio de transporte es muy requerido en su región por lo que también le da buenas ganancias para el sostenimiento de su familia. Es la segunda vez que tiene un crédito con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita comprará materiales para construir otro bote a motor y así generar trabajo a otras personas.
texts.en:
Gilder is 42 years old, the father of 3 children who study, and he lives with his wife. He provides a passenger service with his motorboat, transporting people to the various small towns downriver, a trip which takes him all day. This work is very enjoyable for Gilder as he likes to travel along the river to all these beautiful places and in addition, have pleasant conversations with his passengers. This means of transportation is very much in demand in the area and gives him good earnings to support his family. This is his second time with Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money he requests he will buy materials for building another motorboat and in this way he will provide work for other persons.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy materials to build a motorboat.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 42 años, es madre soltera y vive con sus dos hijos. Hace 19 años ingresó al ámbito del transporte, es propietaria de tres motocarros que son manejados por chóferes particulares dedicados al transporte público de pasajeros. Las ganancias obtenidas en este negocio le ayudan a solventar los gastos diarios de su familia. Gloria cuenta que cada año ha ido aumentando la demanda por este tipo de transporte, y ahora la competencia es mayor, pero lo bueno es que ella cuenta con tres de estos motocarros, por lo que le es más rentable. Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero de este crédito le hará mantenimiento a sus motos, y además mandará a construir un garaje para guardarlas.
texts.en:
Gloria is 42 years old, a single mother and lives with her two children. Nineteen years ago she started in the transportation business. She is the owner of three motocarros (three wheeled motorized cart) which are used for public transportation and are drivien by others. The earnings from this business help her to take care of her family´s daily expenses. Each year the demand for this type of transportation has grown and the competition is now greater, but luckily she has three vehicles and her business is profitable. This is the first time she has asked for a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma. With the money from this loan she will do maintenance on her vehicles and build a garage for storing them.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Maintenance for vehicles and construction of a garage.

loans.name: Jorge

texts.es: Jorge tiene 45 años de edad, es soltero, vive con sus hermanas y su mamá. Se dedica a preparar tamales, juanes y humintas, los mismos que los lleva a vender por distintos lugares de manera ambulante, este trabajo lo viene realizando desde hace 7 años, y lo que le gusta es conocer muchas personas y lugares, sobre todo entablar conversación con sus consumidores. Además, cuenta con clientes  fieles que solo esperan su llegada para comprar su comida que es tan deliciosa. Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP por un préstamo, por lo que está muy comprometido en ser puntual en sus pagos. Con el dinero que solicita comprará utensilios de cocina, además de un triciclo para trasladar con mayor comodidad su comida.
texts.en:
Jorge is 45 years old, single and lives with his sisters and mother. He prepares tamales, juanes (rice, chicken, eggs, olives, herbs and spices wrapped in a large jungle leaf called bijau) and humintas (squares of sweet cornbread with cheese), which he takes around to different places to sell. He has been doing this work for the past 7 years, and he likes getting to know many people and places and most of all chatting with his customers. He has a loyal clientele who wait for him to arrive so they can buy his delicious food. This is the first time he has come to Microfinanzas Prisma for a loan and he is very committed to making his repayments on time. With the money he requests he will buy kitchen utensils as well as a tricycle so that he can transport his food more comfortably.

Translated from Spanish by Molly Puglisi, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy a tricycle for transporting his products.

loans.name: Kathya

texts.es: Kathya tiene 24 años, vive con su hijo y su conviviente quien la apoya mucho. Ella se dedica a la venta abarrotes y verduras en un puesto del mercado de su localidad, también envía a otra persona a vender sus productos por los distintos caseríos del río Ucayali, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 4 años, le gusta porque conoce a muchas personas y siempre está pendiente de darles un trato amable para que regresen a comprarle. Hasta el momento este negocio le da dado buenas ganancias, suficientes para el sostenimiento de los gastos de su hogar, pero ella quiere mejorar y seguir creciendo por lo que no duda en seguir invirtiendo su tiempo y dinero en ello. Es la primera vez que pertenece a un banco comunal, y también es su primer préstamo con MFP, y se ha comprometido a ser muy responsable y puntual. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su puesto, comprar mercadería, para que posteriormente con mucho trabajo y esfuerzo cumpla su sueño de tener un minimarket.
texts.en:
Kathya is 24 years old. She lives with her son and her partner who supports her a lot. She is dedicated to selling groceries and produce from a stall in her local market. She also sends another person to sell her products in the different villages of the Ucayali river. She's had this business for four years. She enjoys it because she knows a lot of people and is always ready to provide friendly treatment so that they become return shoppers. Up until now, this business has generated good income, enough to pay the bills. However, she wants to improve and continue to grow for which she does not hesitate to continue to invest her time and money. This is the first time that she has belonged to a community bank. This is also her first loan with MFP. She has promised to be very responsible and punctual. With the money that she is requesting, she will expand her stall and purchase merchandise so that later, with a lot of work and effort, she can achieve her dream of having a minimarket.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expand her stall and purchase more merchandise.

loans.name: Mardelia

texts.es: Mardelia, de 58 años de edad es madre de 2 hijos que ya son independientes y de familia, en la actualidad viven solo con su esposo. Desde hace 10 años, se dedica a la venta de abarrotes en la pequeña tienda que implementó en su casa, Mardelia tiene como principales clientes a sus vecinos, ya que es su tienda la única en su zona, por lo que tiene buena venta y satisfactorias ganancias. A ella le gusta mucho su trabajo, debido a que en todos estos años ha hecho amistad con sus vecinos, y por su trato amable siempre consigue nuevos clientes. Este es su 2do préstamo con MFP. Con el dinero que solicita mandará a ampliar su tienda, como también comprará más productos para surtirlo.
texts.en:
Mardelia, who is 58 years old and is mother to two sons who are independent and have their own families, currently lives alone with her husband. For ten years, she has sold groceries in the small shop that she established in her home. Mardelia's main customers are her neighbors since her shop is the only one in the area. As a result, she has good sales and satisfactory income. She likes her work a lot since, over all these years, she has made friendships with her neighbors and, through her friendly treatment, she always gains new customers. This is her second loan with MFP. With the money she his requesting, she will expand her shop. In addition, she will buy more products to stock it.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: More merchandise for her shop.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es: Maribel, de 40 años de edad, es madre de 2 hijos que ya son independientes, vive con su esposo quien se siente feliz de tener una esposa tan maravillosa y trabajadora. Ella se dedica a vender comida por las noches en las afueras de su casa, esta labor la viene realizando desde hace 8 años atrás y le va muy bien, ya que se encuentra ubicada en una buena zona. Lo que le gusta de su trabajo es preparar bien su comida que esté al gusto del cliente. Además le es rentable bebido a que cuenta con sus clientes fieles que consumen su comida desde que se inició en este negocio.Es la primera vez que recurre a MFP solicitando un préstamo, el cual invertirá en la construcción de un kiosco para dar una mejor a cogida a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Maribel, who is 40 years old and mother to two children who are already independent, lives with her husband who feels happy to have a wife so marvelous and hard-working. She is dedicated to selling food at night in the area near her home. She began this work eight years ago and it has gone well since she has found herself located in a good zone. What she likes about her work is preparing her food to the liking of her customers. In addition, this work is profitable thanks to her loyal customers who have been eating her food since she began this business. This is the first time that she has resorted to requesting a loan from MFP, which will be invested in the construction of a kiosk so that she may give better service to her customers.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a kiosk for her business.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 34 años, vive con su pareja, tiene dos hijos de los cuales uno de ellos vive acompañando a su madre que está anciana. Desde muy pequeña tuvo inclinación en el cuidado y la protección de los  animales, pero jamás imaginó, que empujada por la necesidad tuviera que sacrificar a sus preciados cerditos como ella los llamaba de niña. Aproximadamente hace 8 años que viene dedicándose a comprar cerdos, los alimenta con los sobrantes de la papa de su cosecha, y en seguida con alimento especial, llamado purina que tiene un costo de 60 soles por saco, que le alcanza para tres cerdos por 20 días. Y una vez que están gordos los sacrifica los días miércoles o sábados de cada semana; para de ese modo llevar al mercado su carne los días de feria, jueves y domingos que sus clientes la esperan. Para Delia este negocio le es muy rentable, ya que por cada cerdo gana entre 100 y 150 soles, su única dificultad es que cuando los compra tiene que llevarlos cargados ella misma. Este es su tercer préstamo consecutivo con MPF, y todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero solicitado comprará alimento para sus cerdos, Delia está muy agradecida con todos aquellos que le permiten acceder a este préstamo.
texts.en:
Delia is 34 years old, lives with her partner, and has two children, one of whom lives with her mother who is old. Since she was young, she had the inclination to care and protect animals. However, she never imagined that, pushed by necessity, she would have to sacrifice her precious little pigs, as she has called them since she was young. Approximately eight years ago, she became dedicated to purchasing pigs. She feeds them the leftovers from the potato harvest and, later, special food called purina that costs 60 soles per bag that feeds three pigs for 20 days. Once they're fat, she slaughters them on Wednesdays or Saturdays each week so that she can take the meat that her customers expect to the market on fair days, Thursdays and Sundays. For Delia, this business is very profitable since for every pig, she earns between 100 and 150 soles. Her only difficulty is when she has to carry the purchase herself. This is her third consecutive loan with MFP and, over all this time, she has demonstrated punctuality in her payments. With the money that she is requesting, she willl buy food for her pigs. Delia is very thankful to all of you who allow her to access this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase food for her pigs.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es: Juan tiene 47 años de edad, es casado, tienen tres hijos que viven con ellos, y su hijo mayor es muy dedicado al estudio. Los padres de Juan eran agricultores, y desde muy niño conoce las temporadas de siembra de cada producto. Cuando se casó se propuso la meta de sembrar en grandes  cantidades y de obtener buenas ganancias y así fue; llegó a cosechar para cada saco de semilla 25 sacos de papa de primera calidad, sin contar las papas desechadas que las vende a las personas que crían cerdos. A Juan le gusta su trabajo, cultivar la tierra le ha permitido adquirir un carro hace 5 años, y hoy es una herramienta muy útil para transportar sus productos. La agricultura para él es muy rentable pero depende de cómo se atiende, asimismo, la lluvia junto con el abono son clave para una buena cosecha, enfatizó muy contento don Juan. El viene trabajando con MFP por tres préstamos consecutivos, y vino realizando sus pagos en las fechas indicadas. Con el dinero solicitado comprará sacos de abono para su chacra de papa.
texts.en:
Juan is 47 years old, is married, has three children who live with him and his eldest son is very dedicated to his studies. Juan's parents were farmers and, since he was young, her knew the planting seasons for every product. When he married, he proposed the goal of planting in great quantities and obtain a good income. In this way, he harvested 25 sacks of first quality potato for every sack of seed, not counting the discarded potatoes that he sold to people who raise pigs. Juan likes his job. Cultivating the land allowed him to acquire a truck five years ago and today it is a useful tool to transport his products. Farming is very proftable for him, however it depends on how it responds. Juan stresses that, at the same time, the rain and the fertilizer are keys for a good harvest. He has worked with MFP for three consecutive loans and has paid by his deadlines. With the money that he is requesting, he will buy bags of fertilizer for his potato ranch.

Translated from Spanish by Kate Divjak, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bags of fertilizer for his crops.

loans.name: Ordalina Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank.  Eva is 46 years old and is married with five children. She sells sweets, fruit, and soda from a mobile tricycle that she parks outsiD. the headquarters of a local inter-provincial transport company.  

Eva needs a loan of 750 soles to buy sodas and cookies. Eva hopes to expand her business, offer a wider variety of merchandise, and proviD. her children with a good education. 

Translated from Spanish by Cynthia McMurry, Kiva Fellow
Eva es socia del Banco Comunal Orquídeas. 
Eva es casada, tiene 46 años y 5 hijos, Eva se dedica a la venta D. golosinas, frutas, gaseosas en un triciclo que se ubica en la puerta D. una empresa D. transporte interprovincial, Actividad que realiza todos los días. 
Eva necesita un préstamo D. 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. gaseosas y galletas. 
Los sueños D. Eva son ampliar y surtir su negocio y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.

loans.use: Buy soda and cookies

loans.name: Trinidad

texts.es: Trinidad tiene 28 años de edad, vive con su pareja, con la que tiene una sola hija de nombre Soledad que es la engreída del hogar. Los padres de Trinidad en su juventud sembraban numerosas hectáreas de papa, ella se levantaba a las 4:00am para ayudar a su madre a preparar el desayuno y el almuerzo, a eso de las 9:00am se tenía que alistar las viandas para luego cargar en los asnos y transportarlos hasta las chacras. Esa es la rutina que hasta ahora tiene Trinidad, ya que su esposo se dedica también al cultivo de la tierra, sembrando por cada temporada de 4 a 5 hectáreas de semilla de papa. Por cada saco llega a vender entre 70 a 80 soles, mientras que la papa de consumo varia su precio de acuerdo el mercado y eso no les conviene, ella y su esposo consideran que sembrar  semilla  de papa, es mas rentable y ya tienen clientes fijos de otras ciudades que les hacen pedidos cada mes. Es la tercera vez que viene trabajando un crédito con MFP, y en todo este tiempo siempre ha tratado de pagar en las fechas programadas. El dinero solicitado le servio para la compra de abono y fertilizantes para sus campos de papa.
texts.en:
Trinidad is 28 and lives with her husband and their daughter, Soledad, who is the household attention-seeker. When Trinidad was a child, her parents cultivated several hectares of potatoes. She would get up at 4:00AM and help her mother prepare breakfast and lunch until 9:00, when she would to pack the food onto the donkeys and bring it out to the fields. Trinidad still has the same routine today, as her husband also earns his living working the land. Every season he cultivates 4 or 5 hectares of potato seeds. Each sack of seeds sells for between 70 and 80 soles. The price of potatoes, on the other hand, varies with the market, which does not suit their needs. Growing the seeds is more profitable for Trinidad and her husband; they already have regular clients in other cities who order from them monthly. This will be Trinidad’s third loan with MFP, and she has always tried to make payments on time. She plans to use her loan to purchase a variety of fertilizers for her potato fields.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a variety of fertilizers for her crops

loans.name: Eva

texts.en:
Eva is a member of the Orquideas (“Orchids”) Village Bank. She is 37 years old and is married with two children. Eva buys and sells grain for a living. She buys the grain in the markets of the city of Ayacucho, and travels by bus to bring them to different towns in the jungle to sell. She has been in this business for the past five years. 

Eva is requesting a loan of 1800 soles to buy wheat, barley and other grains. Her goal for the future is to open her own store in her home.

loans.use: Buy wheat, barley and other grains

loans.name: Mario Francisco

texts.es: El señor Mario Francisco S. V., tiene la edad de 51 años,  habita en Kilómetro  17 ½   carretera hacia ticuantepe,  junto a su esposa, la cual le ayuda con los gastos del hogar ya que ella se desempeña como docente desde hace veinte  años en el colegio del barrio y por las tardes ayuda a despachar en la pulpería que administran ambos, no tiene a su cargo hijos ya que están casados y viven dependiente, los planes hacia su familia es mejorar las condiciones de  vida. El desde hace diez años trabaja como comerciante en su casa de habitación, con sus propios esfuerzos a logrado establecer su negocio en una pulpería donde vende variedad de productos, con la solicitud del préstamo quiere comprar granos básicos, y útiles escolares ya que es buena la venta al comienzo del curso del año,  los planes hacia un futuro es lograr incrementar su negocio  para mejor las condiciones del mismo.
texts.en:
Mario Francisco S. V. is 51 years old and lives outside Ticuantepe with his wife who helps him with the household expenses as she has been a teacher at the local high school for the past 20 years. In the evenings she helps to attend to the grocery store which they run together. They have no dependents as their children are now married and live in their own homes. He wants to improve the living conditions of his family. For the past 10 years, he has worked as a shopkeeper in his home, thanks to his hard work he has been able to start his grocery business where he sells a variety of goods. He will use the loan to buy staple foods and school supplies as these sell well at the beginning of the school year. His plan for the future is to increase his business so that he can improve its state.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple foods and school supplies.

SPBD loans are Faaogea’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.name: Edna Fabiola

texts.es:
La señora Edna Fabiola tiene ya mas de 2 años de aplicarse a  su negocio, tiene una pequeña farmacia y también vende artículos escolares.
Su mayor necesidad en este instante es tener más variedad de mercancía y desea vender otros tipos de artículos. La ubicación del local es muy buena, sólo está ese negocio a su alrededor; Por consiguiente tiene mucha demanda.
texts.en:
Edna Fabiola has run her small business for 2 years; she runs a small pharmacy/drug store and also sells school supplies. Her biggest need currently is to offer a greater variety of merchandise and she would like to sell other types of products as well. The location of her business is very good; since there are few businesses around hers, she sees a lot of demand.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.name: Noel

texts.es: Don Noel reside en el barrio 380 en la ciudad de Managua, casado, y con dos hijos de 7 y 12 años de edad, su esposa se dedica a la venta de nacatamales en su casa, también vende refresco para ayudarse con los gastos, los niños cursan la primaria en la escuela del barrio. El Sr. Noel trabaja como taxista desde hace cuatro años a veces las carreras están malas por que la gente no tiene para viajar en taxi y prefieren viajar en ruta, pero otras veces esta bueno aunque cansado y asoleado pero con ganancias , inicio alquilando el taxi para poder obtener ingresos, y con los ahorros compra su propia unidad que ahora es su fuente de ingreso, y a podido salir adelante con los préstamo que Afodenic le  ha otorgado para hacer mejoras a su casa, con esta solicitud de préstamo es la décima y quiere comprar repuesto de vehiculo para cambiar una pieza del carro que tiene en mal estado, y así poder dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes.  Sus metas a futuro es poder cambiar la unidad de taxi para seguir dando su servicio.
texts.en:
Noel lives in the neighbourhood called "380" in Managua. He is married and has two children aged 7 and 12. His wife sells nacatamales (traditional food) from home, as well as refreshments in order to help with the household expenses. The children attend the local elementary school. Noel has been a taxi driver for four years. Sometimes business is bad because people do not have enough money to travel by taxi; but at other times business is good despite being tiring and sunny but profitable. He started by renting the taxi in order to make money and with his savings he was able to buy his own vehicle which is now generating an income. The loans from Afodenic have enabled him to make improvements to his house. This will be his tenth loan so that he can buy spare parts to change the parts of his car which are in poor condition and therefore offer his customers better service. His goal is to change vehicles in order to continue offer his taxi service.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy spare parts for his taxi.

loans.name: Ivania Del Carmen

texts.es: Doña Ivania es una joven luchadora, que se ha esforzado para estudiar, para poder obtener mejores beneficios, ella se desempeña como  Secretaria ejecutiva desde hace dos años en una empresa privada que se llama Detodo.Com., tiene 26 años y habita en Lomas de Memorial Sandino  en la ciudad de Managua, su esposo es albañil y todavía no tiene hijos, pero quiere tener una casa digna para cuando los tenga, con esta solicitud es la tercera que hace en Afodenic pues se ha beneficiado para hacer las mejoras de su cada con este préstamo es la tercera solicitud y va invertir en infraestructura en cambio de del techo, de su cuarto que esta en mal estado, para esto va,  a comprar zinc, golosos, perlin entre otros y así poder estar mas tranquila ya que este invierno pasado tuvo mucha dificultades para relajar su sueño ya que se le mojaba y tenia que estar pendiente. Sus metas es poder seguir estudiando para obtener un cargo mejor donde pueda ganar mejor.
texts.en:
Ivania is a fighter who has worked hard to study so that she can earn more money. She has worked as an executive secretary for the past two years in a private company called Detodo.Com. She is 26 years old and lives in Lomas de Memorial Sandino, in Managua. Her husband is a mason and they do not yet have children, but they want to have a worthy home for when they do. This is her third loan with Afodenic. She has made home improvements with her previous loans. With this loan, she wants to invest in the infrastructure of her home: to replace the roof and to fix her room which is in bad shape. She will buy zinc, beams, purlins and other building materials so that she can have peace of mind as she could not relax this past winter as everything was getting wet and had to be hung to dry. Her goal is to continue her studies so that she can get a better job with better pay.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials to replace her roof.

loans.name: Ivonne Rubi

texts.es:
La señora Ivonne Rubí tiene ya mas de dos años dedicándose a venta de artículos para bebes y juguetes en diferentes partes de la ciudad.
En este negocio se generan los ingresos de su familia ya que tiene tres hijos pequeños, a los cuales adora con toda su alma.
Al negocio le esta haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía pero no cuenta con el capital necesario para la inversión, agradecerá su apoyo.
texts.en:
Ivonne Rubi has worked for 2 years selling toys and products for babies in various parts of her city. The income she earns from her business help to maintain her three small children who she adores with all her heart. Her business needs a greater variety of merchandise but she doesn't have enough capital to invest. She appreciates your support.

texts.es:

La señora D. trabaja en una empresa como cajera, donde vende madera y muebles para el hogar, de este honroso trabajo provienen los ingresos para mantener a su único hijo que esta estudiando.
Solicita el préstamo para comprar el material y pagar la mano de obra del piso cerámico, para poder habitarla dignamente.
texts.en:
Susana's home does not have a ceramic floor and she currently lacks enough money to carry out such a project. She works as a cashier in a company that sells lumber and home furniture. The income from this honorable job provides for her only son who is a student. She requests this loan to purchase materials and pay the laborers to install her ceramic floor in order to live in a more dignified home.

Translated from Spanish by Scott Crandall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Installation of a ceramic tile floor

texts.en: Taiaopo M., 40, is married with 4 children.  She has many years of experience in the plantation business. She sells to the villagers and general public 4 days per week. She has 2 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Taiaopo’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks. Part of her loan will be used for purchasing ingredients to start up a popcorn business.

loans.use: Purchase  wheelbarrow, chain link wires,  fertilizer, etc.

loans.name: Filomena

texts.en: Filomena I., 54, is married with 6 children.  She has many years of experience in making handicrafts. She sells to the hotels and gift shops 6 days per week. She has 3 previous loans with SPBD.  She expects her weekly net cash flow to be 600 Tala (~250 USD).  SPBD loans are Filomena’s only access to capital because she was never able to qualify for a loan with the traditional banks.

loans.use: Purchase tools for carving

loans.name: Tofig

texts.en: Tofig is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Kayidish village, which is built for IDPs. He was born in 1950, and is married with three children. Tofig started his general store business five years ago. He is requesting a loan so he can buy more foodstuff stock and offer more items to his customers. This will increase his income and help him raise his family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuff for a general store

loans.name: Zakir

texts.en: Zakir is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Bahmanli village. He is 50 years old and married with three children. Zakir has ten years of experience in cattle breeding business, and is requesting a loan so he can buy three calves to improve his business and his income.

loans.use: To purchase calves for breeding business

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group requests loans that contains three members.  S. is the leader of the group.  She is 48 years old and living in Battambang province.  

She sells used clothes by transporting to customers' homes.  Another source of income for her is raising pigs to sell.  Normally, S. buys used clothes from the market and sells to her customers to make a profit.  Besides the clothes selling business, she raises pigs from her house from which she can generate extra income for her family.  

Presently, she lives with her husband and three children.  Her husband, 48, works selling clothes with S..  All of her children are in school: one in high school, one in secondary school, and another one in primary school.  

Because her business is going well, S. needs a loan to increase her capital by purchasing more used clothes for selling and use the remaining money to purchase food to fatten her pigs, which she expects to sell for slaughter soon.

The other two members in the group are: 

- Mrs. S. who grows vegetables to sell and also raises pigs.  She needs a loan to purchase food for her pigs

- Mrs. Y. who is a beef seller in the market.  She needs a loan to use for changing her store from a small one to a bigger one.

loans.use: To purchase more used clothes to sell

loans.name: Shahmurad

texts.en: This kind man was born in 1948. He is married, has four children, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fuzuli region of Kurdmahmudlu village. He has been breeding cattle for 10 years and is requesting a loan to buy two calves to increase his business. This will help provide better for his family.

loans.use: To purchase calves for breeding business

loans.name: Tab

texts.en:
Mrs. S. is 32 years old and is the owner of a small restaurant in Battambang province.  She sells food and drinks to the customers and passengers who walk up her restaurant.  She has also built a small hall for customers or passengers to relax. 

S. is a good cook and has run this business with her husband since 2007.  The business is going well because she is a good cook and the restaurant is located in an attractive place. 

She and her husband have two children, both of whom are teenagers and are in school.  

To attract more customers and to purchase some more materials to serve her customers, S. needs a loan to purchase items for the restaurant such as chairs, cooking materials, and other materials to decorate.  

S.'s husband is shown in the photo because she was not available for the photograph.

loans.use: To purchase materials to use in the restaurant

loans.name: Tann's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group of three people who are requesting a loan through Kiva.  Mrs K., 48, is the group leader of two eligible members.  

K. sells porridge in her area of Andongchenh village.  She earns around $2.50 per day while her husband earns $3.20 per day working for a mobile phone company. 

Her business is going well because her area is a crowded place and she sells along a road that passengers can see easily. 

She has five children, one of whom is married.  One single son is employed as a driver and can earn $100 per month.  He also helps support the family. 

To expand her business, K. is requesting a loan to purchase ingredients and repair her store to make it bigger.  

The other two members of the group are: 

- Mrs. C., 51, is a used-clothes seller.  She needs a loan to buy more clothes to sell.
- Mrs. Sinoun, 32, buys and sells recyclables.  She needs a loan to use as capital for purchasing more recyclables.

loans.use: To purchase cooking ingredients and to repair her store and make it bigger

loans.name: Ramiz

texts.en: Ramiz is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, Dilagarda village. He is married, with two children, and he has been in the business of selling clothes for five years. Ramiz was born in 1960. He is requesting a loan to he can increase his inventory and better supply his customers' demands. This will help him better provide for his family.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes to sell in his business

loans.name: Bahruz

texts.en: Bahruz A. is married and has two children. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fuzuli town, and he  is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in Bahmanli village. He was born in 1986. He began his clothes-selling business six years ago, and he is requesting a loan so he can improve his stock and earn more income for his family.

loans.use: To purchase clothes stock for his business

loans.name: Firangiz

texts.en: Firangiz  was born in 1964, is married and has one child. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town, and is now settled in the Fuzuli region, in the Bahmanli village. She has been in the clothes-selling business for five years, and she is requesting a loan so she can improve her business and better provide for her child.

loans.use: To buy clothes stock for her business

loans.name: Maxim

texts.en: Maxim was born in 1971 and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. He is now settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bala Bahmanli village. He is married and has two children. He started his taxi business five years ago and is requesting a loan to buy spare parts for his car so he can keep his taxi running well and not lose any business.
