loans.use: To purchase spare parts for a taxi business

loans.name: Sevindj

texts.en: Sevindj (her husband is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan. Now she is settled in the Fizuli region, in a Bala Bahmanli village. She is the mother of three children, and has been running her dairy business for six years. She is requesting a loan so she can purchase a pregnant cow to expand her business and help raise her family's standard of living.

loans.use: To purchase a pregnant cow for a dairy business

loans.name: Anar

texts.en: Anar is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan,Fuzuli town, now settled in the Fuzuli region, in Yaglivend village. Anar was born in 1981. He is married, has two children. He has been selling foodstuffs for five years and is requesting a loan to purchase more foodstuff stock so he can increase his inventory and his income and better provide for his family.

loans.use: To buy more foodstuffs for a general store

loans.name: Publia

texts.es:
Publia es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Publia es casada, tiene 40 años y 3 hijos, Publia tiene una tienda en un local alquilado ubicado en la Av. Arenales, en donde vende repuestos de carro y también brinda servicios de engrase, para lo cual cuenta con 2 personas que le ayudan. 
Publia necesita un préstamo de 2000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de zapatas, líquidos y grasa.
Los sueños de Publia son ampliar su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Publia is a partner of Banco Comunal Alianza. Publia is married, is 40 years old, with three children. Publia has a store in a rented space located on the Avenue Arenales, in which she sells spare car parts, and also supplies oil servicing, with which two people help her. Publia needs a loan of 200 soles that will be invested in buying brake shoes, fluid, and grease. Publia dreams to increase the size of her business, and that her children will become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Matt Capetola, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy brake shoes, fluids, and grease.

loans.name: Juana Maria

texts.es:
Juana es socia del Banco Comunal Alianza.
Juana es casada, tiene 42 años y 4 hijos, Juana tiene un puesto en el mercado Jesús Nazareno en donD. venD. abarrotes en general, actividad que realiza todos los días con la ayuda D. su hijo.
Juana necesita un préstamo D. 1000 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra D. arroz, azúcar.
Los sueños D. Juana son hacer crecer su negocio y que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Juana is an associate of the Alliance Communal Bank. Juana is married, 42 years old and has 4 children. Juana has a position in the Jesus of Nazareth market where she sells groceries, an activity that she carries out every day with the aid of her son. Juana needs a loan of 1000 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. The dreams of Juana are to grow her business and that her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her grocery business.

loans.name: Flora

texts.es:
Flora es socia del Banco Comunal Trébol.
Flora es casada, tiene 49 años y 3 hijos, Flora tiene una bodega en su casa ubicada en el distrito de Jesús Nazareno, en donde vende abarrotes, verduras, frutas, actividad que realiza todos los días por las mañanas y por las tardes trabaja en un colegio como docente.
Flora necesita un préstamo de 750 soles dinero que será invertido en la compra de arroz y azúcar.
Flora sueña con mejorar su negocio, su hijos culmine sus estudios y sea profesional.
texts.en:
Flora is an associate of the Cloverleaf Communal Bank. Flora is married, 49 years old and has 3 children. Flora has a convenience store in her house located in the Jesus of Nazareth district, where she sells groceries, vegetables, and fruits, an activity that she carries out every day in the mornings. In the afternoons she works in a school as a teacher. Flora needs a loan of 750 soles, money that will be invested in the purchase of rice and sugar. Flora dreams of improving her business and that her children finish their studies and become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy rice and sugar for her grocery business.

loans.name: Isabel Del Pilar

texts.es:
La señora Isabel del Pilar vive en la ciudad de León donde se desempeña en su negocio de venta de frutas como lo son las manzanas y también verduras ubicada en el mercado la estación donde día a día comercializa estos perecederos con el propósito de llevar el sustento a su casa de habitación compuesta por sus hijos.

El motivo por el cual la señora Isabel ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel es para solicitar un crédito para dar lugar a la compra de los perecederos como lo son las frutas y verduras. Es por esto que espera que su crédito sea otorgado con rapidez para dar lugar a dicha compra.
texts.en:
Señora Isabel del Pilar lives in the city of León where she operates her business selling fruits such as apples and also vegetables located in the station market, where day by day she markets these perishables for the purpose of earning a living for her household of composed of her children. The reason that señora Isabel has sought the support of Ceprodel is to request a loan to purchase perishables such as fruits and vegetables. It is for this that she hopes that her loan will be authorized quickly to make possible said purchase.

Translated from Spanish by Barbara (B) Brown, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fruits and vegetables for resale.

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
En el Mercado La estación en la ciudad de León, la señora María R. se dedica a su actividad de venta de ropa usada comercializada en su propio tramo el cual abre desde muy tempranas horas de la mañana para atender a sus clientes.

Es de importancia destacar que su tramo se encuentra en el sector de venta de ropas en el Mercado por lo que debe de ser muy sabia para la venta por lo que tiene muchos competidores que también ofrecen la misma mercadería.
Por esta sencilla razón es que ella ha solicitado un crédito en Ceprodel para surtir su negocio de mas ropa y así brindándole mayores opciones a sus clientes para comprar el producto.
texts.en:
Mrs. María R. works selling used clothing in the La Estación Market in the city of León. The section where she works opens very early in the morning to attend to the customers. It is very important to point out that María is in the section of the market where used clothing is sold, and one must be very wise about sales in this section because there are a lot of competitors who also sell the same merchandise. For this simple reason, she is requesting this loan from Kiva partner Ceprodel, so she can better stock her business with clothing. This way, she will be able to give her customers more options of products they can buy.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy used clothing

loans.name: Karla Martina

texts.es:
La venta de ropa usada en todo momento requiere de inversión para evitar que los clientes decidan realizar sus compras en otro establecimiento. En el mercado La Estación de la ciudad de León, la señora Karla A. atraviesa la necesidad de adquirir la ropa para comercializarla y lo que requiere es la compra de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños.

Para esto, ella ha buscado el apoyo en Ceprodel ya que actualmente no posee ingresos pero al tener el crédito comprará la ropa y luego con estos ingresos pagará el préstamo. Es por esta razón que con urgencia espera ser beneficiada y salir adelante en su negocio de venta de ropa.
texts.en:
The sale of used clothing always requires an investment to prevent customers from going elsewhere to purchase clothing. In the La Estación Market in the city of León, Mrs. Karla A. has come upon a need to buy used clothing which she will resell. She needs to buy clothing for men, women and children. For this reason she has asked Kiva partner Ceprodel for help, as she currently has no income. When she receives the loan, she will buy the clothing and then with the income she earns, she will repay the loan. Because of this she urgently awaits your assistance so she can move forward with her clothing business.

Translated from Spanish by Laura Westin, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy clothing

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
En la ciudad de León, específicamente en el Mercado La Estación, la señora María A. se desempeña en su negocio de elaboración y venta de refrescos naturales preparados por ella misma. También se ha destacado por vender gaseosas, jugos enlatados y agua helada. Es importante también destacar que ella vende ropa pero en menores cantidades.

Hoy en día, ella tiene la necesidad urgente de adquirir las frutas para elaborar los refrescos y también de comprar los jugos y gaseosas. Para ello ha realizado una solicitud en Ceprodel para ser beneficiada con un préstamo con el cual, al adquirirlo realizará dichas compras y luego ofrecerá estos productos en su establecimiento en el mercado.
texts.en:
At La Estación market in the city of León, María A. sells natural beverages, which she makes herself. She is also know for selling carbonated drinks, canned juice, and iced water. It is important to note that she sells clothing in small quantities. At present, María has an urgent need to obtain fruit for making the drinks and to also buy juices and carbonated drinks. To do so she has applied to Ceprodel for a loan to make those purchases, which she will then offer for sale in her shop at the market.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of ingredients for making beverages

loans.name: Merwais

texts.en:
Merwais is a shopkeeper. He has a retail shop where he works together with his father. Now he wants to open another shop where he can work alone and start a new business. He has a good number of customers in the area where his shop is located. He would love to grow his business more.

Merwais has requested an individual loan to complete his stock and buy more goods to sell retail like baskets, shampoo, and other necessary things for his shop. He is sure that he can further his business and repay the loan.

Merwais is very happy about this loan and he hopes that he will become stronger in his business to become one of the great business dealers in the future.

loans.use: To buy oil, flour and complete his stock

loans.name: Fati

texts.en:
Fati K. lives in Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana with her 3 children, two girls and a boy. They all attend basic school.

Fati is a baker and bakes bread in a local oven in her house. She distributes a high percentage of bread to wholesalers in her community every morning and sells the remaining bread by hawking to houses. Fati buys her raw materials such as flour, sugar, margarine, etc in Kumasi, a town in Southern central Ghana. She has been in business for over eight years. She's 43 years old and divorced. She doesn't receive any help for providing for her children and this has not been easy for her. 

She wants a loan  of $400 to buy raw materials in bulk so she can supply to more customers and thereby, increase her profit margin. It is her desire to sponsor her children to make it to the tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy raw baking materials in bulk

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en: Comfort M. sells rubber and plastic products in local markets. She owns a shop selling rubber buckets, cups, spoons, bowls, plates and other items and sells them in the market square.She buys most of her products in the town of Kumasi in South central Ghana and has been in business for six years.  She is 52 years old and married with four children. The first born has completed school and her other 3 children are in high school. Comfort lives with two of her children and husband in a town called Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana. Her husband works with the high way authority in Mampong in the Ashanti Region. She wants a loan to buy rubber products on a larger scale so she can trek to other markets to do business and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy rubber producets, such as buckets and bowls in bulk

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa A. sells glass and rubber/plastic products such as plates, cups, bowl, etc and sells them in a shop in the market square. She has been in business for twelve years. Yaa procures her goods from Kumasi in the South central region of Ghana. 

She is 35 years old and divorced with two girls, who attend basic school. A slight misunderstanding between her and her husband resulted in their break up. She lives with her children in Bibiani, a town in the Western Region.Yaa pays and provides for school fees, accommodation, food and every need of the family. 

She wants a loan to buy goods on a large scale. It is her dream to make more more money so she can pay for her girls school and help them pursue tertiary education.

loans.use: To buy glass and rubber/plastic products

loans.name: Martha

texts.en:
Martha B. sells eggs in crates. She buys from poultry farmers in nearby villages and sells to beverage and food vendors in her community. In addition to her egg business, she also buys cereals such as beans, groundnut, etc to sell. She has been in business for six years. 

Martha is fifty-one years old and divorced with five children; three boys and two girls. They are all at different levels of their education from basic school to completing tertiary education. Martha and her children live in Bibiani in the Western Region of Ghana. She says her ex-husband does not help in any way with their children’s upbringing. This has not been easy for her but she works very hard to meet her children's needs. 

She wants a loan to procure eggs in bulk so she can supply to more customers and increase her profit margin. It is her desire to help all her children make it to tertiary level of education.

loans.use: To buy more crates of eggs to sell in the markets

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia A. sells cooking oil and vegetables such as tomatoes, pepper, onions, etc on a small table top in the local market square.  She buys most of her vegetables from farmers in her community to resell. Lydia travels to the city to procure the rest of her goods. She has been in business for ten years.

Lydia is 48 years old, married with two sons. The first has completed university and the other is in junior high school. Her husband is a head teacher in one of the basic schools in their community. She works hard to support her husband and take care of the family.

She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk. Lydia's desire is to increase her profit margin so she can own a kiosk to sell her products.

loans.use: To buy vegetables and cooking oil

loans.name: Virginie

texts.en:
Greetings from Virginie M. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Virginie is a widow of 55 years old with 4 children and raising 1 orphan.

This entrepreneur sells milk but her day starts as early as 5 am when she has to go board a taxi to go to buy milk for her clients. She transports it on a rental truck to her business area.

Virginie is requesting a loan worth 515 000 Rwf to buy more material such as a refrigerator, chairs and also to increase the quantity of milk she can buy. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

This entrepreneur appreciates the service given to her by Vision Finance Company s.a and she is ready to use the loan successfully and repay it according to VFC credit policies.

loans.use: Increase the quantity of milk she can buy and outfit her shop

loans.name: Phanuel

texts.en:
Muraho ("Hello”) from Phanuel M. in Buliza, Gasabo district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Phanuel is 28 years old and still single.

Phanuel operates a small video library and he also provides various sound material for rent, earning about  US$ 195 per month.

This entrepreneur is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf. This loan will be used to buy more materials for his business and will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: buying more materials for his business

loans.name: Eric

texts.en:
Greetings from Eric H. in Kanombe sector, Kicukiro district, Kigali, capital of Rwanda! Eric is 25 years old.

This entrepreneur started his business 5 years ago. He sells used shoes and he has a lot of customers in town and up country. Eric is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

Eric believes that once he gets this loan, his profit will increase.

loans.use: Expand his used shoe business

loans.name: Marie Louise

texts.en:
Greetings from Marie Louise I. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Marie Louise is 28 years old and the mother of 2 kids. She started her business 3 years ago.

Marie Louise owns a hardware shop where she sells electric bulbs, paint, building nails, iron sheets for roofing, locks, and cement. She employs 3 people in this business.

She is requesting a loan worth 500,000 Rwf, which will be repaid in eight months. This loan will help her to expand her business, and she now understands how good it is to work with us, especially with KIVA.

loans.use: Expand her little hardware business

loans.name: Annonciate

texts.en:
Greetings from Annonciate M. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Annonciate is 29 years old and still single.

This entrepreneur owns a tailor workshop where she makes various women's clothes for people in the area. She also makes school uniforms for primary students. She has 5 sewing machines and employs 2 people in the workshop. She earns about US$ 210 from the sewing workshop.

Annonciate is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Frws to buy more sewing materials for her workshop. This loan will be repaid in 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: buying more sewing materials for her workshop

loans.name: Cheom

texts.en:
Mrs. Cheom B. is a villager in Tuol Vihear village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Ve Soy, are rice farmers who make a little revenue to support the family. Mrs. Cheom B. is 36 years old and the mother of six children; one is employed in a garment factory, four other children are attending the local school, and the youngest one is just 4 years old.

In addition to the rice plantation, they sell palm sugar in the local village. This business is going well, so they want to expand it. Mrs. Cheom B. is requesting a loan to buy palm sugar to resell.

loans.use: Buy palm sugar to resell.

loans.name: Sarom

texts.en:
Mrs. Sarom C. is a farmer in Prey Torteung village in Kampong Speu province. Her husband, Mr. Chin Voeun, helps her on the rice plantation. Although they try to work hard on the plantation, they still earn only a little revenue to support the family.

Mrs. Sarom C. is 53 years old and the mother of three children; two are employed in a garment factory, and the youngest one is attending the local school. In order to provide better conditions for the family, Mrs. Sarom C. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Poeun

texts.en:
Mrs. Poeun M. lives in the Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who owns a small plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. She is a 59-year-old widow with a child who is attending the local school.

This family has only the income from their rice business, so they cannot provide a better life for the family. Thus, Mrs. Poeun M. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Sreiny

texts.en:
Mrs. Sreiny V. was born in 1982 and she now lives in Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a garment factory worker who earns a small salary to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Muy Reourn, is a construction worker, who also earns a small income to support the family.

Although they try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sreiny V. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start breeding business to improve living conditions

loans.name: Sokvang

texts.en:
Mrs. Sokvang H. lives in Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province. She is a farmer who has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Moang Meng, is a construction worker who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Sokvang H. is 38 years old and the mother of four children who are all attending the local school.

Although they try to work hard, they still cannot provide a better life for the family. In order to improve their living conditions, Mrs. Sokvang H. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business. She hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business

loans.name: Rim

texts.en:
Mrs. Rim K. is 50 years old, and now lives in Kanthorm village in Kampong Speu province with her husband and two children. Her children are employed in a garment factory. She has a plot of land on which she cultivates rice to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. Suk San, is a construction worker.

Even though Mrs. Rim K. and her husband try to work hard, they still earn less income than they need to support the family. In order to provide better living conditions, Mrs. Rim K. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business to improve living conditions

loans.name: Hom

texts.en:
Mr. Hom K. lives in the Kunlaing village in Kampong Speu province. He is a farmer who cultivates rice on a small plot of land. His wife, Mrs. Uch Chanthou, helps him on the plantation. Mr. Hom K. is 40 years old and the father of three children; one is working in a garment factory, and the others are attending the local school.

On the farm, it is the harvesting season and he has difficulty transporting the harvested rice from the field to his house. Thus, Mr. Hom K. is requesting a loan to buy a cart, which will be carried by an electric cow, in order to transport the rice revenue.

loans.use: Buy a cart to transport rice from the field to the house

loans.name: Phath

texts.en:
Mrs. Phat B. lives in the Tuol Vihea village in Kampong Speu province. She and her husband, Mr. Sophea Phon, are farmers. Mrs. Phat B. is 31 years old and the mother of four children; two are attending the local school, and the others are 1 and 5 years old.

Although they try to work hard, they still cannot support the family well. In order to provide a better life for the family, Mrs. Phat B. is requesting a loan to buy a cow to start a breeding business and she hopes to increase her income when she sells the cow.

loans.use: Buy a cow to start a breeding business to improve living conditions

loans.name: It

texts.en:
It T. N. is 32 years old and lives in Kompong Cham province where she earns a living as a local cultivator.  She grows potatoes as well as rice crops, and began her business in 2000. 

She is married with four children, all of whom are single and also attend school.  Her husband's name Khan Kha and he is 32 years old.  He is a used-good seller who purchases from villagers using his motorcycle for transportation, and later sells the goods for a profit.  He currently earns approximately $3 per day T. cover his family's living expenses. 

T. grow the business and earn additional income, It T. Nat has requested a loan T. pay for harvesting her potatoes, as well as for her husband T. enlarge his business.

It T. Nat's husband is pictured because she was not available.

loans.use: To pay for harvesting her potatoes

loans.name: Hun

texts.en:
Hun Y. started her business a long time ago.  She is a grocery seller.  She is 45 years old and a widow who has two children, both of whom are single and are living in the family home.  Her first child assists her in the business and her second child is attending school. 

She currently sells her items, such as cooking ingredients and sweets for kids, to the villagers.  She is a sacrificing woman and is working hard to meet both her children's needs. 

Y. requested a loan of $100 to purchase grocery inventory to sell, and zinc to roof her old house.  The loan will improve her family's standard of living.  

Hun Y. is a person living in a rural area of Kompong Tom province.

loans.use: To purchase grocery inventory to sell

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Long P. earns a living as a local used-clothes seller.  She was born in 1952 and is a widow who is currently living in Kompong Tom province.  She has been selling used-clothes for more than three years, and is earning an average of $2 each day. 

She has two children; both of them are married and are employed as fish sellers.  Two of her cousins are living with her and are working as rice farmers. 

Long P. works hard every day at her small business and has a lot of regular customers who recognize the good clothes she provides.  Recently, she has been selling all her clothes in a store.  Hence, she seeks a loan to buy more second-hand clothes to sell.

loans.use: To buy more second-hand clothes to sell

loans.name: Le Thi Loi Group

texts.vi:
Lê Thị lợi sinh năm 1962(Mã số: 010117090035). Chị làm nông nghiệp, chăn nuôi lợn và đi chợ. Chồng chị H. ngày đi làm T.ê. Vợ chồng chị có 4 người con( hai con lớn đi làm T.ê, hai đứa con nhỏ còn đang đi học). T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 250.000 đến 300.000 vnđ/ngày. Gia đình chị tham gia vay vốn ở mức vay: 5.450.000 vnđ với mục đích mở rộng chăn nuôi. Chị là nhóm trưởng nhóm vay gồm có:
 Ngô Văn G. sinh năm 1986(Mã số: 010117090036 ), làm công nhân tại khu công nghiệp. Anh đang sống cùng gia đình bố mẹ đều có T. nhập ổn định. Bố anh làm công nhân, mẹ bán H. ăn sang, T. nhập bình quân của gia đình khoảng 300.000 vnđ /tuần. Anh vay mức vốn: 5.014.000 vnđ để đầu tư chăn nuôi.
 Trịnh Thị Luyến sinh năm 1969(Mã số: 010117090037 ) làm nghề bán H. quần áo, chồng làm T.ê và làm nông nghiệp. Vợ chồng chị có hai con đang độ tuổi đi học. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vnđ/tuần. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.706.000 vnđ để có vốn đi chợ.
 Đỗ Thị Lục sinh năm 1962(Mã số: 010117090038 ), làm nông nghiệp, hai con chị đã đi làm. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng250.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.706.000 vnđ với mục đích chăn nuôi.
 Nguyễn Thị Cập sinh năm 1972(Mã số: 010117090039 ), làm nông nghiệp và đi chợ. Vợ chông chị có 4 người con. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 250.000 vnđ. Chị vay mức vốn: 5.014.000 vnđ với mục đích đầu tư và mở rộng chăn nuôi.
 Nguyễn Thị Gái sinh năm 1969(Mã số: 010117090040). Ngoài làm nông nghiệp chị còn đi chợ. Chồng chị làm thợ xây, hai con còn nhỏ đang độ tuổi đi học. T. nhập bình quân quân của gia đình khoảng 250.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị vay mức vốn:3.706.000 vnđ với mục đích đi chợ và chăn nuôi.
 Lê Thị T. Hằng sinh năm 1971(Mã số: 010117090041 ), làm nghề bán H. ăn sang, chồng chị làm T.ê, hai con đang độ tuổi đi học. T. nhập bình quân của gia đình chị khoảng 300.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị vay mức vốn: 4.578.000 vnđ với mục đích tăng vốn bán H..
 Nguyễn Quốc T. sinh năm 1985 (Mã số: 010117090041) làm ngề bán H. quần áo, T. nhập bình quân khoảng 300.000 vnđ/ngày. Chị vay mức vốn: 3.706.000 vnđ để đầu tư cửa H. ban quần áo.

loans.use: raising animals

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor H. is 43 years old and resides in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  She earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house.  She raises them for their offspring and for slaughter.  She has been running her business for more than five years and is currently earning approximately $2 each day. 

She has four children, all of whom are single and are living in the family home.  Three of her children attend school and one of her sons is employed as a rice harvester.  Her husband is a wood carving seller and he earns an average of $5 a day to help meet with the family's food needs. 

Lor H. is applying for a loan as capital to purchase more piglets to raise, as well as buffalo to raise and sell.

loans.use: To purchase more piglets and buffalo to raise

loans.name: Lor

texts.en:
Lor H. is 48 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province.  She earns a living by raising pigs in a stall next to her house.  

She will raise two lots of pigs per year and sell them to the slaughterer every six months.  She has been earning an income of approximately $2 a day since 2003. 

She is married with three children, all of whom are single.  Her eldest son works as a wood carving seller and her other two children are students.  Her husband is also a wood carving cutter and sells the carvings from his home. 

To expand the business and earn more revenue, H. is applying for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise and to decorate her old house.  The loan will make her family's living conditions comfortable.

loans.use: To buy additional piglets to raise

loans.name: Pon

texts.en:
Pon Y. is 28 years old and a resident of the Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  She makes a living raising pigs, which she sells for slaughter in four months time after raising them.  She has been raising pigs for about a year and is currently earning around $2 a day. 

Y. is married with three children, two of whom are married while the other one is single and also goes to school.  She is married to Mao Mon who is 29 years old.  He sells wood carvings by cutting the wood from the forest. 

Y. is applying for a loan as capital to allow her husband to purchase a buffalo to connect with a cart to serve as his wood carving transportation.

loans.use: To purchase a buffalo connect with a cart as transportation

loans.name: Pol

texts.en:
Pol K. is 33 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom province where she owns and runs a pigpen for raising pigs behind her house.  

She normally sells all her pigs for slaughter in six months time after she begins raising them.  She can raise at least two pigs per year.  K. has been running this business since 1993 and is currently earning $8 a day.  

She is responsible for her two children; both of whom are teenagers and go to school.  Her husband, Mr. Sao Sreng, 33, sells wood carvings for a profit. 

To purchase additional pigs to raise, Pol K. requested a loan as capital.  This will help her to save and buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: To buy more piglets for raising

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum V., 34, is employed as a construction worker in his community and lives in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  

He is married to Chum Mony, aged 36.  She raise pigs from their home and grows vegetables in a plot of her farmland.  She normally earns the money to support her family's food needs, so she works very hard everyday.  

She is a good mother of two children; both of whom are still young and attend school.  

To begin a new investment and earn additional income, Chum V. has requested a loan as capital to add to his savings to purchase a rice mill machine to provide this service for rice farming.

loans.use: To purchase a rice mill machine

loans.name: Huot

texts.en:
Huot R., 51, lives in Kompong Tom province, Cambodia where she has owned a plot of land since 1979.  She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. 

She is a good mother of seven childR.: four are single and three are married and live away from home.  To help meet a little more of the family's needs, three of her childR. are employed as wood carving sellers.  She is married to Sok Phan, age 52, who also sells wood carvings that depend on carving from the forest. 

In view of the fact that rice growing is R.'s main source of income to sustain her family’s living conditions, and in order to help her meet the hard physical labor demands of farming work, Huot R. is applying for a loan to buy two cows to use for plowing the fields and also to raise for their offspring.

loans.use: To buy two cows to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Abdulatif

texts.en: Abdulatif is a 35 year old married man with 3 small children, living in Jalala in the Bekaa valley. Abdulatif has owned a photography studio for 3 years. He has had a passion for taking pictures ever since he was a young man. Today, he wants to request a loan in order to buy a new camera, along with filters, for better quality pictures.

loans.use: To buy a new camera and filters

loans.name: Im

texts.en:
Im S. is 28 years old and a resident of Kompong Tom province, Cambodia.  He sells wood carvings that he carves from the forest and transports to sell to villagers in his community.  He currently earns the money around of $4 per day.

He is married to Chok Phoeun, who is a good housewife and the mother of five children; two of them are single and three are married.  Two of her children are employed: one is a wood carving seller and another one is a rice harvesting worker as well as a rice mill worker.  

S. and his family are facing difficulty with their old house because it is not so good and is small for them.  Thus, they decided to ask for a loan to purchase equipment to repair their old house.  The loan will make the family's living conditions comfortable.

loans.use: To purchase equipment to repair their old house

loans.name: Mohammad Nzer

texts.en:
M. Nzer lives in Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with 7 children, and has a general store. He would like to make his business larger and stronger by adding more stock to his store.

He has requested a loan to expand and develop his business by buying the necessary materials to complete his stock in his shop. 

He is very happy to have the opportunity of a loan in Afghanistan, because it will provide a chance for poor entrepreneurs like him to expand their businesses.

loans.use: To expand and develop his buisness

loans.name: Mrs. Touch Ven Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan includes twenty people in the Liek village in Kandal province. Mrs. Touch V. is a village bank president, who was selected by the members of the group loan. Mrs. Touch V. is 47 years old and the mother of three children, who all attend the local school. Her husband, Mr. S. Phon, is a farmer who owns 0.6-hectare on which he cultivates rice to earn a living.

Mrs. Touch V. is a tailor in the local village. This business is going well, so she wants to expand it. She is requesting a loan to buy more cloth to make dresses for her customers.

loans.use: Buy more cloth to make dresses for her customers

loans.name: Sayad Abas

texts.en:
Sayad Abas is 22 years old. He lives in district 16 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is single and he has a little restaurant in Kabul. He needs a small loan for his business because he wants to make  his restaurant bigger and make good income for his family.

So he has requested an individual loan of 50,000 Afghani for a term of 11 months and he wants to expand and further his business and buy new tables and chairs for his restaurant to attract more customers and become a good entrepreneur in future.

He is very happy with this process of small loans that helps poor people in Afghanistan. He wants to thank all Kiva lenders.

loans.use: and buy new tables and chairs for his restaurant

loans.name: Mrs. Sophann Phon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Sixteen members, who live in the Liek village in Kandal province, make up the village bank loan. They plan to use the loan for different purposes. Mrs. Sophann P. is the village bank president. Her husband, Mr. San Sambath, is a farmer who has 0.2-hectare to cultivate rice. Mrs. Sophann P. is 46 years old and the mother of two children; one is a construction worker, and the other attends the local school.

Mrs. Sophann P. owns a small store where she sells groceries. This business is going well, so she wants to expand the business. She is requesting a loan to buy more groceries to increase her inventoR..

loans.use: Buy more grocery products for the inventory in her store

loans.name: Soun

texts.en:
Mrs. Soun R. is 45 years old and her husband is 50.  They reside in Kompong Cham province where they own a plot of farmland to grow a rice crop.  

They can run rice crops twice per year, including the dry season and the raining season.  They have been earning an income of approximately $2 per day since 1985. 

The couple has five children; four of them are single and one is married.  To help meet the family's expenses, two of their daughters are working as garment workers in Phnom Penh city.  

The dry season is coming.  Ran and her husband need the money to do rice this season.  Thus, they would like to request a loan of $200 as capital to pay for other expenses in rice crop growing.

loans.use: To pay for other expenses in rice crop growing

loans.name: Yeng

texts.en:
Yeng S. K., 45, is married and currently lives in Prey Chor, Kampong Cham province about 120 miles southeast of the capital, Phnom Penh, with her husband, two of her children, and her elderly mother. She and her husband Chhum Seang Hean, 58, together work their rice field and raise fish to earn a living and are able to make a combined amount of around US$ 5 a day. Besides doing this work, her husband is a government teacher in the village. He has been teaching since 1980.

Yeng would like to take out a loan of US$ 1000 to help open a mechanics shop for one of her sons who lives outside the family home. This son is already married and currently is about to start up a garage but needs capital to run this business.

loans.use: To allow her son, a mechanic, to open a garage

loans.name: Mrs. Sothim Poa Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan includes twenty-one people in Liek village in Kandal province. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Sothim P. is a village bank president and she is a farmer. She cultivates rice on 0.3-hectare field to earn a living. Her husband, Mr. SoV. Nheb, is a construction worker. In this business, he now faces a problem because he does not have enough construction equipment for his business. So Mrs. Sothim P. is requesting a loan to buy all kinds of construction equipment for her husband's business.

Mrs. Sothim P. is 43 years old and the mother of three children; two are employed in a garment factory, and one attends the local school. Mrs. Chan Mean, who is a group guarantee, is also pictured with the group members.

loans.use: Buy all kinds of construction equipment for construction business

loans.name: Amanallah

texts.en:
Amanallah is the son of Meerzaman. He lives in district 12 of Kabul, Afghanistan. He is married with two children and he needs a small loan for his business because he wants to make his shop larger. He sells cloth.

So he is requesting an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 11 months and he wants to expand and further his shop and to complete the necessary materials for his shop.            

He is very happy with this process of small loans in Afghanistan that helps poor people. He thanks all lenders of AFSG and Kiva.

loans.use: he wants to expand and further his shop

loans.name: Julienne

texts.en:
Umwaka mushya muhire! (Happy new year) from Julienne N. in Nyarugenge District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda. Julienne is 32 years old, married with 4 children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop in her local area. She sells household materials such as soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, Colgate, paraffin, biscuits etc. From all her business activities, she earns about US$ 85 per month.

Julienne is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf which will help her to expand her business. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: Expanding her  little general store

loans.name: Kut

texts.en:
Kut T., 38, pictured with her husband above, is a housewife who stays at home, looking after children and cooking for them. She owns a plot of land where she grows rice but her crop is just enough for her family members. Her husband, Thul Peng, 45, has a business selling banana ice-cream and makes US$ 7 a day. This couple together has six children, four of whom are employed and help bear the cost of living for the family as well. Two children are students.

Mrs. Kut T. is asking for a loan of US$ 600 to purchase a motorbike for her husband to transport ice-cream for sale.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her husband's business

loans.name: Kroch

texts.en:
Mrs. Y. is 57 years old and earns income selling groceries from her house in Angkanh Village, Pursat Province. She sells a large variety of products, such as cakes, food ingredients, vegetables, and meat. Mrs. Y.'s business is going well, because she is friendly and has good communication skills. She started her business in 2003 and currently can earn around US$2.5 per day. Mrs. Y.'s husband is a rice farmer, and the couple has one child who is a teenager and studies at a secondary school. 

Because the sales business is one of the main income sources for Mrs. Y.'s family, she would like to request a loan to purchase additional grocery products for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of grocery products for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Noun Neang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Thirteen people who live in Chumrov village in Takeo province formed the village bank loan. All the members plan to use their loans for different purposes. Mrs. Noun N. was selected by the members as the village bank president. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Nuon Touch, is a construction worker who earns a little income to support the family. Mrs. Noun N. is 35 years old and the mother of four children, who are all enrolled in the local school.

Mrs. Noun N. now has a lot of customers who have many needs. In order to meet these demands, Mrs. Noun N. is requesting a loan to buy more silk to weave. She hopes to increase her income and improve her living conditions with this new loan.

loans.use: Buy more silk to weave to meet the needs of her customers

loans.name: Jean

texts.en:
Muraho (hello) from Jean N. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean is 33 years old and married with 1 child.

This entrepreneur has been a taxi driver for two years and a half but what is amazing is that he has got his own car that he is using as a taxi.

Jean is requesting a loan worth 515 000 rwf, which will help him to replace some spare parts for his taxi. He will be paying back this loan over 8 months on a monthly basis.

loans.use: having some spare parts replaced

loans.name: Mut

texts.en:
Mut K., 42, pictured with her husband above, is married and lives in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham, Cambodia. She is a farmer who typically makes about US$ 2 a day. She grows rice two times a year. Her husband works collecting palm juice and refines it into sugar palm. On average, he makes US$ 3 a day. This couple together has four children, three of whom are students. One is too young to attend school.

Mrs. Mut K. would like to take out a loan of US$ 700 to purchase wood and more tools for her husband so he can make more sugar palm.

loans.use: To purchase wood and more tools for palm juice tapping

loans.name: Toem

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is 54 years old, widowed, and has two children, one of whom is married, while the other one is single and still lives at home. Mrs. N. earns income selling groceries at a local market. She sells a variety of products, including vegetables, various food ingredients, shampoo, perfume, and other home products.
The business is going well and provides the largest share of the family's income. With the growing demand for her goods, Mrs. N. would like to expand her business, and therefore needs a loan to purchase additional groceries for sale.

loans.use: Purchase of groceries for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Khema Nhoem Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Khema N. is the president of a village bank of eleven people. All of the village bank members live in Chumrov village in Takeo province. Each member plans to use their part of the loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Khema N. is requesting a loan to buy more silk for her silk-weaving business. Her business is doing well, and she hopes to increase her income and to provide better livings conditions for her family. 

She is a 42-year-old widow with three children. One of her children helps her in her current business. The others attend the local school.

loans.use: To buy more silk to weave for her customers.

loans.name: Pin

texts.en:
Pin L., 39, is married and lives with five of her children and her husband in Prey Chor, Kampong Cham province. Since 2006, she has been selling various kinds of vegetables in a busy market to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day, while her husband who is a police officer makes US$ 2 a day.

This couple also gets support from three of their children who work as garment factory workers. Mrs. Pin L. is asking a loan of US$ 800 to purchase rice for re-sale.

loans.use: To purchase rice for re-sale

loans.name: Malak

texts.en: Malak was born in 1975. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in Fuzuli region, Yaglivend village. She has been in the business of running a general store for 3 years. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy goods to improve her business.

loans.use: to buy goods for her store

loans.name: Mrs. Phally Eang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank, which consists of fifteen people, is located in Chumrov Village in Takeo Province. Mrs. Phally E. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a silk weaver in the local village. Since she now has a lot of consumer demand, she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more silk to process into dresses for her customers.  

Her husband, Mr.Cheng Dy, is a famer who owns a 1.5-hectare plot of land and cultivates rice to earn a living. In addition to his farm, he is a driver who earns a small income to support the family. Mrs. Phally E. is 41 years old and the mother of four children who attend the local school. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term (EoT) loans. Five members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay aN. principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make payments maN. months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more silk to process into a dresses for her customers.

loans.name: Vorn

texts.en: Mrs. D., 30, earns income farming rice and raising pigs for sale. Her husband helps her in rice farming, the family's main source of income. Mrs. D. has two children who are teenagers and attend primary school. To improve her rice farming business and increase the family's income, Mrs. D. needs a loan to purchase a pump.

loans.use: Purchase of a pump to water a rice field

loans.name: Va

texts.en: Va T., 24, is a farmer who lives with her husband and her child. Living in Prey Veng, she is typically makes US$ 2 a day and is aided in supporting the family by her husband who works as a car driver. On average, he makes US$ 5 a day. To make additional money to help support the family, she is asking for a loan of US$ 500 to open a grocery business.

loans.use: To open a grocery business

loans.name: Mrs. Ny Touch Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Ny T. is the president of a village bank. The bank consists of sixteen people who live in Chumrov Village in Takeo Province. Each of the members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Ny T. is requesting a loan to buy silk to weave. Her business is going well. Her husband, Mr. Seing Vin, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Ny T. is 42 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children attend the local school. The other two are ages six months and three years old.

loans.use: To buy silk to weave for her customers.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en:
Phan T. is 37 years old and sells fruit in Kampong Cham province. Her business has been around for about four years and she makes US$ 3 every day. Her husband, Hum Ith, 35, is a construction worker and makes US$ 4.50 a day. This couple together has three young children, two of whom are students. One is too young to attend school.

Phan T. would like to invest US$ 500 in her own fruit business, increasing her stock of fruit to sell. She sees this investment as an opportunity that will be able to increase her daily income.

loans.use: To invest in her fruit store

loans.name: Sokha

texts.en: Mrs. Sokha B. is a villager in Tie Prambiey Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells rice soup to the people in the local village. In addition to this business, she also sells grocery products in the restaurant. Since her second business is going well, she wants to expand, so she has decided to ask for a loan to buy more groceries for her inventory. Her husband, Mr. Phal Hean, helps her with her businesses. Mrs. Sokha B. is 43 years old.

loans.use: To buy more groceries for her inventory.

loans.name: Seng

texts.en:
Seng S., 30, is a teacher and lives in Prey Veng province. He typically makes around US$ 6 a day, while his wife, Sok Vanna, 28, has a business selling clothes in a busy market. On average, she makes US$ 4 a day. This couple together has three young children, one of whom is enrolled in school.

Sok Vanna is asking for a loan of US$ 1000 to expand her clothing inventory to meet her customers’ demand.

loans.use: To add clothing inventory

loans.name: Im's Group
loans.use: Purchase of a piece of land

loans.name: Sophall's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sophall N. is the leader of a group of four people who live in Tropeang Srongae Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. Each of the group members will use their loan for a different purpose. 

Mrs. Sophall N. is requesting for a loan to buy groceries for her inventory. Her business is going well. Her husband, Mr. Neth Sareth, is a breeder who raises 30 chickens for a living. Mrs. Sophall N. is 39 years old and the mother of two children who attend the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy groceries

loans.name: Houn

texts.en:
Mrs. H., 34, earns income growing rice crops and raising pigs for sale in Rumlich Village, Pursat Province. She lives with her husband and two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend primary school. Mrs. H.'s rice farming business is the family's main source of income. Both she and her husband work hard every day. 
The family's house is old, and Mrs. H. would like to build a new one. She managed to save money and buy some of the necessary wood for building the house. However, she needs a loan to be able to purchase wood to finish the building.

loans.use: Purchase of wood to build a house

loans.name: Naing

texts.en: Naing K. is 29 years old and resides in Pursat Province. She makes a living growing rice crops. In addition, Naing is also a housewife and takes care of her two children, both of whom are still young and attend school. She is married to Eang Vanna, 39, who helps her in the farming business and earns additional income catching fish from different lakes in the area for sale in the market. He currently earns approximately US$4 a day, which helps the family to pay for food and the children's school fees. Mrs. K. would like to take out a loan to be able to purchase a second-hand motorcycle for her husband to use in his business and for the family's own transportation needs.

loans.use: Purchase of a second-hand motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Lim Soeurng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of fifteen people who live in Tang Krong Village in Kampong ChhN. Province. 
Mrs. Lim S., the village bank president, was selected by the members. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and visitors to the local village. Her husband, Mr. Mi Reth, sells firewood. 

Although they work very hard, they still earn less income than they need to provide better living conditions for the family. They also live in an old house in poor condition. To improve their circumstances, Mrs. Lim S. is asking for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for the family. Mrs. Lim S. is 45 years old and the mother of five children who attend the local school. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family

loans.name: Sut

texts.en: Sut S., 35, is a widow and resides with two young children in Prey Chor district, Kampong Cham province. She has a business selling groceries and  palm sugar to earn a living and is able to make US$ 4 a day. Two of her children are students. She also gets support from her sister who is a garment factory worker. Mrs. Sut S. would like to take out a loan of US$ 400 to purchase a motorbike to transport  palm sugar for her customers.

loans.use: To purchase a motorbike for her business

loans.name: Mot

texts.en: S. is 26 years old and earns a living growing rice crops. She lives in a village in the Pursat Province and is married to Kimsen (shown in the photograph), 28, who also grows rice. The young couple has two children, both of whom are teenagers. Because rice farming is the family's main source of income, S. and Kimsen work hard every day. At present, however, they only own a piece of farmland that was given to them by their parents. To expand their farming business, therefore, S. would like to ask for a loan to be able to purchase an additional plot of farmland.

loans.use: Purchase of a plot of farmland

loans.name: Leng's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Leng S. is the leader of a four-person loan group. The group members live in Veal Ta King Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Leng S. and her husband, Mr. Choem Sok, are farmers who own a plot of land on which they cultivate rice to earn a living. With their farm, they can earn money for their rice, but it is not enough to support the family well. Although they try to work hard, their family members still live in an old house in poor conditions. 

To provide better conditions, Mrs. Leng S. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for her family. Mrs. Leng S. is 41 years old and the mother of two children. One of her children is employed in a garment factory. The youngest one attends the local school. 

This is a group loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Three members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to maK. payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients maK. their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for her family.

loans.name: Rahman

texts.en: Rahman was born in 1958. He is married, has 4 children, and is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region in Kurdmahmudlu village. 10 years ago he started this business. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a cow, to expand his dairy business.

loans.use: to buy a cow

loans.name: Mahsad

texts.ru: Гайбуллоева Махсад отлично закончив свой очередной кредит , хочет получить ещё займ для закупа зимнего ассортимента тканей.Сейчас у неё бизнес заметно расширился. У Махсад очень много клиентов.Махсад благодарна KIVA за поддержку и финансирование.Она говорит , что все эти достижения в бизнесе благодаря кредитам.
texts.en:
Mahsad G. has successfully paid off another of her previous loans and wants to apply for a new loan to buy seasonal winter assortment of fabrics. At this time her business has visibly expanded. Mahsad has many customers. She is very grateful to Kiva for support and loans. She says that all her achievements in business are because of these loans.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fabrics

loans.name: Mrs. Tha Arn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank loan group consists of eight people who live in Aleng Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Tha A. was selected by the members to be the village bank president. She is a basket maker in the local village. Her husband, Mr. Leng Chamroeurn, collects palm juice, which is processed into palm sugar or wine. He now faces a problem, because he cannot climb up the palm tree. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Tha A. has decided to ask for a loan to buy bamboo to tie to the palm tree, so her husband can climb up to gather palm juice. 

Mrs. Tha A. is 24 years old and the mother of four children. Two of her children attend the local school. The two youngest are ages four months and five years old. 

This is a village bank loan consisting of mainly end-of-term loans. Six members have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy bamboo

loans.name: Naing

texts.en: Naing K., 25, lives in Pursat Province and earns a living cultivating rice crops and vegetables on a plot of land. She started this business in 2001 and is able to harvest the crops twice a year. K. has two children, both of whom are still young and live at home, while her husband, 24, works with her in the rice and vegetable farming business, in addition to catching fish for sale. K. works hard every day and would like to take out a loan to purchase a buffalo to help her plow the farmland.

loans.use: Purchase of a buffalo for plowing farmland

loans.name: Mariama

texts.fr: Dame I. Mariama est âgée de 37 ans. Originaire du Togo Nord, elle a été élevée par sa tante dès son jeune âge, elle aida cette dernière dans la vente de divers articles: conserves, cigarettes, pates alimentaires et autres biens de consommation. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte à 25 ans après avoir été placée  comme domestique pendant 3 ans. Elle  vendait de la nourriture :riz mélangé au haricot  avec de la friture.Depuis 13 ans, elle est arrivée à cotonou, elle a ajouté à son activité de vente de riz, de la pâte de maïs accompagné de diverses sauces. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour augmenter son capital afin de renforcer l'activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en sacs de maïs et de riz.
texts.en:
Mariama I. is 37 years old. Originally from northern Togo, she was raised by her aunt from a young age, and she helped that aunt to sell various products: canned goods, cigarettes, pasta and other consumer goods. She started her own business when she was 25 years old after having worked as a maid for three years. She sold fried food with rice and beans. When she was 13, Mariama moved to Cotonou, and in addition to selling rice, branched out into selling fermented cornmeal mush, accompanied by a variety of sauces. She is requesting her third loan to increase her working capital in order to build up her business. Mariama intends to stock up on sacks of rice and corn.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of one sack of rice and one sack of corn

loans.name: Mrs. Vanny Arn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nine people who live in Kuy Village in Kampong Chhnang Province comprise this village bank loan group. 

Mrs. Vanny A., the village bank president, is a farmer. She grows rice on a two-hectare field to eA. a living. Her husband, Mr. Choeun Rat, is a taxi driver who earns a small income to support the family. Although they work hard, they still cannot provide a better life for their family. 

To improve their living conditions, Mrs. Vanny A. has decided to ask for a loan, which she will use with her savings, to build a new house for the family to live. Mrs. Vanny A. is 27 years old and the mother three children. Two of her children are enrolled in the local school. The youngest is just three years old. 

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To build a new house for the family

loans.name: Nary's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Nary C. the leader of a four-person village loan group. The group members live in Au Village in Kampong Chhnang Province. 

Mrs. Nary C. is farmer who grows rice and vegetables. She now faces a problem, because she does not have enough money to buy vegetable seeds. To deal with this problem, Mrs. Nary C. has decided to ask for a loan to buy seeds. 

Her husband, Mr. Sok San, is a construction worker who can make a little income to support the family. Mrs. Nary C. is 29 years old and the mother of three children, ages one, four, and five years old. 

One member is this village bank loan has an end-of-term loan. The rest have monthly payment loans. This client with the end-of-term loan is not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy vegetable seeds.

loans.name: Assitan

texts.fr:
Madame Assitan Diakité est une femme mariée de 40 ans et mère de deux enfants qui vit dans une famille polygame avec son mari,ses enfants et sa coépouse dans le quartier Hérémakono Nord de la préfecture de Bougouni.(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Très tôt elle commença les activités génératrices revenues notamment le commerce des articles de la  lingerie(tissus, draps de lits) de la parfumerie  et biens d’autres articles divers(en plastiques..) Avec une expérience de 10 ans Madame Assitan Diakité maîtrise son activité qu’elle a appris auprès  de sa tante jadis grande commreçante. 
Afin d’étoffer son  fonds de commerce elle décida de rejoindre l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui elle est à son deuxième  prêt individuel. Le  prêt précédent a été correctement remboursé.
Elle veut  acheter avec ce prêt,  20 piéces de tissus, 35 draps de lit et  3 cartons de parfums de différentes sortes.
Elle s’approvisionne au Burkina Faso et à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des grossistes du grand marché. Elle effectue ses ventes d’une façon ambulante dans les quartiers de la ville et de façon fixe au marché   de Bougouni. Madame Assitan a essentiellement comme clientèle les femmes à qui elle commerce au comptant, en détail et à crédit payable mensuellement ou hebdomadairement.
Elle compte réaliser  avec ce prêt un bénéfice mensuel de 55 000 F CFA qu’elle envisage utiliser pour agrandir son entreprise afin de devenir grossiste.
texts.en:
Mrs. Assitan Diakité, 40, is married and the mother of two children. They live in a polygamous family with her husband, his children, and her co-spouse in the Hérémakono Nord neighborhood of the prefecture of Bougouni (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali).

Very early on, she began to earn her living selling goods, notably linens (fabric, sheets), perfume, and diverse articles (made of plastic). With an experience of 10 years, Mrs.Assitan Diakité is well-versed in her business which she learned from her aunt, who used to be a very fine merchant.

So as to bolster her working capital, she decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso, with whom she is on her second individual loan. The preceding loan was correctly reimbursed.

With this loan, she would like to buy 20 lengths of cloth, 35 sheets, and 3 cases of various sorts of perfume. She does her buying in Burkina Faso and in Bamako (the capital of the Republic of Mali) from the wholesalers who sell in the big open-air market. She sells door-to-door in the neighborhoods of the town and out of a stall in the market of Bougouni. Mrs. Assitan's clientele consists essentially of women to whom she sells for cash, retail, and on credit payable weekly or monthly.

With the loan she expects to make a monthly profit of 55,000 F CFA which she plans to use to expand her business so as to become a wholesaler herself.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of fabrics, sheets, and perfumes for re-sale

loans.name: Rachidatou

texts.fr: Dame I. Rachidatou est née le 20/06/1974 à Cotonou. Originaire de Cana dans le zou, elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de 6ème et abandonna sur sa propre volonté. Après son abandon des classes, elle aida sa tante dans la vente de divers articles de consommation. Elle s'est mise à son propre compte à l'àge de 25 ans et elle se livrait à la vente du gari, d'arachide grillé et ensuite a ajouté à cette activité la vente de divers d'autres articles de grande consommation: les conserves, les pâtes alimentaires, etc. Elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en savons, conserves et les pâtes alimentaires. Elle est mariée à ADENKA Mamoudou et a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Rachidatou I. was born on June 20, 1974 in Cotonou. Originally from Cana in the Zou district, she attended school up to 7th grade and left off of her own accord. After she left school, she helped her aunt sell various consumables. At the age of 25, she struck out on her own and began selling gari (flour made from cassava) and grilled peanuts, and then began to sell other staples as well: tinned goods, pasta, etc. She is requesting this second loan to bolster her little business. She intends to stock up on soap, tinned goods, and pasta. She is married to Mamoudou Adenka and has four children.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing 1/2 case of soap, 1/2 case of pasta, and 1/2 case of tinned goods

loans.name: Madeleine

texts.fr: Dame K. Madeleine est née le 03/06/1979 à Cotonou. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1 où elle abandonna de don propre gré. Elle alla 3 ans après en apprentissage de couture et reçut son diplôme après 4 ans de formation. Elle exerça le métier pendant 3 ans et abandonna au profit de la vente de poulet avec sa maman au marché dantokpa. Elle s'est ensuite mise dans la vente de lingerie, des tenues prêt à porter et divers d'autres articles. Elle sollicite ce 2ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en chaussure, emballages sachets, huile végétale, riz. Mariée à SEHOUNON Marc, elle a des jumeaux Chadrac et Mechac.
texts.en:
Madeleine K. was born in Cotonou on June 3rd, 1979. She went to school until grade 4, at which time she chose to leave school. She apprenticed as a seamstress for three years and after four years of training, she received her diploma. She worked as a seamstress for three years, then decided to join her mother in selling chickens at the Dantokpa market. She then started selling lingerie, ready-to-wear clothing and various other articles. She is asking for this, her second loan, to bolster her business. She plans to purchase shoes, plastic bags, vegetable oil and rice. She is married to Marc Sehounon and is the mother of twins named Chadrac and Mechac.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 4 dozen shoes; 6 dozen plastic bags; 1-25kg bag of rice; 1-25L drum of vegetable oil.

loans.name: Hamidou

texts.fr:
Monsieur Hamidou Konaté est un homme marié de 35 ans et père de deux enfants qui vit avec sa femme et ses enfants dans une famille monogame dans le  quartier populeux de Dougounina à Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
N’ayant jamais fréquenté le système scolaire pour des raisons sociales, très vite il commença les activités économiques notamment la vente d’une boutique depuis maintenant 6 ans. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son père. Hamidou Konaté est apprécié et jouit d’une grande réputation au niveau de son quartier et de la ville de Bougouni.
Dans sa recherche de ressources financières complémentaires il décida de collaborer avec l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec laquelle il est à son  premier prêt.
Il compte acheter avec ce prêt divers articles de boutique( cigarettes, bonbons, sucre, thé, laits en poudre et en boites, huiles alimentaires, pâtes dentifrices, savons, conserves alimentaires, briquets etc.) 
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) auprès de différents grossistes.Il effectue sa vente à une clientèle  composée de toute la franche de la population locale au comptant, à crédit et en détail .
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Hamidou Konaté compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qu’il utilisera pour  agrandir sa boutique, payer les intérêts du prêt et subvenir aux besoins de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Hamidou Konaté is 35 years old and married with two children. He lives with his wife and children in a manogmous family in the populous neighborhood of Dougounina in Bougouni ( the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He was never able to attend the school system for social reasons and very quickly started up his own business, notably selling products from his own shop, which he has done for the last 6 years. His father taught him this business. Hamidou Konaté is appreciated and enjoys a good reputation in his neighborhood and in the city of Bougouni. In his search for additional financing, he decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microbank and take out his first loan. With this loan he plans to buy assorted articles for the shop (cigarettes, candies, sugar, tea, powered milk and boxes of basic oils, tooth paste, soaps, basic preserves, briquettes, etc.) He will purchase these supplies at Bamako (Capital of the Republic of Mail) from various wholesalers and then resell these goods to clients from all sections of the local population. Mr.Hamidou Konaté expects to earn a monthly income of 30,000 FCFA which he will use to enlarge his shop, meet the monthly loan payments and provide for the needs of his family.

Translated from French by David Gibbons, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy assorted products for resale in his shop

loans.name: Lay

texts.en: Lay E., 48, lives in Pursat Province. She earns a living growing rice. Her husband, E. Khom (shown in the photograph), raises oxen for sale and for use in his wife's business. The couple has nine children; five of them are single and four are married. Two of the children help Lay E. and her husband in the farming business. To expand the business and earn additional income, Lay E. would like to request a loan for her husband to purchase additional oxen to raise and then re-sell, as well as to buy a cow-cart.

loans.use: Purchase of oxen

loans.name: Ismaila

texts.fr:
Monsieur Ismaila Cissé est  un célibataire âgé de 30 ans qui vit chez ses parents dans une famille polygame dans le quartier Medine de la préfecture de Bougouni(troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). 
Après avoir fini ses études secondaires Monsieur Ismaila Cissé est resté très longtemps sans emploi. Il a tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite, il décida de mener alors l’activité de jeux téléchargés qui marchent beaucoup avec les jeunes. Il a appris cette activité auprès de son ami durant plusieurs mois. Actuellement Monsieur Ismaila maîtrise cette activité dans ses moindre details.
Afin d’obtenir un fonds de roulement, indispensable à la bonne marche de ses affaires; il décida de prendre un prêt  auprès  de l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son premier prêt.
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter, 2 téléviseurs et 2 appareils play station 2 pour les jeux téléchargés. Il ira faire ses achats d’appareils à Bamako (capitale de la république du Mali) et mise sur une clientèle essentiellement juvénile du quartier et même de la ville toute entière de la préfecture de Bougouni.. 
Le moment propisse pour ses activités est très généralement  la période des vacances scolaires, des congés et les week ends.
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Ismaila Cissé compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA qui sera utilisé pour améliorer son entreprise, payer les intérêts du prêt et aider ses parents à subvenir aux charges de cette famille nombreuse.
texts.en:
Ismaila Cissé is a 30 year old single man living with his parents in a polygamous family in the Medine neighbourhoo of Bougouni, Mali. Mr. Ismaila Cissé finished High School, but could not find a job for a long time afterwards. He started a number of businesses, but without success. He then decided to start a downloaded games' business which is very popular with young people, an activity that a friend of his taught him over several months. Mr. Ismaila has now mastered the fine points of this activity. In order to obtain working capital, which he will need in order to make a success of his business, he has decided to ask the microfinancial institution Soro Yiriwaso for this, his first loan. He will use the loan to buy two televisions and two PlayStation 2 devices for the games. He will go to Bamako, the capital of Mali, for this purchase and is counting on the fact that young people, his target customers, make up most of the population of his neighbourhood and in fact of the entire town and prefecture of Bougouni. His business generally does best during school holidays, school breaks, and weekends. Mr. Ismaila Cissé expects that thanks to this loan he will be able to make 30,000 FCFA which he will reinvest in his business, pay the interest on his loan and help his parents to support their large family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two televisions and two PlayStation 2 devices

loans.name: Pich

texts.en: Pich D. earns income farming rice and raising poultry. She and her husband started the business in 1980. D. has one daughter who is a teenager and attends school. D. and her husband work hard to generate income for supporting their family. Every year, D. buys rice stocks to keep for a while and then re-sell for profit. The business has been going well, and D. would now like to expand it. Therefore, she is asking for a loan to be able to purchase rice stocks for re-sale and to buy additional pigs and chicken to raise.

loans.use: Purchase of rice stocks, pigs and chicken

loans.name: Anne

texts.fr: Dame A. Anne est âgée de 38 ans. Elle est originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre dont elle est née. Très jeune, elle aida sa mère dans la vente d'huile rouge et de boissons sucrées. Après son mariage, elle s'est mise à son propre compte en vendant de poissons frais avec l'aide financière de son mari. Ensuite, elle a ajouté la préparation et la vente d'akassa. Aujourd'hui, elle a maintenu ces diverses activités en prenant le soin d'y ajouter la vente de fagots de bois et la distribution-vente de pagne. Elle a sollicité ce 3ème prêt d'une durée de 10 mois pour renforcer ses activités. Mariée à BADJO Samuel, elle a 5 enfants.
texts.en:
Madam Anne A. is 38 years old. She is originally from Ganvié, a waterside village where she was born. When very young, she helped her mother sell red palm oil and soft drinks. After she was married, she started off on her own selling fresh fish, with financial help from her husband. Next, she included the making and selling of “akassa” (a thick porridge). Today, she has maintained these diverse activities, carefully adding the sale of bundles of wood and the distribution of “pagnes” (colorful West African cloth). She is requesting this third 10-month loan to boost her commerce. Madam A. is married to Samuel BADJO and has five children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For supplies: 2 boat-loads of wood, 2 sacks of corn, and 9 lengths of pagnes

loans.name: Fotima

texts.ru: Назарова Фотима жительница района Абдурахмони Джоми. Замужем. Возраст 49 лет. 7 лет занимается торговлей золотыми украшениями.Торгует на рынке  в городе Курган-тюбе. Хочет получить кредит для того , чтобы увеличить товароборот. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 10 месяцев. Таким образом она увеличит ассортимент товара и привлечет новых клиентов.
texts.en:
Fotima N. lives in the Abdurahmoni Jomi region. She is 49 years old, married. She has seven years of experience selling fine gold jewelry. She sells on the Kurgan-tube market. She wants to get a loan to increase her inventory circulation. By doing this she will increase the assortment of her merchandise and attracts new customers. She will pay off the loan within 10 months.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Issa

texts.fr:
