Monsieur Issa C. est  âgé de 22 ans marié, il vit avec sa femme dans une famille polygame chez son père à  Bougouni dans le quartier Niébala (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Monsieur Issa C. est un diplômé d’une Institut de Formation de Maître (I.F.M)  de Bougouni.
Dés à son jeune âge il appris la fabrication de marmites en aluminuim auprès de son père dans la forge familiale.
Avec une expérience de 7 ans Monsieur Issa maîtrise bien cette activité qui consiste à fondre l’aluminuim pour en faire des marmites qui sont utilisées dans les familles au Mali pour preparer les plats. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers un ami qui est aussi un client l’institution, il décida de prendre un prêt pour achéter 10 tas d’aluminuim et 3 sacs de charbon de bois. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso.                                                                                                                                                                               Il s’approvisionne essentiellement à Bougouni et quelques fois à Bamako( capitale de république du Mali.) Il effectue ses ventes au niveau de la ville de Bougouni et une partie dans les villages environnants lors des foires hebdomadaires au comptant, à crédit et en détail à une clienèle constituée généralement de femmes.
Monsieur Issa C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 40 000 FCFA. Avec ces bénéfices il envisage construire une maison afin de faire demenager sa femme et à aider son père à assurer les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en:
Mr. Issa C. is 22 years old, married, and lives with his wife in a polygamous family at his father’s place in Bougouni, in the Niébala district (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). He is a graduate of a training institute for teachers: Institut de Formation de Maître (I.F.M) de Bougouni.

When he was young, he learned from his father how to make aluminum pots and pans at the family forge. With seven years of experience, he is really mastering this work, which consists of melting aluminum. The products are used by families in Mali to make meals. Acquainted with Soro Yiriwaso through a friend, who is also a client of this micro-finance institution, he decided to take out a loan to buy 10 loads of aluminum and 3 sacks of charcoal. This is his first loan with Soro Yiriwaso.

He gets his supplies essentially in Bougouni and sometimes in Bamako (capital of Mali). He makes his sales retail, cash or credit accepted, to women customers generally, in Bougouni and in surrounding villages when it is market day each week. He intends to realize a monthly profit of 40,000 francs CFA. With this profit, he envisions building a house for his wife and to help his father ensure that family expenses are covered.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy aluminum and charcoal

loans.name: Maman Kartimou

texts.fr: Dame I. MAMAN Kartimou est née en 1969 à BASSILA une ville du nord BENIN dans le département de l'ATACORA. Elle réside au quartier ADOGLETA ; un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Elle est mariée à Mr AFFO Séydou et mère de 5 enfants dont 4 filles et un garçon tous scolarisés. Elle mène l’activité de la vente du savon ghanéenne depuis 5 ans. Elle vend aussi de la nourriture devant son domicile. Elle va acheter le savon au GHANA et les autres produits qui rentrent dans la préparation de la nourriture au marché international du BENIN (Tokpa). Elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Madam M. K. I. was born in 1969 in BASSILA, a city in northern Benin in the county of ATACORA. She resides in the ADOGLETA district, a suburb of the city of Cotonou. She is married to Mr. Séydou AFFO and is the mother of five children (four girls and a boy, all of whom are in school). She has been selling Ghanaian soap for five years. She also sells food from her house. She is going to buy soap in Ghana and the items needed for making food at the international market of Benin (Tokpa). She is on her third loan.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap in Ghana and items that go into making food

loans.name: Pascal

texts.fr: Originaire de Ganvié, village lacustre, monsieur Z. Pascal est âgé de 45 ans. Initié très jeune à la pêche par son père, qui est la principale activité du milieu. Il a su maîtriser les rouages de cette activité et c'est de cela il vit jusqu'à ce jour. Il n'a jamais mis pieds à l'école. Il sollicite ce 3ème credit pour pourvoir s'acheter des outils servant à la pêche. Marié à OKE Victorine, il est père de 7 enfants.
texts.en:
Pascal Z. is 45 years old and is originally from the lakeside village of Ganvié. His father taught him to fish at a very young age; fishing is the main local livelihood. He learned the ins and outs of fishing and to this day, that is how he supports himself. He has never been to school. He is asking for this third loan to buy fishing tools. He is married to Victorine Oke and has seven children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fishing nets.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Chan C., 47, earns income raising pigs in a stall next to her house. She also grows vegetables, such as cabbage, morning glory, and cucumbers, and sells them to a market-seller. She is married to Khot Trim, who is 48 years old and helps her in the business. The couple has four children; two of them are single and still attend school, while the other two are married and live away from home. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province.
C. and Trim recently sold all of their pigs to a slaughterer to pay for plowing their farmland. Now, they would like to ask for a loan to buy additional piglets to raise. The loan will allow the couple to increase their revenue and make sure that their children receive higher education.

loans.use: Purchase of piglets to raise

loans.name: Modieré

texts.fr:
Madame Modieré Sidibé est une femme mariée de 32 ans qui est mère de 6 enfants. Elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants  dans une famille monogame dans le quartier Hérémakono Centre de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali).
Madame Modieré Sidibé fait  comme activité génératrice de revenus de la restauration. Elle a son restaurant sis à la gare routière de Bougouni.  Elle mène cette activité depuis 10 ans qu’elle a appris  auprès de soeur. Elle cuisine des plats alimentaires de diverses sortes qui sont très appréciés par les routiers et les employers travaillant à l’autogare routière.
Avant d’intégrer le programme de crédit de Soro Yiriwaso, Madame Modieré Sidibé avait certaines difficultés pour méner à bien son activité de restauration à cause de la faiblesse de son fonds de roulement. Ayant fait la connaissance de Soro Yiriwaso à travers une association de femmes de son quartier avec qui est a bouclé trois prêts solidaires(prêt de groupe) elle est à son  sixième prêt individuel avec l’institution et ses affaires ont commencés à décoller. Tous les prêts précédents ont été correctement remboursés tant sur le plan collectif qu’individuel.
Avec ce prêt, elle veut acheter 10 chaises pour l’accueil de sa clientèle, quotidiennement divers sortes de condiments alimentaires et hebdomadairement 3 sacs de riz  . Elle s’approvisionnera à Bougouni auprès des commerçants de la place.
Elle envisage réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 30 000 FCFA. Avec ce bénéfice elle compte améliorer davantage son restaurant et achéter une parcelle à usage d’habitation.
texts.en:
Mrs. Modieré Sidibé is a married woman of 32 and the mother of six children. She lives with her husband and children in a monogamous family in the Hérémakono Centre neighbourhood of Bougouni, Mali. Mrs. Modieré Sidibé runs a restaurant in order to make money. Her restaurant is located at the Bougouni bus station. She has been in business for 10 years, a business her sister taught her. She prepares a wide variety of dishes which travellers as well as bus station employees much appreciate. Before joining the Soro Yiriwaso credit program, Mrs. Modieré Sidibé had some difficulties with managing her restaurant because of a lack of capital. A neighbourhood businesswomen's association introduced her to Soro Yiriwaso with which she has already completed three group loans. This is her sixth individual loan with this institution and her business is starting to take off. She has repaid all her previous loans on time, both the group loans and the individual loans. She wants to use this loan to buy 10 chair to accommodate her customers, to buy various condiments daily, and three bags of rice weekly. She will make her purchases in Bougouni, from the merchants in the market. She expects monthly earnings of 30,000 FCFA. With these earnings she plans to further improve her restaurant and to buy land for a home.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy foodstuffs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Robiya

texts.ru: Эшнаева Робия жительница района  Абдурахмони Джоми.Возраст 53 года, замужем ,имеет пятерых детей. Уже 6 лет занимается торговлей фруктами и овощами. Торгует на рынке района со своей торговой точки. Хочет получить кредит сроком на 12 месяцев для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот и привести в порядок торговую точку. Установить новые прилавки . Это даст возможность расширить бизнес и увеличить доход.
texts.en:
Robiya A. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is 53 years old, married and has five children. For the last 5 years she has been selling fruits and vegetables at her own stall at the local market. Robiya would like to take out a loan for 12 months to expand her inventory and fix up the market stall by installing new counters. This improvement will allow her to expand her business and increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Repair of market stall

loans.name: Moussa

texts.fr:
Monsieur Moussa Koné est  un célibataire de 28 ans qui vit chez son oncle dans le quartier Hérémakono de la ville de Bougouni (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali) .
Il abandonna l’école dès son jeune âge au profit de la photographie qu’il a appris  auprès d’un de ses cousin. Avec une expérience de 7 ans, Monsieur Moussa Koné maîtrise son activité et est très apprécié avec une réputation et une notoriété exemplaire. En plus de sa traditionnelle activité qu’est la photographie il fait de l’animation musicale lors de différentes cérémonies(baptèmes, mariages, aniversaires...) 
Dans le souci de faire prospérer ses affaires il décida d’intégrer le programme  crédit de Soro Yiriwaso avec qui il est à son deuxième prêt individuel. Le premier prêt a été correctement remboursé.
Avec ce prêt il compte acheter un appareil photo et un appareil de sonorisation. Il s’approvisionnera en ces différents articles cités ci-dessus à Bamako(capitale de la république du Mali) auprès des commerçants spécialisés du domaine. Ses clients sont généralement les jeunes qui affluent beaucoup plus pendant les jours feriés, les congés et vacances scolaires. C’est pendant ces périodes  que ses activités sont très élévés.
Moussa  Koné compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000 FCFA.
Avec ce bénéfice il envisage ouvrir un autre studio, subvenir à ses besoins et enfin fonder une famille.
texts.en:
Moussa Koné is a 28-year-old single man who lives with his uncle in the Hérémakono neighbourhood of Bougouni, Mali. He left school at a very young age in order to do photography which he learned from one of his cousins. He has seven years' experience and has mastered photography. He is very popular and enjoys an excellent reputation. In addition to photography, he plays music at various ceremonies (baptisms, weddings, birthdays...) He decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso credit program in order to bolster his business. This is his second individual loan; the first loan has been properly repaid. He will use the loan to buy a new camera and sound system. He will travel to Bamako, Mali's capital, to make his purchases, buying from specialized stores. His customers are usually young people who come most often during school holidays and school breaks: sales are highest at those times. Moussa Koné expects to make 65,000 FCFA monthly. With this income, he plans to open another studio, support himself and finally be able to start a family.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a camera and a sound system.

loans.name: Théoneste

texts.en:
Greetings from Théoneste B. in Kicukiro District, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Théoneste is 23 years old, married with 3 children.

This entrepreneur owns a small shop in his local area. He sells household materials like soap, maize flour, cassava flour, matchboxes, salt, sugar, beans, paraffin, biscuits, etc. From all his business activities, he earns about US$ 95 per month.

Théoneste is requesting a loan worth 300 000 Rwf which will help him to expand his business. This loan will be repaid over 8 months.

loans.use: expanding his general store

loans.name: Djibiline Anatou

texts.fr: Originaire de l'ATACORA ; un département du Nord BENIN, dame D. Djibiline est née à BASSILA en 1970. Elle est mariée à Mr Abasse ADAM chauffeur de profession. Elle est mère de 5 enfants dont un garçon et quatre filles tous scolarisés. Elle exerce depuis quatre ans l’activité de la vente du savon ghanéen au quartier Sègbèya où elle vit avec son mari et ses enfants. C’est un savon qui coûte cher et est très apprécié par bon nombre de béninois. Elle va régulièrement au GHANA s’approvisionner. Elle est à son troisième crédit et sollicite pour cette fois un crédit.
texts.en:
Djibiline D. was born in 1970 in Bassila, in the department of Atacora in the North of Benin. She is married to Abasse Adam, a professional driver. She is a mother of five: one boy and four girls who all attend school. For the past four years, she has sold Ghanaian soap in the neighbourhood of Sègbèya, where she lives with her husband and children. This soap is expensive and very popular with many Beninese. She travels regularly to Ghana to stock up on soap. This is her third loan request.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy soap in Ghana

loans.name: Julien

texts.fr: Agé de 32 ans, monsieur B. Julien est originaire d'Adja, département de MONO, il n'a pas eu la chance d'aller à l'école, mais plutôt, il fut mis en apprentissage en mècanique vélo-moteur pendant 3 ans. Il n'a pas pu prendre son parchemin, faute demoyens financiers de ses parents. Pour pourvoir subvenir à ses besoins, il aida un ami dans la vente de pièces détachés. Après,il s'est mis dans le commerce de vente de maïs sur fonds propre parrallèlement à son métier de mécanicien. Il sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour augmenter son capital et agrandir son commerce. Il compte s'approvisionner en 15 sacs de maïs. Marié à AKPANOU Sévérine, il est père de 02 enfants.
texts.en:
Julien B. is 32 years old and originally from Adja, department of Mono. He did not have the opportunity to go to school: he apprenticed as a motorbike mechanic for three years. He was not able to get his diploma because his parents could not afford it. In order to support himself, he helped his friend sell parts. Later, he started a corn-selling business using his own funds, while continuing to work as a mechanic. He is asking for this third loan to increase his working capital and expand his business. He plans to purchase 15 bags of corn. He is married to Sévérine Akpanou and has two children.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy 15 bags of corn.

loans.name: Souleymane

texts.fr:
Monsieur Souleymane C. est un célibataire de 29 ans. Il vit dans une famille polygame  chez ses parents dans le quartier Hérémakono-Nord de la préfecture de Bougouni (troisième région administrative  de la république du Mali).
Après les études secondaire et supérieure, Monsieur Souleymane C. est resté très longtemps sans emploi. Après avoir tenté plusieurs activités sans réussite il décida de  s’installer dans le domaine de l’aviculture. Depuis maintenant deux ans. Il fut initié à cette  activité par un de ses oncles.
Dans le souci de satisfaire le besoin de sa clientèle de plus en plus croissante, Souleymane C. décida de prendre un prêt avec l’institution Soro Yiriwaso. Il est à sa première expérience avec Soro Yiriwaso
Il compte utiliser ce prêt pour acheter 10 mangeoires, 3 cartons de vaccins et 25 sachets de vitamines 15 sacs de 100 kilogrammes maïs et  2 sacs de poissons sechés pour la nourriture de la vollaile.
Il s’approvisionne à Bamako( capitale de la république du Mali). Il vend ses produits (oeufs, coquelets et pondeuses) à une clientèle composée de boutiquiers,  de gérants d’alimentations, de restaurataires et  aux revendeurs du marché à vollaile de Bougouni. Les périodes les plus propices pour la  vente est surtout les périodes de  fêtes de fin d’années, les cérémonies(réligieuses..).
Avec ce prêt, Monsieur Souleymane C. compte réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 65 000FCFA qui sera utilisé pour payer les intérêts du prêt, investir dans l’activité et fonder dans un futur proche un foyer.
texts.en:
Mr. Souleymane C. is single and 29 years old. He lives with his parents in a polygamous family in the neighbourhood of Hérémakono-Nord, Bougouni prefecture, in Mali. After completing high school and university, Mr. Souleymane C. was unemployed for a long time. After a number of unsuccessful attempts at business, he decided to start a poultry business. For two years he has been in this business which he was taught by an uncle. In order to satisfy his customers' increasing demand, Souleymane C. decided to take out a loan from Soro Yiriwaso. This is his first experience with Soro Yiriwaso. He plans to use the loan to buy 10 feeders, 3 boxes of vaccines, 25 bags of vitamins, 15 100-kg bags of corn, and 2 bags of dried fish to feed the poultry. He will buy these products in Bamako, the capital of Mali. He sells his products (eggs, cockerels and laying hens) to a clientele made up of shopkeepers, food managers, restauranteurs and resellers of the Bougouni poultry market. The best times to sell are during the year-end festivities and at times of ceremonies (religious...) Mr. Souleymane C. expects to make 65,000 FCFA monthly with this loan. He will use the income to pay the loan interest, invest in his business and establish a home in the near future.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy feeders, vitamins, vaccines, and food.

loans.name: Jean De Dieu

texts.en:
Greetings from Jean de Dieu B. in Kicukiro district, Kigali, the capital city of Rwanda! Jean de Dieu is 26 years old, married with 2 children.

This entrepreneur has been a motorbike driver for three years but what is amazing is that he got his own motorbike. This man gets up very early at 5am every day to start transporting people to their workplaces. Jean de Dieu is requesting a loan worth 500 000 Rwf, which will help him to buy another motorbike. He will be paying back this loan over 8 months. His goal is to send all his siblings to school and build a house for his family.

loans.use: buying another motorbike to transport passengers

loans.name: Yolande

texts.fr: Née le 03 Août 1964 à Lomé, dame E. Yolande est originaire du OUIDAH une ville historique du BENIN. Elle réside à Sègbèya l’un des quartiers populaire du capital économique du BENIN (Cotonou). Elle est mariée à GONDJOU Cyrille, un dresseur de chevaux au chômage depuis onze ans suite la mort de son employeur. Elle a deux enfants dont l’aîné un garçon est à l’université et la benjamine en apprentissage de couture. Elle vend des casseroles et des bols en série ; des chaussures pour enfants et adultes ; des pagnes et des mèches. Elle exerce cette activité dans son domicile où elle livre ses produits en gros et en détail à ses clientes. Elle va s’approvisionner à Lomé.
texts.en:
Born on August 3, 1964 in Lomé, Yolande E. is originally from Ouidah, an historic town in Benin. She lives in Sègbèya, one of the most populous neighbourhoods of the economic capital of Benin (Cotonou). She is married to Cyrille Gondjou, a horse trainer who has been unemployed for 11 years after the death of his employer. She has two children: the elder is a son studying at university and the younger is a daughter apprenticing to be a seamstress. She sells pans and nested bowls; shoes for children and adults; pagnes (traditional cloth) and hair extensions. Her business is home-based and she delivers her products in bulk or in small quantities to her customers. She will travel to Lomé to purchase her products.

Translated from French by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pans and various other items.

loans.name: Raphael

texts.fr: Monsieur F. Raphaèl est né le 23 janvier 1971 à Cotonou. Originaire de GUEZIN dans l'Atlantique, il a fréquenta jusqu'en classe de CM2. Après son echec au Certificat d'Etude Primaire, il abandonna les classes et alla en apprentissage de soudure autogène pendant 3 ans. Il reçût son diplôme de fin de formation et exerça le mètier pendant 7 ans. Parrallèlement à son métier, il vend de divers articles tels que les cartes de recharges et les boissons. Il sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Marié à EZOUN Eliane,il est père de 05 enfants.
texts.en:
Mr. Raphaèl F. was born on January 23, 1971 in Cotonou. Originally from GUEZIN in Atlantique, he attended school through the 5th grade. Failing to earn his grade school diploma (Certificat d'Etude Primaire), he dropped out and entered a 3-year spot-welding apprenticeship. He received his certificate of completion and has been practicing his trade for seven years. Concurrent to his work as a welder, he sells various items, such as rechargeable phone cards and drinks. He is requesting this third loan to bolster his business. Mr. F. is married to Eliane EZOUN and is the father of five children.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: For 20 cases of beverages (beer and soft drinks)

loans.name: Suos

texts.en:
N. is 27 years old and runs a laundry service in Pursat Province. She started the business in 2004 and currently can earn around US$ 3 per day. She is married to Ra, 30, who is a construction worker. He can carve marble and wood statues beside construction work. The couple has one son, who is a teenager and attends school.

Because marble carving is one good source of extra income for the family, N. would like to ask for a loan for her husband to purchase marble and wood to carve for sale. Her husband is in the photo because she was not available for photographing.

loans.use: to purchase marble and wood to carve for sale

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica T. sells carcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Monica is 40 years old and is married. Her husband is a security guard. She has 4 children and her children go to school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a house

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret J. lives and works in Rongo Town in Kenya. She is 55 years old and married to a retired schoolteacher who currently is involved in farming. Margaret and her husband have 6 children, only one of whom is still in school.

Margaret is the proprietor of Westlands Academy in Rongo Town. The school has 102 pupils, from pre-primary to class 8. There are 11 teachers employed by the school, as well as 2 other employees. Margaret started Westlands Academy in 2001.

Wanting to give the school a facelift, Margaret has applied for a loan of KSH 52,500 (USD 700) in order to perform renovations on the building.

loans.use: Renovation of school building.

loans.name: Svay

texts.en:
Svay K. is 58 years old and a resident of Pursat Province where she has owned a plot of land since 1979. She grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. She is widowed and the mother of five children: three are married and live away from the family home, and two are single and attend school.

Svay K. works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Rice growing is K.'s main source of income to sustain her family and especially make sure both her children receive higher education. To help do the hard physical labor of her farming work, Svay K. is applying for a loan to buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the fields and a cart to transport her rice crop.

loans.use: buy a water buffalo to use for plowing the fields

loans.name: Marifat

texts.ru: Боева Маърифат проживает в районе Абдурахмони Джоми. Возраст 35 лет, замужем и имеет четверых детей. Муж в России на заработках , поэтому ей одной приходится вести хозяйство и обеспечивать семью. Для этого она очень много работает . Имеет торговую точку на рынке ,где торгует фруктами и овощами. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы увеличить товарооборот. Погасть кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Marifat B. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. She is 35 years old, married and has four children. Her husband is away working in Russia and so she is running the household and providing for her family all by herself. In order to make ends meet Marifat has to work a lot by selling produce at the local market. To expand her business and increase profits she want to take out this loan. Marifat is planning to pay back the loan in the next 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Expanding inventory to increase profits

loans.name: Mehpara

texts.en: Mehpara (her brother is pictured) is single. She is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town, settled in the Fuzuli region of Kurdmahmudlu village. She was born in 1978. 5 years ago, she started this business. Now she plans to buy 3 calves to fatten for sale that is why she is applying for a loan of 950 AZN.

loans.use: to buy 3 calves to fatten for sale

loans.name: Margret

texts.en:
Margret P. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Margret is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a builder. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a house for rent.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Build a house for rent

loans.name: Sharbat

texts.ru: Одинаев Шарбат житель района Абдурахмони Джоми. Возрст 40 лет, женат и имеет шестерых детей. Имеет средне-техническое образование. Использует специальность в бизнесе. Работает сварщиком. Делает печки и другие изделия из металла , а так же работает с деревом. Свои изделия продает на рынке , а так же делает их на заказ.Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы закупить материал. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Является основным кормильцем семьи , поэтому он хочет увеличить свой бизнес.
texts.en:
Sharbat O. lives in the Abdurahmon Jomi region. He is 40 years old, married and has six children. Sharbat has a technical school degree as a welder and uses his skills to support his family. He makes ovens and other equipment out of metal, and works with wood as well. Sharbat sells the ovens at the local market and also makes them to order. He wants to take out this loan to purchase raw materials and he is planning to pay it back in the next 12 months. Sharbat is the main provider for his family so he is very interested in expanding his welding business to increase profits.

Translated from Russian by Anya Lyuksyutova, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of raw materials

loans.name: Yvette

texts.fr: Dame B. Yvette, est née le 13 Janvier 1977 à Cotonou. Originaire de Porto-Novo, capitle politique du BENIN. Elle fréquenta jusqu'en classe de de CM2 avant d'abandonner. Elle alla ensuite en apprentissage de couture pour 5 ans. Elle reçût son diplôme de fin de formation et exerce son métier jusqu'à ce jour. Parrallèlement, elle vend de divers articles: les conserves, farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner en farine de manioc, cuire dent artisanal, galettes. Mariée à LOKOSSOU Janvier, elle a 4 enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yvette B. was born January 13, 1977, in Cotonou. She is originally from Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin. She went to school until the 5th grade, when she left school. She then went to train in dressmaking for 5 years. She received her certificate of completion and has been practicing this occupation until now. At the same time, she sells miscellaneous items: canned foods, cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks. She seeks this third loan to grow her business. She plans to stock up on cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, cakes. She is married to Janvier Lokossou and has 4 children.

Translated from French by Sherry W., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: to buy 1 bag of cassava root flour, traditional toothpicks, 100 cakes

loans.name: Fatima

texts.fr: Dame O. Fatima est née le 17 Juin 1934 à ADJOHOUN une ville du département de l’OUEME. Elle est veuve depuis 20 ans et à sa charge 5 enfants dont 3 filles et 2 garçons tous scolarisés. Elle exerce l’activité de la vente de divers (savons, sucre et tomate en boîte, détergents, des cartes de recharges téléphonique etc.) dans son domicile à Gankpodo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou où elle vit depuis plus de 30 ans. Elle   va s’approvisionner régulièrement à Tokpa (marché international du BENIN). Elle est à son 4ième crédit et sollicite maintenant un crédit pour renforcer son activité.
texts.en:
Mrs. Fatima O. was born on June 17, 1934 in Adjohoun, a town in the Oueme district. She has been a widow for 20 years and is responsible for 5 children, three girls and 2 boys, all enrolled in school. She sells various items (soap, sugar, tinned tomatoes, detergent, rechargeable telephone cards, etc.) out of her home in Gankpodo, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Cotonou, where she has lived for 30 years. She makes regular trips to Tokpa (the international market of Benin) to stock up on merchandise. She is on her fourth loan and is asking for this loan so as to bolster her business.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of various items and rechargeable telephone cards

loans.name: Phy

texts.en:
Mrs. M. is 41 years old and grows rice in Chreykrim Village in Pursat Province. Her husband sells carving wood, transporting it to customers' homes, using a buffalo cart as transport. Her family relies on farming rice and selling carving wood. She has four children, all of whom are single and live in the family's home. Two daughters are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh and two others are in school.

To alleviate her farming work, M. would like to ask for a loan to purchase one young ox and a buffalo to use for farming business and for her husband's business. She expects the loan will help to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to purchase one young ox and a buffalo to use for her farming business

loans.name: Frida

texts.fr: Dame C. Frida est née le 28/02/1987 à Dangbo dans l'ouémé dont il est originaire. Elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM2. Après l'obtention du Certificat d'Etude Primaire (C.EP, elle abandonna les classes au profit des petites activités de vente de nourriture et de vêtements qu'elle faisait parrallèlement aux études. Finalement elle opta pour la vente d'akassa à base de jus pimenté aux poissons frits,appelée communément "moyo". Depuis 6 mois elle s'est mise dans le commerce de vente de bijoux et d'habits prêt à porter qu'elle vend sur commande faite par les clients. C'est en vue de renforcer ces activités, qu'elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt.
texts.en:
Mrs. Frida C. was born on February 28, 1987 in Dangbo in the Ouémé district, where she is from. She went to school up to grade 5. After having received her Certificate of Primary Studies (CPP) she left her classes to sell food items and clothing which she was doing at the same time as studying. Finally, she chose to sell "akassa" with fried fish and hot pepper sauce, commonly called "mojo". Six months ago, she went over to selling costume jewelry and ready-to-wear which she sells on orders received from her customers. It is with the intent of bolstering these businesses that she is requesting her third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchasing of 1/2 sack of maize (corn) and 10 outfits for children and adults

loans.name: Dupe

texts.en: Dupe E. is 38 years old and married with a child. She sells frozen foods such as beef, fish, and turkey. Dupe purchases her frozen foods in small quantities. She is requesting for the loan amount of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more frozen foods to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more frozen foods to sell

loans.name: Julienne

texts.fr: Dame O. Julienne est née en 1969 à Abomey Calavi. Originaire de Igolo dans l'Ouémé, elle a fréquenté jusqu'en classe de CM1. Elle a été forcée d'abandonner les classes par sa tutrice, et aida celle-ci dans la vente de divers articles: conserves, pates alimentaires, et autres biens de consommation. A 15 ans environs, elle s'est mise à son propre compte avec la vente d'oeufs frais pour laquelle elle est ambulante. Elle a exercé cette activité pendant des années. Aujourd'hui, elle est semi-grossiste dans le domaine. Elle achète des plateaux d'oeufs  qu'elle livre à crédit aux détaillants. Elle sollicite ce 3ème prêt pour renforcer son activité. Elle compte s'approvisionner  uniquement en plateaux d'oeufs frais.
texts.en:
Mrs. Julienne O. was born in 1969 in Abomey Calavi. Coming from Igolo in the Ouémé district, she attended school up to grade 4. She was obliged by her guardian to leave school and help with selling various items: tinned goods, pasta, and other consumables. At around 15 years of age, she began on her own, selling fresh eggs door-to-door. She was in this business for some years. Today, she is a semi-wholesaler in this sphere. She buys trays of eggs which she places on credit with retailers. She is requesting this, her third loan, to bolster her business. She is intending to buy fresh eggs only by the tray.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: buying 75 trays of fresh eggs

loans.name: Mavluda

texts.ru: Рузматова Матлюба проживает  в городе Курган-Тюбе. Возраст 50 лет, замужем и имеет двоих детей. Имеет высшее образование . Работает бухгалтером . Кроме того уже 15 занимается торговлей одежды. Обратилась к нам за кредитом для того, чтобы использовать его в бизнесе и с помощью него увеличить товарооборот.Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.
texts.en:
Mavluda R. lives in Qurgan-Tube. She is 50 years old is married and has 2 children. Mavluda has a college education. She works as an accountant. In addition to this, she has been selling clothing for 15 years. Mavluda has turned to us for a loan and will use it for her business and with the loan’s help will increase her inventory. She plans to pay back her loan over 12 months.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase inventory

loans.name: Miech

texts.en:
Mr. P. is a rice farmer who lives in Orumchang Village in Pursat Province. He grows rice that is the source of income to support his family. He is married to Saun and has six children, four of whom are married and have left home to live independently. Two single children live in the family's home and attend school. For another source of income, he plants sugarcane to sell.

P. and his wife are experienced farmers and succeed with their business. To alleviate his work and improve their income, P. would like to ask for a loan to purchase an oxen-cart to use as transportation for his farming business.

loans.use: to purchase an oxen-cart for his farming

loans.name: Mathias

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo le capital politique du BENIN, monsieur K. Mathias est né à Adjohounn le 29 Juillet 1978. Il est marié à HOUNNOU Rose qui lui a fait deux enfants de sexe différent. L’aînée est au CI et le benjamin n’a pas encore l’âge d’être scolarisé. Il est menuisier de profession. Il a son atelier de menuiserie à Midombo un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou  où il fabrique et vend des meubles de toute sorte. Il va acheter le bois (principale matière première qui rentre dans ses fabrications) à Savè ou  Parakou deux villes du nord BENIN. Il est à son troisième crédit et sollicite maintenent un crédit.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mathias K. was born in Adjohounn on July 29, 1978. He is married to Rose Hounnou, who has given him two children, a son and a daughter. The eldest girl is in pre-school, while the youngest boy is not yet school age. Mathias is a carpenter by trade. He has his workshop in Midombo, an area on the outskirts of the city of Cotonou, where he manufactures and sells furniture of all sorts. He goes to Savè or Parakou, two towns in northern Benin, to buy wood, the primary material with which he works. The loan he is now seeking will be Mathias’ third.

Translated from French by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of wood and hardware

loans.name: Iyere

texts.en: Iyere I. is 24 years old and single. He has a salon, where he creates lovely hairstyles for his customers. He also sells hair materials and drinks, to keep the customers busy while waiting for their hair to be done. He is requesting a loan of N40,000 (US $275) to purchase more hair materials and drinks to sell. He says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more hair materials and drinks to sell

loans.name: Hudoidod

texts.ru: Муродов Худойдод житель района Бохтар. Возраст 28 лет, женат и имеет троих детей. Образование среднее. Имеет восьмилетний стаж работы в животноводстве. Хочет получить кредит для того, чтобы купить бычка и комбикорма для животных. Кредит сможет погашать в течение 12 месяцев. Жена у него домохозяйка , но она помогает ему ухаживать за животными.
texts.en:
Hudoidod M. is a resident of the Bohtar region. He is 28 years old and has 3 children. Hudoidod has a high school education. He has 8 years of experience in raising livestock. He would like to take out a loan in order to purchase a calf and feed for his animals. He will be able to pay back the loan over 12 months. Hudoidod’s wife is a homemaker, but she helps him to take care of the animals.

Translated from Russian by Sabina Holzman, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a calf and feed

loans.name: Ayyub

texts.en:
Ayyub (his wife is pictured) is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan, Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Bala Bahmanli village. He is married and has 3 children. 
Ayyub was born in 1954. This family has been in the dairy business for 10 years. Now they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy 2 cows.

loans.use: to buy 2 cows

loans.name: Aîcha

texts.fr: Née le 25 Mai 1975 à Bassila une ville du Département de l'ATACORA du nord BENIN, dame M. Aîcha est veuve depuis 10 ans et à sa charge un garçon et une fille tous scolarisés. L'aîné est au CM1 et la benjamine au CI à l'école primaire publique de Sègbèya, un quartier populaire de la ville de Cotonou où dame M. vit depuis 7 ans avec ses enfants. Elle vend des sacs de charbon en gros des divers et des tissus. Elle va s'approvisionner en charbon à Parakou, une ville du nord BENIN. Elle est à son troisième crédit.
texts.en:
Born on May 25, 1975 in Bassila, a town in the Atacora District in the north of Benin, Mrs. Aîcha M. has been a widow for 10 years and is raising a son and a daughter, both enrolled in school. The older is in 4th grade and the younger in kindergarten in the public primary school of Sègbèya, a densely populated neighborhood of the city of Cotonou, where Mrs. M. has been living for 7 years with her children. She sells sacks of charcoal in bulk, diverse items, and cloth. She buys her charcoal in Papakou, a town in the north of Benin. She is on her third loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of sacks of charcoal and various items for re-sale

loans.name: Prum

texts.en:
Mrs. N. is a rice farmer who lives in Kampongsvay Village in the Kampong Thom Province. She grows rice twice a year, during the rainy and dry seasons. She has been farming since 2000, while her husband, Mr. Tha is a veterinarian and works in the local area. N. has five children, two of whom are married staying with the family's home and three others are single. One son is employed as a driver in Phnom Penh City and one other runs a business of carpentry. 

Now, she would like to ask for a loan to pay for renting a tractor to plow the farmland for dry season and the remaining amount she plans to use for her daughter's business of carpentry.

loans.use: to pay for renting a tractor to plow farmland for dry season

loans.name: Queen

texts.en: Queen O. is married with six children. She has a grinding machine that she uses to grind foodstuffs such as grains, maize for making pap, and beans. She learned this business from her sister. She plans to purchase two more grinding machines and hire an assistant in order to serve her increasing number of customers efficiently. To purchase the machines, she is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700). She says thanks to all who made this loan possible.

loans.use: To purchase two additional milling machines for her business

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: To buy basic supplies for arts and crafts

loans.name: Mohchehra

texts.ru: Акрамова Мохчехра жительница города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 28 лет , замужем и имеет двоих детей.Семь лет занимается торговлей . Торгует одеждой на рынке города КУрган-тюбе. Для завоза сезонного товара и увеличения ассортимента планирует получить кредит , сроком на 12 месяцев. Хочет привезти  зимний товар.
texts.en:
Mohchehra A. lives in the town of Kurgan-tube. She is 28 years old, married and has two children. She has been in the retail business for seven years. She sells clothing on the market of Kurgan-tube. Mohchehra decided to apply for a loan for a term of 12 months to bring in seasonal clothing and increase inventory circulation. She want to buy winter merchandise.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase commodity circulation

loans.name: Elburus

texts.en:
Elburus (his wife is pictured) was born in 1958. He is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Bala Bahmanli village.
Seven years ago they started this business. Now they need a loan of 950 AZN to buy 2 calves to fatten for sale. Elburus has 5 children.

loans.use: to buy 2 calves to raise and resell

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 60 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a retired civil servant. She sells sarongs, and she hopes to increase her stock. She is requesting a loan of N140,000 (US $975) to purchase more sarongs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more sarongs to sell

loans.name: Henriette

texts.fr: Originaire de Porto-Novo la capital politique du BENIN, dame H. Henriette est née en 1965 à Hlacomey un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou où elle vit actuellement avec son mari du nom de SAGBO Prosper un mécanicien  moto et ses deux filles dont la benjamine seule est scolarisée et est en classe de CE2. Elle vend des torchons, des serviettes, des plastiques et des habits pour enfants. Elle distribue certains de ses produits à ses clientes et va après trois jours recupérer ses fonds. Elle va s'approvisionner régulièrement au NIGERIA. Elle est à son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
A native of Porto-Novo, the political capital of Benin, Mrs. Henriette H. was born in 1965 in Hlacomey, an outlying neighborhood of the town of Cotonou, where she lives at present with her husband, Prosper Sagbo, a motorcycle mechanic, and her two daughters, of whom only the younger is enrolled in school, in 3rd grade. She sells floor cloths, napkins, plasticware, and clothing for children. She distributes certain of her products to her customers and goes to get paid three days later. She goes regularly to stock up in Nigeria. This is her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchase of floor cloths, napkins, plasticware, and outfits for children

loans.name: Suzanne

texts.fr: Née en 1956 à Adjohoun un village du sud BENIN dont elle est originaire dans Département de l'OUEME, dame Z. Suzanne est mère de trois enfants dont deux garçons et une fille tous scolarisés. L'aîné est à l'université et les deux autres enfants sont au collège. Elle est mariée à HANTO Samuel un vendeur de bois avec qui elle vit depuis 32 ans à Agbato un quartier périphérique de la ville de Cotonou. Elle mène depuis 15 ans l'activité de la vente de condiments et d'huile d'arachide et de palme dans le grand marché international du BENIN (Tokpa). Elle va s'approvisionner dans des marchés locaux à l'interieur du pays. Elle est à son deuxième crédit.
texts.en:
Born in 1956 in Adjohoun, a village in the south of Benin where she comes from, in the Oueme district, Mrs. Suzanne Z. is the mother of three children, two sons and a daughter, all enrolled in school. The oldest is at university and the two others are in high school. She is married to Samuel Hanto, a seller of wood, with whom she has lived for 32 years in Agbato, an outlying neighborhood of the city of Cotonou. For 15 years, she has been selling condiments and peanut oil and palm oil in the big international market of Benin called Tokpa. She stocks up on her goods in the local open-air markets in the interior of the country. She is on her second loan.

Translated from French by Teresa Kramer, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: purchasing condiments and oil

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica W. sells local brews and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Monica is 27 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have four children, all of whom attend school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a small shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Rahmatullo

texts.ru: Хасанов Рахматулло житель города Курган-тюбе. Возраст 37 лет, женат и имеет четверых детей. Имеет высшее образование. По профессии учитель. Работает в средней школе №9. Кроме этого он занимается животноводством. Планирует получить кредит для того, чтобы купить дополнительно двух или более животных. Погасить кредит сможет в течение 12 месяцев.Это даст возможность увеличить поголовье скота и расширить бизнес.
texts.en:
Rahmatullo H. resides in the city of Qurgan-Tube. He is 37 years old, married and has four children. He finished his higher education and by profession is a teacher who works at a secondary school simply designated "Number Nine." In addition, Rahmatullo raises livestock. He is planning to take out a loan in order to buy two or more additional head of cattle. He will be able to repay the loan over the course of 12 months. This will give him the opportunity to increase his herd and expand his business.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of livestock

loans.name: Cicilia

texts.en:
Cicilia P. sells bread and tea at a restaurant and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Cicilia is 34 years old and is married. Her husband is a businessman. They have five children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to build a small shop.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To build a small shop

loans.name: Zokhra

texts.en: Zohra is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Zobchug village. She is the mother of 5 children. Five years ago she started a dairy business. She was born in 1960. Now she needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy a cow for improving her dairy business.

loans.use: to buy a cow to improve her dairy business

loans.name: Fedelia

texts.en:
Fedelia N. sells beans at the market and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Fedelia is 45 years old and is divorced. She has four children, all of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Monica

texts.en:
Monica J. is currently in the business of selling groundnuts and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Monica is 22 years old and is divorced. She has one child.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand the business

loans.name: Juan

texts.en:
Juan S. sells charcoal and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Juan is 28 years old and is married. Her husband is a teacher. They have two children, both of whom are in school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lula

texts.en:
Lula S. sells green vegetables and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lula is 45 years old and is married. Her husband is a peasant. They have three children, all of whom attend school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Zamaddin

texts.en: Zamaddin was born in 1972. He is is an Internally Displaced Person (IDP) from the Armenian-occupied territory of Azerbaijan Fuzuli town. He is settled in the Fuzuli region of Dilagarda village. He has been in this business for 6 years. He is married and has 2 children. Now he needs a loan of 950 AZN to buy clothes and shoes to resell.

loans.use: to buy clothes and shoes

loans.name: Christine

texts.en:
Christine P. is currently in the business of selling local brew and is requesting a loan to expand her business.  Christine is 39 years old and is widowed.  She has two children, who are both in school.  With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to expand the business.


BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: To expand her business

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en:
Lucia J. is currently in the business of making alcohol and is requesting a loan to expand her business. Lucia is 28 years old and is widowed. She has one child, who is in school. With the profits from her loan, she hopes to expand her business. 

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development; health; education; and human rights and legal services which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions.  In 2007, BRAC started operations in southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: Expand her business

loans.name: Susan

texts.en:
Susan is currently in the business of selling beans and rice at a resturant and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Susan is 28 years old and is widowed. She has 2 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: to expand her business and pay school fees for her children

loans.name: Marcelline

texts.fr:
Madame S. Marcelline vend les produits d’alimentations générales à Cotonou, Benin.  Elle a commencé ce travail depuis 10 ans, et son entreprise va bien, sauf que des prix des articles ont augmente récemment.  Elle sollicite ce troisième crédit pour acheter des boites de conserve, du macaroni, et du riz afin de reconstituer son stock.  Avec ce crédit, elle peut acheter les articles en gros et réaliser plus d’économie.  

Madame S. a 45 ans et elle est mariée avec monsieur ZODEHOUGAN Bienvenu.  Ils ont 4 enfants qui sont tous scolarisés.
texts.en:
Mrs. Marceline S. has been selling staple food in Cotonou, Benin, for 10 years. Her business is doing well, except for the fact that the cost of the products has increased recently. She's seeking this third loan to buy canned food, macaroni, and rice, to replenish her stock. With this loan, she will be able to purchase products wholesale and save more money. Mrs. S. is 45 years old and is married to Mr. Bienvenu ZODEHOUGAN. They have four children, who all go to school.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy canned food, macaroni, and rice to replenish her stock

loans.name: Viola

texts.en:
Viola S. is currently in the business of selling beans and rice at the resturant and is requesting a loan to expand the business. Viola is 28 years old and is widowed. She has 6 children and her children go to school. With the extra profits from her loan, she hopes to be able to expand the business.

BRAC's holistic approach to poverty alleviation and empowerment of the poor encompasses a range of core programs in economic and social development, health, education, and human rights and legal services, which are delivered through an extensive network of village organizations. BRAC has become one of the world's largest NGOs as measured by the scale and diversity of its interventions. In 2007, BRAC started operations in Southern Sudan. The microfinance program, which is targeted towards returning war refugees, has already formed 418 village organizations with more than 14,000 women members.

loans.use: expand the business of selling rice and beans

loans.name: Lydia

texts.fr:
Madame A. Lydia vend les boissons et elle sollicite ce troisième crédit afin de renforcer son activité.  Elle dit que son activité ne va pas mal mais elle a vu une mévente à cause de la crise économique.  Malgré cette difficulté, son entreprise est en train d’accroitre, et les crédits qu’elle a déjà reçu ont change son qualité de vie.  Avec ce troisième crédit, elle espère de capitaliser assez de sous pour débuter la vente de divers en gros.

Madame A. a 39 ans et elle est mariée avec monsieur TAMADAHO Boniface.  Ils ont trois enfants, dont deux sont scolarisés.
texts.en:
Mrs. A. Lydia sells beverages, and she's seeking this loan to bolster her business. She says that her business is going well, but she experienced slow sales due to the economic crisis. In spite of this difficulty, her business is growing, and the loans she was previously granted have changed her quality of life. With this third loan, she hopes to capitalize enough money to start various wholesale activities. Mrs. A. is 39 years old and is married to Mrs. Boniface TAMADAHO. They have three children, out of which two go to school.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy and resell beverages

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther O. is 38 years old and married with two children. Her husband sells drinks, and Esther sells used shoes. She purchases the shoes from Cotonou to sell in Benin City. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 (US $350) to purchase more used shoes to sell. She says thanks to Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more used shoes to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en:
Roseline I. is 54 years old and married with six children. She lives in Benin City, Edo State, Nigeria. Her husband sells wood, and Roseline sells foodstuffs such as melon, beans, and rice. She is a LAPO client.

Roseline plans to increase her stock, so she is requesting a loan of N140,000 (US $975) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Mirca

texts.en: Mirca deals in agriculture, namely growing and selling transplants of vegetables such as seedling tomato, melons, peppers, cabbage. This has been his business for 17 years. Together the family manages an acreage. Seedlings and vegetables are sold wholesale and retail in this market in central Chisinau. The loan will be for greenhouse construction and repair. The business was started in 1991. Seventeen years of customer loyalty has proven that this business is profitable. There are competitors in the market, but sales are still going well. The monthly net income in the business season is about 5000-6000 lei.

loans.use: greenhouse construction and repair.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary Agbolahor is 42 years old and married with four children. She sells foodstuffs such as melon. She hopes to give her children a quality education. She is a LAPO client.

In order to stock her shop with more products to sell, Mary is requesting a loan of N140,000 (US $975) to purchase more foodstuffs. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Emilio

texts.es:
Emilio tiene un taller de  carpintería donde elabora muebles  y también hace arreglo de muebles.
Su vivienda y taller se encuentran ubicados en la zona de Alto de Villa San Antonio de la Ciudad de La Paz.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (madera, venesta, cola y clavos)
Es la sexta ve que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial lo califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Emilio es una persona muy responsable y así lo ha demostrado durante  estos años. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2004.
texts.en:
Emilio has a carpenter's shop where he makes furniture and also repairs furniture.

His home and his shop are located in the region of Alto de Villa San antonio in the city of La Paz.

This loan will be used to purchase materials (wood, plywood, glue and nails).

This is the sixth time he is requesting a loan through Impro (Kiva Field Partner). His credit hisotry qualifies him as a Client 1, which means that he has made his payments on time.

Emilio is a very responsible person, as he has demonstrated these past years. He has been a client of Impro (Kiva Field Partner) since the year 2004.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase wood, plywood, glue and nails for his carpentry business.

loans.name: Felicia

texts.en: Felicia O. is 50 years old and married with eight children. She sells yams and kerosene. She is requesting a loan of N50,000 (US $350) to purchase more yams and kerosene to sell. Felicia says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and kerosene to sell

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en: Dorcas L. is 57 years old and is a widow with four children. She sells foodstuffs such as beans, melon, and onions. She is a LAPO client. Dorcas is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.es:
Ernestina se dedica a la costura de sombreros y trabaja con su esposo; vende sus productos en un puesto que tiene en la calle Isaac Tamayo de la Ciudad de La paz 
Vive en la zona de Las Lomas  de la ciudad de La Paz, tiene dos hijos en edad escolar.
El crédito será destinado para la compra de materia prima (tela, yute, hilo)
Es la décima primera vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Ernestina makes sombreros and she works with her husband. They sell their products from a stand they have on the street named Isaac Tamayo in the city of La Paz.

She lives in the region of la Lomas in the city of La Paz, and she has two children that are school aged.

The loan will be used to purchase materials (fabric, string, threat).

This is the eleventh time she is requesting a loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Her credit history qualifies her as Client 1, meaning she has payed her credit on time in the past.

Her great will to work have given her the opportunity to access this loan, as she is a responsible woman.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fabric, string, thread, lining, to make sombreros for the business.

loans.name: Nelly

texts.es:
Nelly tiene una tienda de abarrotes donde vende refrescos, azucar fideo y otros.
Su negocio y domicilio se encuentra ubicados en la zona de Bello Horizonte de la Ciudad de La Paz 
El crédito será destinado para la compra de mercadería (arroz, fideo, refrescos, azúcar).
Es la Séptima vez que solicita un crédito en Impro, su historial la califica como cliente 1 es decir con buen cumplimiento en el pago de su crédito.
Las ganas de trabajar le dan la oportunidad de acceder a este crédito ya que es una persona responsable.
texts.en:
Nelly runs a convenience store where she sells soft drinks, sugar, pasta and other items.

Her business and home are located in the region of Bello Horizonte in the city of La Paz.

The loan will be used to purchase merchandise (rice, pasta, soft drink, sugar).

This is the seventh time she is requesting a loan from Impro (Kiva Field Partner). Her credit history qualifies her as Client 1, meaning that she has payed her past loans on time.

Her willingness to work has given her the opportunity to have this loan, as she is a responsible person.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase rice, pasta, and sugar for her convenience store.

loans.name: Linda

texts.en: Linda O. is a graduate of the University of Port Harcourt, Nigeria. She is 33 years old and married with three children. She sells baby clothes. Because she plans to increase her stock, Linda is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more baby clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Ana

texts.es: Ana tiene 47 años, es casada, tiene dos hijos, de los cuales, uno de ellos ya vive fuera de casa. Los padres de Ana fueron agricultores, cultivaban todo tipo de hortalizas y ella les ayudaba, pero por iniciativa de su esposo, hace como 2 años atrás se dedica a sembrar flores, y les va muy bien, sobre todo en época de semana santa y en el mes de octubre, que cotizan las flores a un mayor precio, que le permite ganar al doble de su inversión; y en temporadas cuando están más baratas prefiere hacer secar el fruto para que se conviertan en semillas, y las clasifica para venderlas a un mejor precio. Por ello, cuando se pasa el tiempo del buen precio prefiere  hacerlas secar y no venderlas en flor, de ese modo las almacena para venderlas a mayor precio como semilla. Asimismo, comenta que cultivar flores requiere de mucha inversión y sobre todo en la cosecha, requieren de mucho cuidado, y aún más para su transporte a la ciudad. Ana viene trabajando por quinta vez con Microfinanzas Prisma, y todo este tiempo pagó puntualmente. El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizante para volver a sembrar los tan demandados claveles, ya que tiene la semilla lista.
texts.en:
Ana is 47 years old, she is married, and she has two children, of whom one of them lives away from home. Ana's parents were agriculturers, cultivating all types of crops and she helped them. But it was her husband's initiative that about 2 years ago she started growing flowers. It has been going very well, especially during Easter and in October when they sell their flowers at a better price, permitting them to earn twice their investment. During this season they are the cheapest and she prefers to dry the fruits to make them into seeds, and she prepares them to sell them at a better price. When it is out of season she prefers so dry them and not sell the flowers, and this way she can stock up and sell them as seeds instead. She says that growing flowers requires a large investment, especially for the harvest. They require so much attention, just in the transportation to the city. Ana is currently on her fifth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma (Kiva Field Partner), and all this time she has repaid her loans on time. The loan requested will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer to be able to plant again the very popular carnations, especially now that the seed is ready.


Translated from Spanish by Erika Lindig, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase fertilizer for her flowers.

loans.name: Idemudia

texts.en: Idemudia O. is 30 years old and married with two children. Her husband is a commercial driver. Idemudia sells foodstuffs such as yams, plantains, and gari (a popular food made from cassava tubers). She is requesting a loan of N40,000 (US $275) to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. Idemudia says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and plantains to sell

loans.name: Artemio

texts.es: Artemio tiene 56 años, es soltero y vive solo, ocasionalmente lo visitan su hermana y sus sobrinos que se quedan por unos días. La única actividad que conoce desde niño es la agricultura, ha sembrado casi toda su vida hortalizas, y cuando su hermana, que también siembra lleva su carga en un camión, él se une a esa carga para de ese modo repartirse los gastos del flete (transporte). Artemio se levanta a las 4.00am, prepara sus alimentos, da de comer a sus cuyes y eso de las 9:00am ya está en marcha con dirección a su chacra. Todos los viernes se dedica a cosechar y luego sumerge en el rió para lavar las zanahorias, lechugas o espinacas, luego las pone en canastas, si son espinacas y si son zanahorias en costales, y eso de las 3.00 de la mañana, todos los sábados, las transporta para amanecer en la ciudad. Esta actividad es consecutiva para él, y para  todos los que siembran hortalizas, además le es muy rentable, sobre todo en los meses de enero a marzo, después bajan los precios. El es cliente por sexta vez de Microfinanzas Prisma, y no ha tenido problemas en pagar sus cuotas a tiempo. El dinero que ha solicitado es para abonar sus chacras de espinacas y  flores, considera que le costará aproximadamente entre 1300 a 1500 soles, por lo que aumentará al dinero del préstamo.
texts.en:
Artemio is 56 years old. He is single and he lives alone. He is occasionally visited by his sister and his nephews who usually stay for a few days. He has been farmer his whole life. He and his sister grow vegetables. She usually takes her products in her truck, and also takes Artemio’s products with her so they can share their freight expenses. Artemio wakes up at 4 am every morning. He prepares his food, feeds his guinea pigs and, around 9 am he is already heading to the farm. Every Friday, he harvest his items and then he goes to the river to wash the carrots, lettuce, spinach, and then he puts the spinach in baskets, the carrots in sacks. Every Saturday, around 3 am, he transports them to the city. This activity is very important to him, as it is to every person who harvests vegetables. Besides, it is very profitable, especially during the months of January and March, as after that season the prices always drop. This is the sixth time he requests for a loan from Microfinanzas Prisma, and he has never had a problem making his payments. The money requested will be used to purchase fertilizers for his spinach and flowers farm. He believes he will need around $400 to $475. This is the reason why this time, he is requesting for a higher loan.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for his crops

loans.name: Penthioum Maurel Group

texts.fr:
http://sem-fund.org/carabane.php

Nous somme un groupe de femmes qui s'exercent dans la commercialisation de prosuits de pêche transformés(poisson sec, huître, crevettes et autres fruits de mers séchés). Nous achetons les produits frais que nous transformons nous même(sèchage, fumage, salage) et que nous allons vendre dans les marchés hebdomadaire qui se tiennent dans les différends points de vente de la région de Casamance. Nous voulons lutter contre la pauvreté et le manque d'emploi qui caractèrisent notre zone qui a eu un retard considérable en matière de développement à cause du conflit armé qui a longtemps sévit ici. Mais depuis bientôt cinq ans, les activités ont repris et chaque personne essaye de faire une activité pour sortir de la pauvreté. C'est pour cela, grâce à notre partenaire qui est le SEM, nous venons solliciter un prêt auprès de Kiva pour que nous puissions travailler dignement
texts.en:
We are a group of women working in the fish industry (our products include dried fish, oysters, prawns and other seafood). We buy fresh produce and process it ourselves (drying, smoking, salting) to sell at the weekly markets held in different parts of Casamance. We wish to fight against the poverty and unemployment typical in our region which is underdeveloped following years of armed conflict. However, business has picked up in the last five years and everybody works hard in order to escape from poverty. For this reason, thanks to our partner SEM, we seek a loan from Kiva to allow us to work with respect.

Translated from French by Holly Miller, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of seafood products to sell in weekly markets

loans.name: Bruma

texts.en: Bruma deals in the sales of clothing for adults in Criuleni city. He has been in business 9 years. His store has a rich assortment of sports suits, jeans for women, pants, pajamas, sweaters, socks, and hats. Merchandise is purchased in Odessa. The business is initiated in 1999, enables the coordinator of the business. Bruma has had three loans from Microinvest. His 9 years of client activity has proven that this business is profitable. Bruma procures supplies from Odessa, even though the roads are bad. There are many competitors. His monthly net income is about 3000-4000 lei. The loan is directed towards strengthening his business, because the client does not have other sources of income.

loans.use: Improving the offering of goods

loans.name: Naomi

texts.en: Naomi A. is 26 years old and married. She has no children. Naomi sells women's clothes and baby clothes. She plans to increase her stock to meet the demands of her customers. Therefore, she is requesting a loan of N100,000 (US $700) to purchase more clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more women's and baby clothes to sell

loans.name: Omosigho

texts.en: Omosigho O. is 42 years old and married with 6 children. She makes local soap, called soda in Nigeria. She also sells palm oil. Beside her in the picture are containers for giving the local soap a round shape. She is requesting a loan amount of N60,000 to purchase more palm oil and materials for making the local soap. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil and materials for making soap

loans.name: Uso

texts.en: Uso G. is 49 years old and married with 7 children. He has a shop where he sells provisions like noodles, sugar, detergent and drinks. Uso is requesting a loan amount of N40,000 to purchase more provisions and drinks to sell. He says thank you to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en: Elizabeth O. is 40 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells palm oil, and the demand for her palm oil is high. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more palm oil to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more palm oil to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret O. is 46 years old and married with 2 children. She sells provisions, drinks and foodstuffs. The profits from this business are used to support her family. She hopes to stock her shop with more goods. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase more provisions, drinks and foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva leaders for their financial support

loans.use: To purchase more drinks, provision and foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Basiratu

texts.en: Basiratu O. is 52 years old and married with 4 children. Her husband is a building supervisor. Her eldest daughter has rounded off her secondary school education and she hopes to get her higher education. Beside her in the picture is her eldest daughter. She is requesting a loan amount of N50,000 to purchase more provisions to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more provisions to sell

loans.name: Oghogho

texts.en: Oghogho Airhihenbuwa is 29 years old and married with 3 children. Her husband is a commercial motorcyclist. She is a fashion designer and she also sells children's clothes. She opens her shop Mondays to Fridays. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more children's clothes to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more clothes and shoes to sell

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret I. is 48 years old and married with four children. Her husband is a retired civil servant. She sells yams in wholesale and retail. She hopes to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more yams to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams to sell

loans.name: Margaret
