texts.en: Margaret E. is 37 years old and married with 6 children. Her husband is a motor mechanic. She sells foodstuffs like yams and plantains. She hopes to increase her stock to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more yams and plantains to sell. She says thanks to all kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more yams and plantains to sell

loans.name: Patience

texts.en: Patience O. is 45 years old and married with 5 children. Her husband is a taxi driver. She sells foodstuffs like yams, peppers, crayfish, melons, stockfish and palm oil. She travels to the village to purchase foodstuffs to sell in Benin City. She is requesting a loan amount of N100,000 to purchase more foodstuffs to sell. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase more foodstuffs to sell

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline A. sells packaged pure water. She has a deep freezer that she uses to cool the water to sell. But the demand for her pure water has increased, so she needs another deep freezer to cool more pure water so that she will be able to meet the demands of her customers. She is requesting a loan amount of N70,000 to purchase one deep freezer. She says thanks to all Kiva lenders for their financial support.

loans.use: To purchase one deep freezer

loans.name: Sekolina

texts.fr:
Madame D. Sekolina est une femme âgée de 37 ans qui a pour l’activité la restauration.  Elle sollicite ce troisieme crédit pour acheter du maïs et du riz afin d’augmenter le volume de son activité.   Elle a vu récemment une mévente qui a rendu ses fonds de roulement insuffisant, mais elle a reçu une formation sur la gestion à Alide qui a aidé avec ses affaires.  Elle dit que, a cause des derniers crédits, il y a une augmentation du revenu qui a conduit à une indépendance totale vis-à-vis des fournisseurs.  Dans le futur, elle aimerait mobiliser plus d’épargne pour renforcer le capital.

Madame D. est mariée et mère de quatre enfants.
texts.en:
Mrs Sekolina D. is 37 years old, and her business is food serving. She's seeking this third loan to buy corn and rice to bolster her business. She recently experienced slow sales, which left her with an insufficient working capital. She received management training from the microfinance institution Alidé, and that helped her business. She says that, thanks to the former loans, her revenue grew, so that she is know completely independent from her providers. In the future, she would like to increase her working capital. Mrs. D. is married and the mother of four children.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy corn and rice

loans.name: Nana Obeng

texts.en:
Nana Obeng A. lives in Agogo, a suburb of the Ashanti region, Ghana. His major occupation is crop farming. He's also a professional carpenter and makes all kinds of furniture including dinning sets, beds, chairs and coffins for over 3 years. He recently added coffins to his business to sell within his community after realizing families had to travel long distances to buy coffins for deceased relatives.  

Nana is 51 years old, married and father with seven children. Four of his children have successfully completed senior high school, and the other 3 are still in primary school. Lots of people in the community are amazed with his work and his good health. Nana is happy because he has work to do and is not idle.  
 
Nana requests a loan to buy more wood, nails, and coffins because the demand is very high. With the loan, Nana will be resourceful and use the loan wisely in his business so he can continue taking care of his family. He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Nana wants a loan to buy wood, nails, and coffins

loans.name: Richard

texts.en:
Richard O. is a Carpenter. Carpentry has been his major occupation and his primary livelihood for his family for the past ten years. He owns a carpentry shop manufacturing all kinds of furniture work. He is unable to pre-finance most of the orders from his customers because of a lack in adequate working capital. This slows down his work as he has to wait for funds from his customers before he can begin a project and there are often delays. Richard is 31 years old and married with three kids.

He is requesting a loan to purchase useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper etc. to improve his efficiency. He believes his status and income will improve and ensure a good living for his family. His dream is to save money for his kid's education so they can be of a higher social class.

loans.use: To procure useful working tools and furnishing materials like polish, glue, sand paper etc.

loans.name: Stephen

texts.en:
Stephen A. owns a shop selling provisions and plastic products and has been in business for twelve years. He procures his goods from Kumasi in Southern Ghana. His shop is strategically positioned at a junction where a lot of people pass by. Through experience, Stephen knows what products attract his customers and what they want. He is requesting a loan to have a bigger working capital to procure different kinds of goods and expand the size of his shop to  accommodate the variety of new goods. 

Stephen is 53 years old and married with six children, two males and four females. He says his youngest son is currently in  technical school and his adult children have completed school and are working.

loans.use: To buy provision and plastic products in bulk

loans.name: Adelaide Eleonore

texts.fr: K. Adelaide Eleonore s’est mariée avec GANSOU Léon. Ils ont quatre enfants ensemble, âgés de 36, 34, 33, et 23, tout scolarisés. Elle est née le 18 décembre 1955. Elle vend les tissus en crédit. Ses clients la rendent visitent pour donner de l’argent chez elle, et ils reviennent quand le commande arrivera. Elle les vend depuis 20 ans, et elle achète au Dantokpa. Elle a également un autre commerce de loyer sa maison aux locataires. Dans le futur, elle voudrait sauver l’argent pour acheter plus des tissus, et elle voudrait construire une autre maison pour loyer.
texts.en:
Adelaide Eleonore K. is married to Léon GANSOU. They've had four children together, who all went to school and are now 36, 34, 33, and 23 years old, respectively. She was born on December 18, 1955. She sells fabrics cash in advance : her customers come to order and pay, and then come back when the order is ready. She's been selling fabrics, that she buys at the Dantokpa market, for 20 years. She also rents her house to tenants. In the future, she would like to constitute a working capital to purchase fabrics wholesale. She would also like to build a new home to rent.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase and resell fabrics

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary O. sells textile materials, shoes, bags and a variety of other accessories and has been in business for over ten years. She sells in a store at a junction. She buys her goods from big cities like Kumasi and Accra in Ghana. She lives with her family in a town called Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Mary is forty-two years old and married with four children, 3 girls, 1 boy. Two of her children are in their senior year of high school with the youngest in upper primary school. Mary’s husband is a teacher. 

Mary wants a loan to buy more bales of textiles to expand her business and sell at nearby markets to do more business.

loans.use: To buy more bales of textiles and accessories

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth W. is a trader of timber products, like plywood, in the community where she lives. Through handwork and self determination, she hires dogma machines from people who cut the timber directly from the bush for her. There has being frequent breakdowns of the machines preventing her from receiving her weekly supply of timber.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan to acquire two dogma machines so she doesn't have to rely on hiring others dogma machines. She plans to employ helpers to assist her in cutting the timber. With this loan, she will be more self-sufficient to meet the demand of her clients who travel from the city to buy her timber. Timber is processed into wood products and used for a variety of crafts. Elizabeth wants the best for her children and to cater to all their school needs, which will be more possible with your help.  

She is thirty-eight years old, married with three children. Her two oldest are in high school studying reading, visual arts and science, while the youngest is breastfeeding.

loans.use: Elizabeth wants the loan to buy two dogma machines to cut timber

loans.name: Akua

texts.en:
Akua K. is a trader of plantains and other food items. She buys food from farmers in her community and nearby towns. She treks to Accra, Ghana to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Akua has been in business for over fifteen years and has lots of experience. She says when plantains becomes scarce, she resorts to fruits like pears, oranges, and pineapples.  Akua wants a loan to buy plantains on a large scale so she can supply to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.
 
Akua is thirty–seven years old, married with five children– one girl and four boys.  Four of her children are in basic school and the youngest is still crawling. Akua’s husband is a commercial driver. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: Paul

texts.en:
Paul K. repairs broken refrigerators to support his family. He has been in business for seven years now and has trained three apprentices. He provides delivery and servicing of refrigerators, which has attracted lots of customers when their fridge needs repair. Paul knows his strategy is good because it enables him to make increased sales over a short period through prompt service and delivery. He rents a store for his work in the community where he lives. 

He is requesting a loan to buy more refrigerator parts. He also hopes to increase his savings to support his wife’s business so she can be of support when they have a baby. Paul is twenty seven years old and married.  He is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased stock of refrigerators parts

loans.name: Dora

texts.en: Dora A. is 32 years old. She is married with two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children are currently in the basic school. Dora’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates food crops such as cassava, plantains, etc., in the community in which they live. Dora is into trading. She sells provisions like milk, sugar, bread and vegetables like tomatoes, peppers, onions, etc., and all kinds of cooking oil. Dora sells in a small kiosk in front of her house. She has been in business for three years. Dora says she buys her goods from Kumasi and sometimes from the wholesalers in her community. It is Dora’s dream to expand her business by acquiring a bigger store to sell in. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk from the big cities where the cost is more economical.

loans.use: To buy provisions, vegetables and cooking oil for resale

loans.name: Juliana

texts.en: Married with children, Juliana O. is 24 years old. She sells home products like cooking utensils, plastic bowls, buckets and plates. She makes her sales by ‘hawking’, which is door-to-door sales. Juliana is an achiever and her focus is to save enough to build a shop to house her goods. She wants to use the loan to buy increased stock of plastic materials and kitchen sets to serve her customers. She is convinced that this would help her to overcome competition and also save enough for her kids to stay in school, because that has been her daily prayer. Juliana says she would be grateful for your assistance; she is in the photograph taken after we visited her.

loans.use: Increased her stock of kitchen sets to serve her customers and overcome competition.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris B. is 37 years old. She is married and has given birth to three children, all girls. She says all her children are in the junior high school. Doris’s husband is a farmer. He cultivates tomatoes and fruits such as watermelon. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. She is a trader. She trades mainly in plantains and maize. She buys her stuff from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She treks to Accra to sell to local "chop bar" (restaurant) operators. Doris has been in business for two years. She says when plantains becomes scarce, she then swings to the maize market. Doris wants to buy plantains on large scale so that she can supply to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To procure plantains and maize in bulk

loans.name: Vida

texts.en: Vida O. is 34 years old, married and a mother with four children. Currently three of them are in school while the last born is still breastfeeding. She has been a food vendor for two years now in the Agogo community school where she lives with her family. She sells rice with stew; this food is mostly purchased by the schoolchildren during their break time. Vida says the demand for her food has extended to the people in the community, so when she closes in the morning she prepares more for the afternoon and sells it in the community market. Vida wants the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal and others. She is convinced that the loan would help her increase her stock, so in the event of a price hike she still would have resources to cook food. Vida wants to use the proceeds to supports her kids in their educations. She says she would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: to buy food stuffs like rice, cooking oil, charcoal, spices and meats, etc.

loans.name: Sylvie

texts.fr: A. Sylvie s’est mariée avec PAMPHILE Gbede. Elle a 4 enfants, âges de 16, 11, 9, et 3. Elle est née vers 1963. Elle voudrait un crédit pour renforcer son commerce, la restauration, qu’elle fait depuis 10 ans. Elle cuisine le riz, et l’akassa solide avec sauce (une nourriture traditionnelle béninois a base de la farine de mais). Les gens achètent chez elle pour emporter. Elle aussi vend les boissons fraiches. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait acheter une parcelle pour louer.
texts.en:
Sylvie A. is married to Gbede PAMPHILE. She has four children, age 16, 11, 9, and 3. She was born circa 1963. She's seeking a loan to bolster her food serving business, which she's been running for 10 years. She cooks rice and prepares "akassa" with sauce (a traditional beninese food, made out of corn flour). People buy her dishes to go. She also sells cool drinks. In the future, she would like to purchase a plot of land to rent.

Translated from French by Patrick Stadelmann, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food for her food serving business

loans.name: Ernestina

texts.en: Ernestina A. is 54 years old. She is divorced and the mother of seven children. At the moment, four have completed senior high school. She sells baby clothes, Pampers, powder, napkins, detergents, feeding bottles, etc., through hawking. She balances her stock on her head and walks miles to her customers at their doorsteps to sell. She needs the loan the enable her to inject more capital into the business to make progress. She wants to use the loan to buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil and detergents, to increase her stock and to make more income, to provide her children with a good education. Ernestina says she would be grateful for your assistance. With the loan she wants to save more to rent a store so that her burden of hawking would be minimized. This, she says, would also help her to support her kids at the university level.

loans.use: To buy more supplies of baby clothes, napkins, Pampers, baby oil, detergents and plastic materials

loans.name: Amos

texts.en: Amos K. is 50 years old. He is married and has three children, all boys. Currently, two of his sons are in the senior high school. He lives with his family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Amos is a serious business-minded man. He deals in charcoal. What he does is to buy bags of charcoal from the charcoal producers in the surrounding villages. He then conveys them in big cargo cars to big cities like Accra to distribute. He supplies to people who retail and also to food vendors who uses charcoal a lot. Amos has been in business for six years. It is his dream to buy bags of charcoal to trek to many other places. He wants a loan to help him realize this dream. He says he desires to sponsor all or his children to study to the tertiary (high school and beyond) level.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal

loans.name: Georgette

texts.fr: H. Georgette s’est mariée avec DEGBEVI Jean. Ils ont 2 enfants, 15 ans et 5 ans. Elle est née le 14 Janvier 1971. Elle gère une activité de la vente des arachides grillés ou beurrés. Elle vend également l’huile d’arachides et le sodabi. Elle achète ses arachides a Dantokpa, et elle voyage aux voyages pour acheter l’huile. En ce moment, sa nourriture coute chère. Avec ces autres prêts, elle a pu cesser d’acheter la nourriture en crédit. Elle a eu une formation d’informaticienne. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait ouvrir une kiosque de la photocopie.
texts.en:
Georgette H. is married to Jean DEGBEVI. They have two children, 15 and 5 years old. She was born on January 14, 1971. She manages a business that sells grilled peanuts or peanut butter. She also sells peanut oil and sodabi [West African palm liquor]. She buys her peanuts in Dantokpa, and she travels to buy the peanut oil. At this time her food is expensive. With her previous loans she was able to stop buying food on credit. She has had computer training. In the future she would like to open a photocopy kiosk.


Translated from French by Véronique Fourment, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of peanuts

loans.name: Derrick

texts.en:
Derrick K. H. is 40 years old. He is married with four children. Currently the first two are in the senior high school the remaining two are still in the junior high school. He owns and operates a grocery shop and pharmaceutical shop and sells items like rice, sugar, vegetable oil, bottled water, body and hair creams, skimmed powdered milk etc. Recently a license was issued to him by the Ghana Pharmaceutical Council. So he has the right to sell drugs. He deems it a big opportunity to expand his business to include other items frequently demanded by customers both at the pharmacy shop and the grocery shop. 

H. has being in this business for the past seven years. He wants to use the loan to buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams and pharmaceutical drugs, etc., to increase his inventory. He hopes to improve sales to enable him save more for his children’s educations. His picture was taken when we visited him. Derrick would be grateful for your assistance to improve his business.

loans.use: To buy more bags of rice, bags of sugar, cartons of vegetable oil, boxes of body and hair creams, etc., and pharmaceutical drugs.

loans.name: Kwame

texts.en: Nana Kwame A. is 41 years old. He is married and has six children. two females and four boys. Currently, he says some of his children are in the senior high school while others are in the basic school. He lives with his family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Nana Kwame is a serious business-minded man. He deals both in charcoal and maize. He buys bags of charcoal and maize from the charcoal producers and maize farmers in the surrounding villages. He then conveys them in big cargo cars to big cities like Accra to distribute. He supplies to people who retail and also to food vendors who uses charcoal a lot. Nana Kwame has been in business for three years. It is his dream to buy more bags of charcoal and maize and to be able to trek to many other places. He wants a loan to help him realize this dream. He says he desires to sponsor all his children to study to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and maize

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
La señora Adriana R. R. tiene 48 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, tiene 02 hijos de los cuales 01 depende económicamente de ella.
Adriana se dedica a la venta de leche, al inicio vendía la leche en baldes de casa en casa, con las ganancias obtenidas logro comprarse una carretilla y actualmente tiene su propio triciclo,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
Con el crédito de 2200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
Adriana sueña con tener un pequeño establo.
texts.en:
Adriana R. R. is 48 years old. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. She finished primary school. She has 2 children, but only one of them still depends on her. Adriana sells milk. At first, when she started, she sold milk in buckets, door to door. With the money she made, she was able to purchase a wheelbarrow and currently she owns a 3-wheeler to transport the milk. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras” to purchase balanced food for her cows. She will use this current $700 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, to purchase more cow food. Adriana’s dream is to one day own a small corral.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase balanced food for her cows.

loans.name: Abena

texts.en: Nana Abena Opii is 47 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, both of whom are female. She says one of her daughters has completed senior high school while the other is in the junior high school. She and her family live in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. Nana Abena’s husband works with the forestry commission. She is a farmer as well as a trader. She cultivates plantains and other foodstuffs. She trades mainly in plantains and maize. She buys some of the stuff in addition to what she cultivates from her farm. She buys from farmers in her community and nearby villages. Nana Abena treks to Accra to sell to local "chop bar" (restaurant) operators. She has been in business for over eight years. Nana Abena wants to buy plantains and bags of maize on a large scale so that she can supply to a number of customers. She desires to help her husband sponsor their children to the higher level.

loans.use: To buy plantains and maize in bulk

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en: Wilson A. is 31 years old, he is married and father with three children. One is breastfeeding while the rest are getting schooling. He is an Urvan driver or what we call a Trotro driver, and he uses this for commercial purposes, which generates an income for him to support his household. He has been driving for one year. It is a common misconception that only people with low incomes take the Trotro. Schoolchildren, workers and everyone takes it because it is affordable, as compared to a taxi. But many people also believe that it is better. Wilson says he has had a recent breakdown which is keeping him from making sufficient income to run the business. He requests a loan to buy vehicle parts to mend his car. With the loan he also believes he can make more profits so that within two years he can buy additional cars. This, he believes, would help him in taking care of his kids in school. Wilson would be grateful for your assistance and support.

loans.use: Wilson wants the loan to buy vehicle parts to maintain his commercial car.

loans.name: Alicia Janeth

texts.es:
La señora Alicia Janeth P. B. tiene 37 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Alicia Janeth se dedica a un wawawasi, empezó cuidando algunos  niños, pero poco a poco fue creciendo y ahora tiene muchos  niños a su cargo, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió la construcción del piso y tartajeo de su local.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá  en algunos arreglos de su local y en la construcción de su casa. 
Alicia Janeth tiene el gran sueño de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales y que su negocio crezca mucho más.
texts.en:
Alicia Janeth P. B. is 37 years old; she finished secondary school, and has dependent 2 children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Alicia Janeth runs a Wawa Wasi (children’s daycare center). She started taking care of a few children, but after some time, she managed to take work with many children. She runs this business at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to finish the floor of her business facilities and to pay the workers. With this $250 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will perform more improvements to her business and home. Alicia Janeth’s dream is to see her children become professionals and also to make her Business grow even further.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Make improvements to her business and home.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en: Yaa A. is 45 years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, one boy and a girl. She says her son has completed senior high school and is currently working for a while. She says he will continue his education in due course. The girl however, is in the junior high school. Yaa’s husband is a professional nurse. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. She is a trader. She trades mainly in maize. She buys bags of maize from the farmers in her community and nearby villages. She says city dwellers come to buy with big cargo cars and go to retail to food vendors. Yaa has been in business for over four years. She wants to buy maize on a large scale so that she can supply to the increasing number of her customers and increase her profit margin. She yearns to help her children climb the academic ladder.

loans.use: To procure bags of maize

loans.name: Amalia

texts.es:
La señora Amalia P. S. tiene 49 años es presidenta de su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Victor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3er ciclo de contabilidad, tiene 02 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Amalia se dedica a la venta de ollas, inicio su negocio vendiendo de puerta en puerta, poco a poco se hizo conocida y ahora tiene clientes que llegan a buscarla a su casa, a la vez tiene a su cargo un wawawasi,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en mejorar la infraestructura de su local.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ollas.
Amalia tiene el sueño de construir su casa y viajar a EE.UU.
texts.en:
Amalia P. S. is 49 years old and has 2 dependent children. She is the president of the Community Bank. She took an accountant course. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Amalia sells kitchen supplies. She started her business selling products door to door and now she has clients who go to her house to purchase her products. She also runs a Wawa Wasi (children’s daycare center) at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to make improvement to her business facilities. With this $250 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase more kitchen supplies. Amalia’s dream is to finish building her home and travel to the US.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase kitchen supplies for her business

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary Diana A. is 36 years old. She is married and has one child, a girl. Currently, she says her child is in the basic school. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She says her husband works with the local bank in her community. She deals both in charcoal and maize. She buys bags of charcoal and maize from the local charcoal burners and maize farmers in the surrounding villages. She sells to retailers in her community, mostly to food vendors. Mary has been in business for eight years. It is her dream to buy bags of charcoal and maize and to be able to trek to other towns to supply them. She wants a loan to help her realize this dream. She says she desires to sponsor her child to study to the tertiary level.

loans.use: To buy bags of charcoal and maize

loans.name: Ana María

texts.es:
La señora Ana Maria S. D. tiene 49 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos de los cuales 01 depende económicamente de ella.
Anita se dedica a la compra y venta de ropa al por mayor, el negocio anteriormente perteneció a su hija que por motivos de viaje se lo cedió a ella hace ya 2 años, su negocio lo desarrolla en Trujillo.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para su negocio.
Anita tiene el gran sueño de construir su casa y tener una tienda de abarrotes..
texts.en:
Ana Maria S. D. is 49 years old and she finished secondary school. She has 2 children, one of which still depends on her. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Anita sells and buys clothes as a wholesaler. The business was previously run by her daughter, who moved to another city and left the business to her mother two years ago. She runs the business in Trujillo. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase clothes. With this $125 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase more clothes for her business. Amalia’s dream is to finish building her home and to open a grocery store.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase clothes for her business

loans.name: Cecilia

texts.en: Cecilia K. is a wife and mother with four children. One has successfully completed senior high school, two are still in the senior high school, and the last born is in the junior high school. She is a 45-year-old trader who trades in charcoal. Charcoal is very popular source of energy for cooking in many traditional Ghanaian homes. Through this business, she has added the sale of plantains to the charcoal, realizing that lots of her customer demand it. Cecilia obtains her supply of charcoal and plantains from the surrounding villages of Agogo in the Ashanti region where she lives, and then retails them to her customers. She wants to use the loan to buy more supply of charcoal and bunches of plantains to increase her stock. She believes the loan will enable her to increase her savings to provide for the educational needs of her children, especially the first born who would be entering the university this year. She said she would be grateful for your assistance. Her picture was taken when we spoke to her on her business progress.

loans.use: To buy more supply of charcoal and plantains.

loans.name: Anita Isabel

texts.es:
La señora Anita Isabel H. H. tiene 38 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco H., provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Anita, inicio su negocio vendiendo comida los días domingos en la puerta de su casa, luego cocinando menú todos los días, actualmente  reparte menú a diario a pensionistas, a la vez que cocina para algunos eventos de empresas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal, lo invirtió en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alimentos de primera necesidad para su negocio.
Anita tiene el gran sueño de lograr que sus hijos sean profesionales.
texts.en:
Anita Isabel H. H. is 38 years old and she finished 4th year in secondary school. She has 4 dependent children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco H., province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Anita started her business selling food on Sundays at her front door. After a while, she began to cook a daily menu. Currently, she delivers a daily menu to regular clients and at the same time, she cooks for company events, and she provides a delivery service. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase basic food products. With this $475 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase more basic food products for her business. Anita’s dream is to see her children become professionals.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products for her business

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria Takyi M. is fifty years old and divorced.  She has given birth to three children. One of her children; a boy, is in technical school, one in junior high school and one is in the primary school. Being a single parent, Victoria says it is difficult to provide for the family, all by herself. . She lives with her children in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. Her ex-husband does not help in any way with the children’s upbringing. She is a food vendor. She cooks ‘jollof’ rice, and ocasionally, rice and stew. She buys bags of rice from Kumasi. Victoria has been in this business for over twenty years. Besides selling food, Victoria also sells toilet soap and washing soap.
She wants to buy bags of rice on a larger scale. This will cut down on her costs, as she must now make frequent trips to procure goods for resale.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice in bulk

loans.name: Pelagie

texts.fr: A. Pelagie a 55 ans et 3 enfants, 30, 28, et 5 ans. Le plus âgé est déjà a l’université. Elle est veuve, et elle pratique une activité depuis 25 ans. Au début, elle est allée a Ghana, Togo, et Nigeria pour acheter les sacs et les chaussures. Actuellement, elle prépare les ignames, les bananes, et le piment pour vendre au bord de la rue. Elle achète sa nourriture a Dantokpa. Grace au crédit, elle n’achète plus sur le crédit, et elle a pu mettre l’argent a coté pour acheter le ciment pour construire une maison. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait construire une maison pour louer les chambres.
texts.en:
Pelagie A. is 55 years old and has three children, ages 30, 28, and 5. The eldest is already at university. Ms. A. is a widow and has been working for 25 years. At first, she went to Ghana, Togo, and Nigeria to buy handbags and shoes. Now, she prepares yams, bananas, and chili peppers for roadside sale. She buys her food in Dantokpa. Thanks to this loan, she no longer buys on credit, and she was able to put money aside to buy cement to build a house. In the future, she would like to build a house for renting out the rooms.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Yaw

texts.en: Yaw O. K. is 45 years old, married, and a father of four children who are currently in school. He sells fuel in gallons in the community where he lives. The distance from the village to the big town is quite great, so what he does is buys the fuel in gallons and resells it to the commercial vehicle drivers who plight that road to pick up passengers. Yaw has been in this business for the past three years. He says what he does is risky because he does not have a bigger container to store the fuel; instead he uses smaller gallons which can catch fire. He requests the loan to buy bigger fuel containers so that he can store larger quantities of fuel for his customers. It seems Yaw is the only fuel supplier on that road; therefore the demand for fuel is high. Through this business he has supported two of his kids who are in junior high school. He believes with this loan he would be more resourced to save more in supporting his kids in school. Yaw would be grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: To buy gallons of fuel for supply

loans.name: Carmen Soria

texts.es:
La señora Carmen Soria T. D. C. tiene 60 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito D. Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, tiene 06 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Carmen se dedica a la venta D. desayuno, inicio su negocio vendiendo en un pequeño triciclo, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro alquilar un pequeño puesto en el que ahora venD. también comida y caldos, negocio lo desarrolla en el terminal pesquero D. Víctor Larco.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra alimentos D. primera necesidad para su negocio.
Con el crédito D. 2000 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá  en alimentos D. primera necesidad para su negocio y parte D. el para realizar arreglos en su casa.
Carmen tiene el gran sueño D. viajar a Paita para ver a su hijo que vive allá y lograr terminar D. construir su casa.
texts.en:
Carmen Soria T. D. C. is 60 years old and she finished primary school. She has 6 independent children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Carmen sells breakfast menues. She stated her Business selling food on a small 3-wheeler. With the money she maD., she was able to rent a small place and now she also sells food and soup at the Víctor Larco port. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase basic food products. With this $625 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase more basic food products for her business and to perform home improvements. Carmen’s dream is to travel to Paita to see her son, who lives there, and to finish building her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more basic food products for her business and to perform home improvements

loans.name: Rose

texts.en: Rose A. is thirty-two years old and married with three children, two boys and a girl. Two of her children are currently in junior high school. Her husband is a vegetable farmer. He cultivates mostly tomatoes in the community in which they live. They live in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. Rose is into trading and sells food items like rice, groundnut, cooking oil, and other things. She procures her goods from the northern part of the country where it is more cost-effective. Rose sells on a table top in front of her house. She has been in business for over ten years, and dreams of expanding it by acquiring a bigger store to sell her wares. She wants a loan to procure goods in bulk at every trip.

loans.use: To enlarge her food business and buy more inventory for it

loans.name: We All Na One Group

texts.en:
This is Emma S., Bilkisu S., Musu K. and Rugiatu M.. They named their group We All Na One, a Krio phrase meaning “we are all the same."  The four are local entrepreneurs in the town of Makeni. They have several loans from Kiva through SMT. Most recently, each one of them in the group received a loan of LE 700,000. That loan was a great help as it enabled them to expand their businesses, make more profit, and consequently improve their living conditions. Having repaid their last loan successfully, they have requested a loan for LE 1,000,000 each (with Rugiatu M. receiving a loan for LE 700,000). 

Emma (right) is the leader of the group. She is forty years of age and was born in Port Loko in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and her husband is a diamond miner. They have seven children who are between the ages of six and twenty-one. Emma sells a number of items including ready-to-wear-clothes for children, dishes, cottons and other items she discovers to be in high demand in the market. She has been in this business since her childhood days.

With this new loan, Emma will expand her business. She cannot tell yet exactly how much she will be able to buy as prices keep fluctuating, but she is going to use the loan to buy more of the goods mentioned above to add to the ones she already has in her stall. It is in Freetown where she buys the items she sells. Freetown is about a 390 mile(627.51 kms) round-trip from Makeni. The fare to and from Freetown is LE 24,000.

So far, Emma faces no major challenge in her business that is worth mentioning. Business is going on fine for her. This business is her only source of income and she enjoys being a businesswoman very much. With this loan and the profit it will generate for her, Emma will be able to solve a lot of her problems.

loans.use: To purchase more inventory and expand her business

loans.name: Cecilia Armida

texts.es:
La señorita Cecilia Armida H. R. tiene 55 años es secretaria de su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Idiomas en UNT, carrera que ejerció durante 10 años, por motivos de salud tuvo que dejar de trabajar, no tiene hijos.
Cecilia Armida inicio su negocio vendiendo comida rápida por las tardes, con sus ganancias obtenidas logro incrementar su negocio y ahora tiene su propio restaurante, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de utensilios de cocina
Con el crédito de 1600 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de productos de primera necesidad para su restaurante. 
Cecilia Armida sueña con ampliar más su negocio y viajar a EE.
texts.en:
Cecilia Armida H. R. is 55 years old and studies several Languages at the UNT. She used her skills to work for 10 years, but due to a health problem she had to stop working. She has no children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Cecilia started her business selling fast food in the evening. With the money she made, she was able to improve her business, and now she owns a restaurant at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase kitchen supplies. With this $500 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase basic food products for her business. Cecilia’s dream is to diversify her business and to travel to the US.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase basic food products for her restaurant

loans.name: Céline

texts.fr: A. Céline est née vers 1956 et elle est veuve. Elle a trois enfants de 36, 22, 18, et la benjamine reste encore a sa charge. Elle gère une activité depuis 40 ans. Elle a commencé de vendre la viande fumée a Parakou au nord du Bénin. Actuellement, elle vend les vivres comme le riz, l’huile végétale, l’huile d’arachide, les haricots, les ignames, le mais, l’akassa, et la farine. Elle achète ses produits a Dantokpa. Elle a rencontrés les difficultés a cause de la variation du prix qui a causé une rupture. Elle voudrait acheter en gros dans le futur au village, ou les produits sont beaucoup moins chers. Son crédit l’aide en payer les frais de la scolarité, et elle voudrait augmenter et renforcer son commerce dans l’avenir.
texts.en:
Céline A. was born around 1956, and she is a widow with three children, ages 36, 22, and 18; the youngest is still in her care. She has been working for forty years. She started selling smoked meat in Parakou in northern Bénin. Now, she sells staple goods, such as rice, vegetable oil, peanut oil, beans, yams, corn, akassa (a thick porridge), and flour. She buys her goods in Dantokpa. She has encountered difficulties due to price variations, which have resulted in inventory shortages. In the future, she would like to buy in bulk in the village, where goods are a lot less expensive. Her loan is helping her to cover school costs, and she would like to increase and bolster her commerce for the future.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy grocery items

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., 54, is married with three children.  One of her children has completed senior high school while the rest of her children could not finish school and are now learning the trade.  

Comfort A. has been trading cereals like maize and smoked fish for the past 30 years.  She started the business with a small amount of working capital, but through commitment and hard work, Comfort can boast of business growth which she credits to God.  Through her business, she has been able to provide for her family. 

She wants to use this loan to buy a larger supply of maize and smoked fish to serve her customers throughout the season, especially in the face of increasing prices due to the current food crisis in the country.  She treks to Techieman in the Brong Ahafo region of Ghana and other surrounding towns to sell food.  

She believes the loan will enable her to upgrade her business.  With the loan, Comfort says she will be able to venture into the sale of Agro chemical products, which is frequently demanded by most people in the community.  She is grateful for your assistance.

loans.use: Comfort wants the loan to buy larger quantities of maize and smoked fish; she will use the proceeds to restock her grocery shop.

loans.name: Sarah

texts.en: Sarah A. is fifty two years old. She is married and has given birth to two children, a boy and a girl. Both of her children have completed senior high school. Sarah’s husband is a cocoa farmer. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region. She is a trader. She trades mainly in plantain and other food items. She buys her produce from the farmers in her community and nearby towns. She treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators. Sarah has been in business for over six years and is well experienced. When plantain becomes scarce, she resorts to buying and reselling food items like cassava, yam, etc. Sarah wants to buy plantain on larger scale so that she can supply to a greater number of customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy plantain in bulk

loans.name: Jesús María

texts.es:
La señora Jesús María S. D. T.  tiene 54 años, vive en el distrito D. Victor Larco Herrera, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió secundaria completa, tiene 04 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Jesús Maria empezó a su negocio D. manualidades haciendo materiales para implementar jardines, trabajo a que se dedicaban sus hijas, ella aprendió mirando y  actualmente se dedica a la confección D. bejouteria, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su Banco Comunal “Las Palmeras” lo invirtió en material para sus manualidades.
Con el crédito D. 1100 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en material D. bijouteria.
Jesús María sueña con tener una tienda D. manualidades y bejouteria en su casa.
texts.en:
Jesús María S. D. T. is 54 years old and finished secondary school. She has 4 dependent children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Jesús Maria started her craft products business making material to use in gardening. She picked up these skills from her daughters and currently she makes custom jewelry at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase material for her craft products. With this $350 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will purchase bijou products. Jesús María’s dream is to open a craft and bijou store at her home.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase bijou material for her customer jewelry

loans.name: Solange

texts.fr: S. Solange est née le 23 avril 1968. Elle s’est mariée avec GLELE Ahanhanzo Armand. Elle était scolarisées jusqu’au primaire. Elle a cinq enfants – 20, 18, 16, 14, et 3 ans, tous scolarisés. Elle gère une activité depuis 10 ans. Au début, elle a vendu le divers. Actuellement, elle fait la distribution des produits. Ses clients commandent les pagnes, les colliers, et les chaussures qu ‘ils les achètent chez elle. Elle achète ses produits a Lomé. Son mari a aidé avec sa commerce. Les autres prêts de Kiva lui a permis d’augmenter les articles. Dans l’avenir, elle voudrait ouvrir une poissonnerie et de vendre ses produits divers en gros.
texts.en:
Solange S. was born on April 23, 1968. She is married to Ahanhanzo Armand GLELE and has five children, ages 20, 18, 16, 14, and 3, who are all in school. She herself had been provided with a primary school education and has been working for ten years. In the beginning, she sold various goods. Currently, she distributes them. Her customers order pagnes (colorful West African cloth), necklaces, and shoes that they buy from her. She acquires her stock in Lomé. Her husband has helped. The other Kiva loans have enabled her to expand her offering. In the future, she would like to open a fish shop and to sell various goods in bulk.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes, necklaces, and shoes

loans.name: Diana

texts.en:
Diana A., 34, is married and the mother of four children.  Currently, all of her children are in school.  For three years, Diana has been a food vendor in a community school within the village of Agogo, where she lives with her family.  

She sells ‘ampesi’ and rice with stew; this food is mostly purchased by school children during their break time.  Ampesi is cooked and enjoyed with any kind of stew. Diana says the demand for her food has grown, extending outside of the school to the people in the community.  After she closes in the morning, she prepares more ampesi in the afternoon and sells it in the community market.  

Diana wants to use the loan to buy more bags of raw materials like rice, meat, charcoal and among others.  She is convinced that this loan will increase her stock; in the event of price hike, she will still be able to cook food.  Diana wants to use the proceeds to supports her children's education.  She says she is grateful for your assistance.  It has always been her dream to add the sale of soft drinks to her existing business, so that she can make additional income to support her husband in taking care of the children.

loans.use: Diana needs your assistance to buy food stuffs like yam, plantain, bags of rice, meat, fish, spices and charcoal etc.

loans.name: Liliana Pamela

texts.es:
La señora Liliana Pamela Z. C. tiene 27 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Liliana inicio su negocio repartiendo leche de casa en casa en una bicicleta y vendiendo embutidos; una amiga la animo a ingresar a la venta de productos de belleza, negocio al que actualmente se dedica y en el que ha logrado con esfuerzo y sacrificio llegar a ser directora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de toda clase de embutidos para su negocio.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en el pago de cupones y compra de productos de belleza.
Liliana sueña con terminar de construir su casa y tener un carro.
Ella pertenece al programa de vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Liliana Pamela Z. C. is 27 years old and finished secondary school. She has 2 dependent children. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Liliana started her business selling milk and dairy products door to door in her bicycle. A friend encouraged her to start selling beauty products. After a lot of hard work, she managed to become director of this small company. She runs her business at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase dairy products for her business. With this $475 loan, which will be paid off in 6 months, she will invest in coupons and will purchase beauty products. Liliana’s dream is to finish building her home and to buy a car. She is part of a Peruvian government’s program called “Glass of Milk” where she receives a daily basket of basic food products to feed her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Invest in coupons and purchase beauty products

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
Evelyn A., 35, is married and has given birth to three children – a boy and two girls.  She says two of her children are in basic school.  Evelyn’s husband is a commercial driver, and she lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. 

She is in the business of trading, mainly plantains.  She buys food from the farmers in her community and nearby towns, and then Evelyn treks to Accra to sell to local ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) operators.  She has been in business for barely two years.  She says when plantains become scarce, she buys other food items like cassava, yam, etceteras.  Evelyn wants to buy plantains on larger scale so that she can sell to a number of customers and increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy plantains in bulk

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señorita Maria Elena E. V. tiene 55 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3er ciclo de Asistenta Social , abandono los estudios por enfermedad de sus padres, no tiene hijos.
Maria se dedica a los tipeos e impresiones, inicio su negocio con una computadora realizando trabajos de tipeos a familiares y amigos, con el tiempo se hizo conocida y ahora tiene clientela, con sus ganancias obtenidas  logro adquirir una impresora y repotenciar su computadora con nuevos programas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de papel bond y tinta de impresora para su negocio.
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de papel bond, tinta de impresora y papel para impresión de fotografías.
Maria sueña con tener un local de fotocopiadora y tipeos, además viajar al cuzco.
texts.en:
Maria Elena E. V. is 55-years old and lives in the Victor Larco Herrera district of Buenos Aires, in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Peru. She studied to become a social worker until her parents became sick and she had to abandon her studies. She does not have any children. Maria provides word-processing and printing services. She started her business typing for family and friends; over time her work became known and she now has many customers. With her profits she bought a printer and updated her computer with new programs. She works from home. With her first loan of 300 PEN that she borrowed from Las Palmeras community bank, Maria invested in bond paper and printer ink cartridges for her business. With this loan of 1,200 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, she will purchase bond paper, ink cartridges, and photo printing paper. Maria dreams of having a photocopy and printing business, and of traveling to Cuzco.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of bond paper, ink cartridges, and photo printing paper.

loans.name: Yaa

texts.en:
Yaa N., 63, is a widow with two children – a male and a female. She says her two children are adults and living independently; however, Yaa N. lives with some of her grandchildren who are in junior and senior high schools in Konongo, a town in the Ashanti Region of Ghana.  

Despite her age, Yaa still desires to trade, in order to make a living.  Even before her husband passed away, Yaa was in the business of trading.  She sells toffees, biscuits and other sweets, which she buys from wholesalers in Kumasi and Accra.  Yaa has been in business for over forty years. She sells on a table top in front of her house and also at the local community market.

loans.use: To buy biscuits, toffees, etceteras

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora Maria Elena Z. N., tiene 30 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 1er ciclo de Relaciones Públicas, carrera que abandono cuando se caso, tiene   01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Maria inicio su negocio ayudando a su esposo en la elaboración de estampados de polos, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro algunos productos y decidió poner una pequeña bodega, con el tiempo ha logrado surtirla con variedad de productos que le dan muchas ganancias, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de pinturas para estampados.
Con el crédito de 600 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra abarrotes para su bodega.
Maria sueña con tener un minimarket en su casa y viajar por todo el Perú
Ella pertenece al programa de vaso de leche de su sector.
texts.en:
Maria Elena Z. N. is 30 years old and she finished the first trimester of the Public Relation degree. She has a dependent daughter. She lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, province of Trujillo, department of La Libertad, Peru. Maria started her Business helping her husband to make stamping designs. With her money she made, she decided to open a small shop. With time she was able to diversify her business so she makes a good profit out of them. She runs her business at home. She requested for a first $100 loan from the community bank “Las Palmeras”, which she used to purchase paint to make stamping designs. With this $200 loan, which will be paid off in 4 months, she will purchase grocery products for her shop. Maria’s dream is to open a minimarket at home and to travel around Peru. She is part of a Peruvian government’s program called “Glass of Milk” where she receives a daily basket of basic food products to feed her children.

Translated from Spanish by Jimena Lopez, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase grocery products for her store

loans.name: Comfort

texts.en:
Comfort A., 60, is a widowed mother of nine children.  She has four female and five male children.  She says her last born is currently in senior high school.  The rest of her children have completed school and are employed.  

Comfort trades yams and charcoal.  She buys her goods from Atebubu and Ejura, in the Brong Ahafo and Ashanti Regions respectively.  She buys the goods at a low-price in those locations, and then she sells some at the local market and also treks to other towns to supply to food vendors.  Comfort has been in business for over 15 years. She wants a loan to buy goods in bulk so that she can increase her profit margin.

loans.use: To buy yams and bags of charcoal

loans.name: Michael Jose

texts.es: Michael es soltero, de 23 años de edad, tiene 1 hija de año y medio, su compalera no trabaja, el trabaja en El Ayote como profesor de primaria, viaja cada 15 dias a Juigalpa a ver  a su familia, esta solicitando su primer credito para utilizarlo en la compra de tablas para cambiar la de su cuerto que esta construido mitad concreto y mitad tablas (minifalda conocido popularmente), ademas comprará cemento para embaldozar el mismo, esto  lo hace con el objetivo de brindarle mayor seguridad a su familia durante los dias que el esta fuera; ha sido recomendado por otros clientes  y clientas ya que ellos consideran que AFODENIC es la solucion a los problemas de vivienda, con una mejor politica para sus clientes.   El se ha comprometido a pagar en tiempo y forma para de esa manera ganarse un buen record crediticio y llegar a ser un fiel cliente de la institucion que ha alcanzado un gran prestigio entre sus clientes.
texts.en:
Michael is single, 23 years old and has a daughter aged 1 and a half. His partner is not working; he works in El Ayote as an elementary school teacher. Every 15 days he travels to Juigalpa to see his family. He is asking for this, his first loan, in order to buy floorboards to change those in his room which is built partly of concrete and partly of floorboards (commonly referred to as "minifalda"). He will also buy adhesive to tile the room, which he is doing in order to give his family a more secure home when he is away. He was recommended by other clients, who believe that AFODENIC can help solve their housing problems because of its client policies. He is committed to paying on time and recognizes that this is a good way to earn a good credit record and become a loyal client of the institution which has gained such a good reputation with its clients.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy building materials.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen B. is fifty years old. She is married and has given birth to seven children – four males and three females. She says five of her children are out of school and are working. Currently, her last two children are in junior high school.

Ellen’s husband is an artist, a carver by profession. He carves artifacts such as dolls and sells them, mostly to foreigners who normally show interest.

Ellen is a food vendor. She lives with her children in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She cooks rice and ‘banku’. Banku is a local food prepared from corn dough. It is served hot with soup. She buys bags of rice and maize from Kumasi.

Ellen has been in business for over twenty years. She wants to buy bags of rice and maize on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost, and on frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
La señora Maria Esther O. G. tiene 34 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene 03 hijos de los cuales 02 dependen económicamente de ella.
Maria se dedica a la venta de productos lácteos, pasteles y embutidos, inicio su negocio vendiendo comida, con las ganancias que obtuvo empezó con la venta de quesos y roscas de casa en casa, luego amplio su negocio vendiendo también embutidos, actualmente tiene clientes fijos y vende a pedido, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra alimentos de primera necesidad.
Con el crédito de 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de pasteles, lácteos y embutidos.
Maria tiene el gran sueño de construir su casa y viajar a Chile.
texts.en:
Maria Esther O. G. is 34-years old and lives in the Víctor Larco Herrera district of Buenos Aires, in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She went to school until her third year of secondary school. She has 3 children, 2 of which depend on her financially. Maria sells dairy products, cakes, and sausages. She started selling food and with the profits began a business selling cheese and roscas (ring-shaped bread rolls) door-to-door, later expanding her sales to include sausages. She now has regular customers and order requests, and runs her business from home. With her first loan of 300 PEN which she received from Las Palmeras community bank, Maria invested in basic foodstuffs. This loan of 1,200 PEN, which will be repaid in 6 months, will be used to buy cakes, dairy products, and sausages. Maria dreams of building a house and traveling to Chile.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of cakes, dairy products, and sausages to sell

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace A. is fifty-six years old. She is married and has given birth to five children, one male and four females. She says four of her children are out of school and are working. Currently, her last one is in junior high school. Her husband works with the national fire service.

Grace runs a ‘chop bar’ (restaurant) in her locality. She sells ‘banku’ and ‘fufu’. Banku is prepared from corn dough. Fufu is another local food made from cooked and pounded cassava. Both dishes are served hot with soup. She lives with her family in Konongo in the Ashanti Region of Ghana. She buys bags of rice and maize from Kumasi.

Grace has been in business for over fifteen years. She wants to buy bags of rice and maize on a large scale so that she can cut down on cost, and on frequent trips to procure goods.

loans.use: To buy bags of rice and maize

loans.name: Maria Fermina

texts.es:
La señora Maria Fermina C. C. D. C. tiene 63 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito D. Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3er grado D. primaria, tiene 04 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Maria inicio su negocio vendiendo leche D. casa en casa, con las ganancias obtenidas logro comprar animales para la venta, dedicándose ahora a la venta D. animales menores,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra D. alimento balanceado para sus vacas.
Con el crédito D. 1800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra D. alimento balanceado y animales para la venta.
Maria tiene el sueño D. construir su casa y lograr tener una granja.
texts.en:
Maria Fermina C. C. D. C. is 63-years old and lives in the Víctor Larco Herrera district of Buenos Aires, in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She went to school until the 3rd graD. and has 4 children, who no longer depend on her financially. Maria began her business selling milk door-to-door, and with the profits bought animals to sell. She now specializes in small animals sales, running her business from home. With her first loan of 300 PEN received from Las Palmeras community bank, she invested in cattle feed and animals. Maria dreams of building a house and owning a farm.

Translated from Spanish by Vivian Lu, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of enriched feed and animals to sell

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es: La Sra. H. es soltera, de 39 años de edad, auxiliar de enfermeria, trabajadora del Hospital Asuncion con 23 años de servicio, tiene 2 hijos, un varon estudiando 3er año de zootecnia en la Universidad Agraria y la niña en 4to grado de primaria.  Doña Candelaria plantea que vivio durante 18 años alquilando y fue hasta finales del año 2008 que pudo realizar su suelo  de tener una vivienda propia, la que obtuvo a traves de Cáritas donde pagó U$.1,000.00 dólares, ella tenia el terreno que compro con los creditos que AFODENIC le ha otorgado. En esta ocacion esta solicitando su 6to credito el que utilizara para construir un pequeño anexo para cocina, instalar energia electrica, agua y construccion de una letrina, con lo que dará una mayor comodidad a su vivienda, una vez realizado el proyecto que se ha planteado tendra la posiblidad de trasladarse a vivir en lo que es propio, sueño que se realizo despues de mucho tiempo y con el apoyo que le brindó AFODENIC, ahora puede ofrecer a sus hijos un techo aunque pequeño pero digno y lo mejor que es propio.  Ella tiene el apoyo de su hijo que realiza algunas activivdades en el tiempo que no esta en clase, donde el dinero que percibe lo comparte con ella.  Manifiesta que le pide a Dios siempro cumplir con sus compromisos crediticios, pues siempre se necesita qeue le sirvan con confianza.
texts.en:
Señora H. is single, 39, and a nursing assistant. She has 23 years of service at Hospital Asunción. She has two children, a son who is in his third year of studying zoology at the agricultural university, and a daughter who is in fourth grade. Candelaria considers that she rented a place to live for 18 years, and at the end of 2008, she thought she earned enough money to realize her dream of having her own home. She acquired her home through Cáritas, where she paid $1,000. She had the land that she purchased with her credits that AFODENIC offered her. On this occasion, she is requesting her sixth credit, which she will use to build a small addition to her kitchen, to install electricity and water, and to construct a bathroom, which will give her home more comfort. At the same time, she will accomplish the project that she set out to achieve and will have the possibility of moving into her own home, a dream that she has has for a long time. With the support of AFODENIC, she can now offer her children their own roof to sleep under. Although it is small, it is worthy and it's better because it's their own. She has the support of her son, who makes money while he is not in class and shares with her. She expresses that she always asks God to let her comply with her credit obligations because it is always necessary to serve him with confidence.

Translated from Spanish by Tanya Harper, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To construct an addition to her kitchen and a bathroom

loans.name: Marlene Esperanza

texts.es:
La señora Marlene Esperanza A. G. tiene 48 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que dejo de ejercer cuando se caso, tiene 02 hijos que ya no dependen económicamente de ella.
Marlene se dedica a la venta de chocolates, bijouteri y sandalias, negocio que inicio ayudando a su esposo en la confección de sandalias, con las ganancias que obtuvo compro material para la fabricación de chocolate y luego también para bijouteri, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de materiales para la fabricación de sandalias.
Con el crédito de 400 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de materiales para sandalias y bijouteri para su negocio.
Marlene sueña con tener una empresa de calzado y le gustaría conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Ms. Marlene Esperanza A. G. is a 48-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She earned an Executive Secretarial certificate, but she stopped practicing her profession when she got married. She has 2 independent children.

Marlene sells chocolate, costume jewelry and sandals for a living, a business which she started by helping her husband make sandals. With the profits she earned, she purchased ingredients to make chocolate, and later also materials to make costume jewelry. She runs her business from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Palmeras”—in purchasing materials to make sandals.

She will invest this 400.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 4 months, in purchasing materials to make sandals and costume jewelry for her business.

Marlene dreams of having her own shoe company and of traveling to the Cuzco region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase materials for sandal and costume jewelry production

loans.name: Fausto Francisco

texts.es: El Profesor Fausto es soltero, de 51 años de edad, tiene 2 hijas: la mayor de 13 años que es adoptada y con probleas de discapacidad y cursa el 3er grado, la otra tiene 12 años y estudiara el 1er año de secundaria, él sale de su casa alas 5:00 a.m. para su trabajo a la comarca Hato Grande y regresa a las 2:00 p.m., tiene 21 años de servicio en la zona rural.  Está solicitando su credito # 7 el que utilizara para la construccion de un anexo a su pequeña vivienda que tiene 3 vras de frente por 4½ de fondo, esta ampliacion la esta planificando porque tiene como proyecto poner una venta de comida para que su compañera trabaje en la casa y de esa manera tener un ingreso mas paa la familia.  El profesor G. se ha destacado como un cliente "A", pues sus 6 creditos los ha cancelado antes de la fecha establecida, siendo un ejemplo para el resto de sus compañeros del NERPE "Isaac Deleo" de la comunidad de Hato Grance, es merecedor de mucho respeto en el gremio magisterial.
texts.en:
Professor Fausto is single, 51 years old, and has two daughters. His older daughter is 13 years old, was adopted and has a disability; she is in third grade. His younger daughter is 12 years old and in her first year of high school. He leaves home every day at 5:00 A.M. to work in the region of Hato Grande and returns at 2:00 P.M. He has been working in the rural schools for 21 years. He is asking for this, his seventh loan, which he will use to build an addition to his small home which measures 3 "varas" wide by 4.5 "varas" deep [about 8 feet by 12 feet]. This addition would allow for a home-based food sales business which his partner would run, thus creating another source of income for the family. Professor G. is rated an "A" client because he has repaid his six previous loans before their due dates. He is an example to the rest of his colleagues at "Isaac Deleo" school association in the community of Hato Grande and deserves great respect as a teacher.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To build an addition

loans.name: Mirian Janet

texts.es:
La señora Mirian Janet H.  H. tiene 37 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco H., provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene  01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Mirian se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inicio su negocio por iniciativa de su familia empezó vendiendo algunos productos y con las ganancias que obtuvo logro formar un capital de trabajo, con el tiempo ha logrado conseguir clientela y aumentar sus ventas, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra de productos de belleza y mejoras en su domicilio.
Mirian sueña con lograr que su hija sea una profesional y viajar con ella a conocer el cuzco.
texts.en:
Ms. Mirian Janet H. H. is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco H., in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied up to the 3rd year of middle school and has 1 dependent daughter. Mirian sells beauty products for a living. She started her business out of her family’s initiative. She began by selling some products, and with the profits that she was able to earn, she managed to accumulate business capital. Over time, she has been able to form a client-base and increase her earnings. She runs her business from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Palmeras”—in purchasing beauty products.

She will invest this 1,000.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, in purchasing beauty products and in home improvement.

Mirian dreams of helping her daughter become a professional and traveling with her to the Cuzco region.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Home improvement and beauty products

loans.name: Nora Rosa

texts.es:
La señora Nora Rosa R. R. tiene 36 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene 01 hija que depende económicamente de ella.
Nora se dedica a la venta de menú, inicio su negocio vendiendo caldos por las mañanas y ceviche los domingos, dejo de trabajar durante 01 año por motivo de salud, cuando inicio nuevamente empezó vendiendo menú a diario, ahora tiene pensionistas todos los días, su negocio lo desarrolla en su casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de mesas, sillas y arreglo el piso de su casa.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de una vitrina o congeladora para su negocio.
Nora tiene el gran sueño de construir su casa y viajar a Huaraz con su hija.
texts.en:
Ms. Nora Rosa R. R. is a 36-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She studied up to the 3rd year of middle school. She has 1 dependent daughter. Nora sells set menu meals for a living. She started out by selling soup in the morning and ceviche—citrus marinated fish—on Sundays. She stopped working for a whole year due to health reasons. When she resumed her business, she started selling set menu meals daily. She now serves patrons everyday in her restaurant, which she runs from home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Lomeras”—in purchasing tables and chairs and having her floor repaired. She will invest this 800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, in purchasing a display case or a freezer for her business.

Nora’s biggest dream is building her house and traveling to Huaraz with her daughter.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase a display case or freezer

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
La señora Rosa María B. T. tiene 37 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudió hasta 2do año de secundaria no termino debido a que se caso joven, tiene 03 hijos que dependen enteramente de ella.
Rosa Maria  se dedica a la venta de ropa, inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa interior, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro formar un capital que le ha permitido ampliar su negocio y actualmente vende también jeans y polos a pedido, negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en compra de ropa interior.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa interior, jeans, polos y una parte en la compra de eternit para su techo. 
Rosa María sueña con tener una tienda de ropa en su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ms. Rosa María B. T. is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Buenos Aires, district of Víctor Larco Herrera, in the Trujillo province of the department of La Libertad, Perú.

She completed her 2nd year of high school but was unable to finish because she got married at a young age. She has 3 dependent children.

Rosa María sells clothing for a living.
