She started out by selling undergarments, and with the profits she earned, she was able to accumulate the business capital that has allowed her to expand her business. She currently also sells jeans and t-shirts by special order. She runs her business from her own home.

She invested the first 300.00 PEN loan that she received from her local microfinance institute—“Las Palmeras”—in purchasing undergarments. She will invest this 800.00 PEN loan, which will be repaid in 6 months, in purchasing undergarments, jeans and t-shirts. She will also use some of the loan to purchase roofing materials for her house.

Rosa María dreams of having her own clothing boutique in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Elizabeth Casian, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase roofing materials for her home and undergarments, jeans and t-shirts

loans.name: Rosa Maria

texts.es:
La señora Rosa Maria S. D. J. tiene 51 años, ella es tesorera D. su Banco Comunal, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito D. Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia D. Trujillo, departamento D. La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Secretariado Ejecutivo, carrera que ejerció durante 9 años, dejo D. trabajar cuando se caso, tiene  02 hijos y ninguno depenD. económicamente D. ella.
Rosa inicio su negocio en una pequeña bodega donD. vendía arroz, azúcar y verduras, con las ganancias que obtuvo y con dinero D. juntas en las que ella participaba logro adquirir mas productos para la venta, logrando tener ahora una tienda granD., su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito D. 300 soles que recibió D. su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra D. gaseosas para su negocio.
Con el crédito D. 1200 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra D. cerveza y gaseosas.
Rosa sueña con tener un minimarket y un local para venta D. cerveza.
texts.en:
Rosa Maria S. D. J. is 51 years old and the treasurer of her cooperative bank. She lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied as an executive secretary, a career she followed for nine years. She stopped working when she married, and has two children who are no longer financially dependent on her. Rosa started her small business in a small bodega where she sold rice, sugar, and vegetables. With the money she maD., she managed to purchase more goods to sell. She now has a large store, and carries out her business in her own home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of sodas for her business. With the loan of 1,200.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in the purchase of beer and sodas. Rosa dreams of having a mini-mart and a location to sell beer.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beer and sodas.

loans.name: Rosa Milagritos

texts.es:
La señorita Rosa Milagritos P. B. tiene 43 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella es profesora de Educación Inicial, carrera que aun no ejerce porque esta realizando los trámites para su título, no tiene hijos.
Rosa tiene un locutorio, inicio su negocio con un pequeño teléfono fijo, con las ganancias obtenidas logro adquirir una cabina de madera, con el tiempo se hizo conocida y tiene mucha clientela que le ha permitido adquirir otra cabina  para su negocio que lo desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de una cabina.
Con el crédito de 1300 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en mejorar su local.
Rosa tiene el gran sueño de tener su propio jardín de niños.
texts.en:
Rosa Milagritos P. B. is 43 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She is a primary school teacher, however does not pursue her career because she is continuing to work toward her degree. She does not have children. Rosa runs a “locutorio” (a phone service kiosk where people can come to make calls), having started with one phone. With her earnings, she was able to build a wood cublicle. Over time, she has become well-known and has a good customer base that has allowed her to purchase another cubicle. She runs her business out of her house. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of a cubicle. With the loan of 1,300.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in making improvements to her establishment. Rosa has a grand dream of one day having her own nursery school.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make improvements to her phone call center.

loans.name: César

texts.es: César tiene 30 años, es soltero y vive con su madre y sus hermanos en la casa de sus padres. El es un joven que trabaja desde hace más de 2 años vendiendo productos de nutrición de una línea de reconocida trayectoria en la región, dedica todos los días a buscar nuevos clientes mediante encuestas de casa en casa, de las cuales obtiene nuevos clientes y de esa manera supera las metas que él mismo se propone. Con este negocio puede adquirir lo que necesita para sostenerse él mismo y a su madre, su meta es tener sus propias cosas y en un futuro ser un empresario próspero. La mayor dificultad es cuando camina largas rutas para conseguir nuevos clientes, lo cual es muy cansado, pero que es muy bien recompensado por la satisfacción que siente de generar ingresos económicos. Es la cuarta vez que César está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, y durante este tiempo ha demostrado ser puntual en sus pagos, lo que ha favorecido bastante para que su banco comunal sea merecedor de una renovación de crédito, ya que el nivel de confianza es suficiente. Con el dinero que solicita invertirá en la compra de más productos para de esa manera incrementar sus ventas. Cada  frasco que vende está valorizado en 100 soles, de los cuales, él compra al por mayor a 75 soles, con este préstamo adquirirá una caja con 46 productos.
texts.en:
César is 30 years old, single, and lives with his mother and siblings in his parents’ home. He is a young man who has worked for more than 2 years selling nutritional products by a well-known brand. He dedicates every day to building his customer base by traveling door-to-door so he can add clients and meet the goals he has set for himself. With this business, he can buy the necessary items to sustain himself and his mother and his goal is to have his own things and be a successful businessman. The greatest difficulty is when he travels the long routes to attract new customers, which is very tiring; however, he is rewarded by the satisfactory feeling he gets from generating income. This is the fourth time César is requesting a loan with MFP and, over this period of time, he has demonstrated himself to be punctual with his payments. This has been favorable for him because his cooperative bank feels confident enough in him to allow a renewal of his credit. With the funds he requests, he will invest in the purchase of more merchandise so he can continue to grow his business. Each bottle he sells is valued at 100.00 Peruvian soles, and he buys these at wholesale for 75.00 Peruvian soles. With this loan, he will purchase one case containing 46 items.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To increase the quantity of products that he sells.

loans.name: Rose Mary Mabel

texts.es:
La señora Rose Mary Mabel P. G. tiene 39 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Victor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 4to de secundaria, tiene 04 hijos de los cuales 02 dependen económicamente de ella.
Rose Mary inicio su negocio vendiendo ropa interior y ganchitos, con las ganancias obtenidas ha logrado formar un capital que le ha permitido incrementar su negocio, ahora vende todo tipo de ropa. Negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de ropa para niños.
Con el crédito de 800 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa para campaña escolar.
Rose Mary sueña con tener una tienda de ropa en su casa
texts.en:
Rose Mary Mabel P. G. is 39 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied to the 4th year of secondary school and has four children, two of whom still depend on her financially. Rose Mary started her business selling undergarments and hangers. With the income she has earned, she has managed to have some capital that allowed her to grow her business. She now sells all types of clothing. She runs her business out of her home. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of children’s clothing. With the loan of 800.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in clothing for the school season. Rosa Mary dreams of having her own clothing store in her house.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase children's clothing for the school season.

loans.name: Ruth Maribel

texts.es:
La señora Ruth Maribel N. A. tiene 33 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio secundaria completa, tiene una hija que depende enteramente de ella.
Ruth se dedica a la venta de ropa y plasticos, inicio su negocio con la venta de juguetes por campaña de navidad, con las ganancias que obtuvo logro comprar ropa interior y plásticos para la venta, su negocio lo desarrolla en Paijan.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de juguetes para campaña navideña.
Con el crédito de 1500 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de ropa y plásticos
Ruth sueña con tener una tienda de abarrotes en su domicilio.
texts.en:
Ruth Maribel N. A. is 33 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She completed secondary school and has a daughter who still dependens solely on her. Ruth dedicates herself to selling clothing and plastic products, having started her business initially selling toys for the holidays. With the earnings she made, she managed to buy undergarments and plastic products to sell. She runs her business in Paijan. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of toys for the holiday season. With the loan of 1,500.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in six months, she will invest in the purchase of clothing and plastic products. Ruth dreams of having a grocery store in her home.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase clothing and plastic products.

loans.name: Tatyana Juddyt

texts.es:
La señorita Tatyana Juddyt M. T. tiene 22 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio Enfermería Técnica, carrera que aun no puede ejercer por no conseguir trabajo, no tiene hijos.
Tatyana se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza, inicio su negocio vendiendo algunos productos, con las ganancias que obtuvo ha logrado formar un capital de trabajo que le permite adquirir mas productos para  la venta a sus clientes, su negocio lo desarrolla en su domicilio.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de productos de belleza para la venta.
Con el crédito de 300 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá en la  compra productos de belleza.
Tatyana  tiene el gran sueño de estudiar Enfermería en la universidad y viajar a España.
texts.en:
Tatyana Juddyt M. T. is 22 years old and lives in Buenos Aires, located in the Trujillo province of La Libertad, Perú. She studied nursing, but was not able to practice because she was unable to find a job. She does not have children. Tatyana dedicates herself to selling beauty products, having started her business selling just a few items. With her earnings, she managed to save some working capital which allowed her to buy more products to offer her clients. She runs her business out of her house. With the first loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles that she received from her cooperative bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchase of beauty products to offer for sale. With this loan of 300.00 Peruvian soles, to be repaid in four months, she will invest in the purchase of beauty products. Tatyana has the grand dreams of studying nursing at the university and traveling to Spain.

Translated from Spanish by Mary Lynn Malaby, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase beauty products.

loans.name: Viviana Cecilia

texts.es:
La señora Viviana Cecilia B. A. tiene 20 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Víctor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio hasta 3ro de secundaria, tiene 02 hijos que dependen económicamente de ella.
Viviana se dedica a la venta de anticuchos y salchipollo, inicio su negocio vendiendo anticuchos, con el tiempo fue haciéndose de clientela y aumentando sus ventas que le ha permitido ampliar su negocio a la venta de salchipollo, su negocio lo desarrolla cerca de la casa de su mamá.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de una parrilla para su negocio de anticucho.
Con el crédito de 200 soles, que será cancelado en 4 meses, lo invertirá  en completar el dinero para la compra de un carrito sanguchero.
Viviana sueña con tener un restaurant en su casa.
texts.en:
Viviana Cecilia B. A. is 20 years old, and lives in the town on Buenos Aires, which is located in the province of Trujillo in Peru. She studied up to the 3rd year of secondary school, and has two children who financially depend on her. Viviana sells kebabs and salchipollo (a sausage and chicken dish). She began her business selling kebabs, and with time she expanded her customer base and increased sales; this has allowed her to expand her business to the sale of salchipollo. She has developed her business close to her mother’s home. With her first loan of 300 Peruvian Soles (approximately $100 USD), which she received from her community bank “Las Palmeras”, she invested in the purchased of a grill for her kebab business. With her current loan request of 200 Peruvian Soles (approximately $75 USD), which will be re-paid in 4 months, she will be able to accrue enough money to purchase a food cart. Viviana dreams of someday having a restaurant in her own home.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of a food cart.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
La señora Yolanda G. E. tiene 48 años, vive en Buenos Aires, distrito de Victor Larco Herrera, provincia de Trujillo, departamento de La Libertad, Perú.
Ella estudio primaria completa, tiene 03 hijos y ninguno depende económicamente de ella.
Yolanda se dedica a la crianza de animales menores, al inicio comenzó con unos cuantos patos y gallinas, con sus ganancias fue adquiriendo mas animales y actualmente solo cría cuyes,  negocio que desarrolla en su propia casa.
Con el primer crédito de 300 soles que recibió de su banco comunal “Las Palmeras”, lo invirtió en la compra de alimento balanceado y animales.
Con el crédito de 1000 soles, que será cancelado en 6 meses, lo invertirá en la compra de alimento balanceado y animales.
Yolanda sueña con tener su propio carro.
texts.en:
Mrs. Yolanda G. E. is 48 years old and lives in the Buenos Aires neighborhood, in the Victor Larco Herrera district in the province of Trujillo in Libertad, Peru. She finished her elementary education and has 3 children that no longer depend on her economically. Yolanda raises small animals for a living. She started with a few ducks and chickens and with her earnings she acquired more animals. Now she works out of her home, raising guinea pigs. With her first loan of 300 soles that she received from Las Palmeras Community Bank, she bought more animals and food for them. With this loan of 1,000 soles, which she will repay in 6 months, she will invest in a balanced diet for her animals and will also purchase more animals. Yolanda would like to someday have her own car.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase more animals and animal food

loans.name: On Time Group

texts.en:
Finda J., Yeabu K., Bamba J. and Mafila J. have named their group "On Time". They are all local entrepreneurs in Makeni, in northern Sierra Leone. Each one of the group received a loan of Le 500,000 during the last loan cycle. That loan created meaningful impacts in the lives of these borrowers. They were able to use their profits to pay their children’s school fees. They’re also able to feed and clothe themselves and their children with the income generated from the loans. Today, they are requesting a loan of Le 700,000 each to buy more goods to add to their businesses.

Finda (second from left) is the leader of the group. She is forty-five years of age. She was born in Kabala, Kionadugu district in northern Sierra Leone. She is married and has three children. Two of her children are already married and one is in secondary school. She has been a businesswoman since childhood days.

Finda sells cottons, gara lappers (locally dyed cloth with fabricated designs) and firewood. With this new loan, she will expand her business. She travels to Freetown (about 390 miles r/t) to buy the pieces of cotton used for the gara. As for the firewood, she buys it from neighboring villages. The fare to Freetown is Le 12,000 and she usually pays a delivery fee of Le 5,000 for the cottons. In Freetown, a piece of cotton costs something between Le 75,000 to Le 80,000. A truck of firewood costs Le 300,000.

So far, Finda faces no serious challenge in her business that is worth noting. Business is going fine. She enjoys what she does for a living. To Finda and her colleagues in the group, an increase in profit means making their lives better. They will be able to take good care of their children, specifically their educational and nutritional needs, and save some money for emergencies.

loans.use: Expand her business by buying cottons and firewood

loans.name: Gloria

texts.es: Gloria tiene 50 años, vive con su esposo en su propia casa. Ella trabaja diariamente en una oficina gubernamental de su ciudad, pero desde hace un año esto no la limitó a dedicarse a la venta de cosméticos, donde sus principales clientes son sus colegas de trabajo, cada día lleva a su oficina el catálogo de sus productos, una estrategia muy eficiente para que sus amistades la ven en sus ratos libres y luego de revisarla soliciten los productos que desean. Gloria les vende al crédito y al mes cobra poco a poco, de esta manera se genera ingresos extras a su remuneración que favorecen la economía de su hogar. Por el momento Gloria se ha propuesto incrementar su capital de trabajo, ya que esto garantiza el aumento de sus ganancias. Es la cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella ha demostrado ser una persona muy  responsable en sus pagos, y es muy colaboradora en todos los planes que se ha propuesto su banco comunal. Con el dinero solicitado comprará, en oferta, grandes cantidades de los productos que ofrece el catalogo de ventas para tener en stock y pueda vender inmediatamente a un mejor precio.
texts.en:
Gloria is 50 years old and lives with her husband in their own home. She works for a government office in her city, but for the past year she has also sold cosmetics. Her customers are mostly her co-workers and she is an efficient saleswoman. Everyday she takes the cosmetics catalog to work with her and her friends look at it in their free time and then order the products they would like. Gloria sells them products on credit and collects payments each month, which helps her generate extra income for her home. Now Gloria would like to increase her business capital, which would increase her earnings. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she has been very responsible with her payments and is very active in her community bank. With this loan she will buy large quantities of cosmetics on sale, to have them in stock and offer them to her customers at a lower price with immediate delivery.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase her stock of cosmetics

loans.name: Luz

texts.es: Luz tiene 33 años y vive con su hijo de 3 años en casa de sus padres. Ella trabaja vendiendo cosméticos desde hace 3 años, su mercadería es de las líneas más confiables y mejor cotizadas de su medio. La forma de vender de Luz es ofreciendo de casa de casa a sus amistades y vecinos, y debido al incremento de sus ventas ha decidido aumentar su capital de trabajo con prendas de vestir para llevarlas a los trabajadores del sector salud de su localidad, ya que para ella esto significa mayor garantía cuando da al crédito sus productos, además que siempre su  clientela es fija y como les vende en su centro de trabajo, siempre los ubica y conoce cuando es fecha de pago para ir a cobrar sus cuentas. Ahora Luz mira con grandes expectativas su futuro para seguir siendo el sostén de su hijo. Es la segunda vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, ella regresó a su banco comunal después de dos ciclos (préstamos consecutivos) y fue admitida porque tiene como antecedentes positivos su puntualidad y fortaleza en el trabajo en equipo. Luz esta solicitando esta cantidad para la compra de mayor cantidad de cosméticos, adquirirá estos productos al contado para que de esta manera pueda ofrecer al crédito, también comprará prendas de vestir al por mayor, para empezar, ropa interior.
texts.en:
Luz is 33 years old and lives with her parents and her 3-year-old son. For the past 3 years she has worked selling cosmetics from one of the most trusted and valuable brands available. Luz sells her products by going to the houses of her friends and neighbors. Due to her increased sales she has decided to expand her business by also selling clothing to health care workers in her area. [By selling to more clients] she will have more security when she sells her products on credit. Regardless, she has set clients that she sells to at their workplace, she knows where they are and what day she has to go collect her payments. Luz looks toward the future with the expectation that she will continue to support her son. This is the second loan cycle with MFP. She went back to her community bank after two consecutive loans and was accepted because of her previous positive experiences, punctual payments and ability to work as a team. Luz is asking for this money to purchase more cosmetics. She will buy these products at a discount and then offer them to her clients on credit. She will also buy clothing articles to sell--to start with she will purchase undergarments to sell.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of cosmetics she sells

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 26 años, vive con su esposo y sus 2 hijos, viven en una casa alquilada. Desde hace más de 5 años se dedica a elaborar guantes para actividades pesadas, en las mañanas ayuda a su esposo en el taller ubicado en la casa de su suegro, donde confecciona sola hasta 10 pares de guantes al día y su esposo otra cantidad, así juntan el trabajo de la semana para venderlo principalmente a comerciantes que venden artículos de ferretería. Esta actividad le permite a María y su esposo poder sostener la economía del hogar, ella está muy animada de seguir adelante con este trabajo, para ella la dificultad se presenta cuando hay poca demanda de sus  guantes, eso es generalmente cuando suben los precios, pero esta dificultad está siendo superada, porque ya tiene clientes fijos. Es la tercera vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, tiempo en el cual ha demostrado ser muy eficiente en sus pagos, además de que agradece que en todo este tiempo ha podido aumentar su capital de trabajo, lo que le permite mantenerse  en su negocio. Con el dinero que requiere comprará cuero de segunda calidad, que es la materia prima que utiliza para la elaboración de los guantes.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and lives with her husband and their two children in a rented house. For more than 5 years she has worked making heavy-duty work gloves. In the mornings she helps her husband in their workshop located at her in-laws home. She makes up to 10 pairs of gloves per day and her husband makes another group--they combine their weekly production and sell the gloves mainly to people who work with hardware and metal. Making gloves allows Maria and her husband to support their family and she is very excited to continue with this job. The only difficulty is when there is a low demand for her gloves, this is generally when prices go up. This difficulty is being overcome because she now has returning customers. This is her third loan with MFP and she always been efficient with her payments. She is very grateful that she has been able to increase her capital and sustain her business. With the money she is asking for she will buy medium quality leather, which is the material she uses to make the gloves.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Buy leather to make work gloves

loans.name: Noemi

texts.es: Noemí tiene 28 años, vive con su hija y su esposo en la casa de sus suegros. Se dedica a la venta de productos medicinales desde hace 2 años, ella fue animada por su padre para vender estos productos, de lo que ya ha visto que en estos últimos tiempos que se han incrementado sus ventas y le permite ser un sostén más para su familia. Noemí está satisfecha por la labor que ha conseguido y está muy comprometida a seguir trabajando. Trabajar de esta manera es muy factible para ella porque le permite tener tiempo disponible para atender a su pequeña hija, recogerla de su escuela y ayudarle en sus tareas por las tardes, mientras que en las mañanas vende sus productos. Es la cuarta vez que está solicitando un préstamo con MFP, es una integrante activa de su banco comunal, del que forma parte de la junta directiva, y es un ejemplo de responsabilidad en el pago de sus cuentas. El dinero solicitado en esta ocasión es para la compra de una caja completa de los productos que vende, con ello incrementará sus ventas y sus ganancias.
texts.en:
Noemi is 28 years old and lives with her daughter and husband in her in-laws home. For the past 2 years she has made a living by selling medicinal products. Her father encouraged her to begin selling these products and in recent times she has seen an increase in her sales that allow her to help support her family. Noemi is satisfied with the work she has found and is very committed to continue working. Working in this way is very feasible for her because it allows her some free time to care for her small daughter, to pick her up from school and help her with homework in the afternoons and selling her products in the mornings. This is her fourth loan with MFP and she is very responsible in paying her loans. She is an active member of her community bank and is part of the director's group. The money she is asking for this time is to buy a complete case of the products that she sells, with this she will increase her sales and her earnings.

Translated from Spanish by Rachel Crouch, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Increase the amount of products she sells

loans.name: Adalid

texts.es:
Adalid trabaja de transportista, tiene una movilidad de servicio publico en la ciudad de La Paz, la cual  es su principal fuente de ingreso.

El es soltero vive en la av.  Max Fernandez de la zona de alto LLojeta en la ciudad de La Paz.

El crédito lo destinara para la adquisición de un motor para su vehiculo el cual con el constante trabajo ya no presta servicio a cabalidad.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Adalid works in transportation: his main source of income comes from using his vehicle as public transportation in the city of La Paz. He is single, and lives in the Llojeta neighbourhood of La Paz. He will use the loan money to buy a motor for his vehicle, which in addition to running constantly is not being adequately serviced. This is his first loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a motor

loans.name: Raymundo

texts.es:
Raymundo trabaja como cerrajero, en la construcción de puertas y ventanas de metal en la casa donde vive como inquilino, ubicado en el manzano K de la zona de Rio Seco en la ciudad de El Alto.

El vive solo con uno de sus hijos pues su esposa vive en el área rural cuidando su ganado

El crédito lo destinara para la adquisición de fierros y planchas metálicas para la construcción de una puerta metálica.
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el préstamo.
texts.en:
Raymundo works as a locksmith and in the construction of metal doors and windows. His business is based in the house where he lives as a tenant in the Rio Seco area of the city of El Alto. He lives alone with one of his children since his wife lives in the country, raising livestock. He will use the loan to buy hardware and metal plates for metal door construction. This is his first loan with Impro. Our evaluation determined that he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy work materials.

loans.name: Maria Auxiliadora

texts.es: Doña María Auxiliadora esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para invertirlo en repellar su casa y asi mejorar las condiciones del hogar, vive en la colonia Nuevo León-Nueva Guinea, tiene 24 años de desempeñarse como docente de educación primaria, es muy responsable, honesta y ha demostrado  buena conducta y moral crediticia, ha contribuido al desarrollo de su colonia, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad, y a pesar que no viven con ella se encarga del cuido de sus ancianos padres, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca y aporta con los productos basicos del hogar, ya que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos.
texts.en:
María Auxiliadora is asking for her 7th loan from AFODENIC to invest in plastering her home and thereby improve her home’s condition. She lives in the Nuevo León-Nueva Guinea neighborhood, is 24 years old and works as a primary school teacher. She is very responsible, honest and has demonstrated good conduct and moral credit history. She has contributed to the development of her neighborhood. She has 2 grown children. And even though they don’t live with her, she takes care of her elderly parents. Her husband works as a farmer and contributes basic products to the home, as they are a family of few economic resources.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Plaster her home

loans.name: Beto Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando  vive en la calle “Manuel caballero”  de la zona villa Adela en la ciudad de El Alto.
 
Vive en casa propia junto a su esposa e hijos. Tanto El como su esposa trabajan como docentes en escuelas de la ciudad.

También poseen un tienda la cual funciona como una pequeña  librería y fotocopiadora.
 
El crédito lo destinara en la adquisición de una nueva fotocopiadora ya que la que tienen se encuentra en malas condiciones. 
 
Es el segundo   crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada lo califica para otorgarle el crédito.
texts.en:
Orlando lives on “Manuel caballero” Road in the area of villa Adela in the city of El Alto. He lives in his own home with his wife and children. Both he and his wife work as teachers in city schools. They also own a store which functions as a small library and a place to photocopy. He will use the loan to buy a new photocopier as their current one is in bad shape. This is his second loan with Impro; our evaluation qualifies him for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy a photocopier.

loans.name: Dina Susana

texts.en:
Dina is a member of the Paraíso (“Paradise”) Village Bank. She is 39 years old and is married with four children. Dina sells food and drink in the market in Quinua, a town about an hour outside of the city of Ayacucho. She sells traditional Peruvian meals like “caldo de gallina” (chicken soup), “caldo de cabeza” (head soup), “mondongo” (tripe soup), and “arroz con pollo” (rice with chicken).

Dina has been in this business for the past twenty years. She wakes up each morning at 3:30am or 4am, and starts working at 5am. She works until she runs out of food, which usually happens sometime between 12pm and 4pm. Her daughter helps her run the business.

Dina is requesting a loan of 1,800 soles to buy rice, sugar, oil and meat to cook with. Her goal for the future is to turn her house in Quinua into a hotel for tourists to stay at.

loans.use: Buy rice, sugar, oil and meat

loans.name: Victoria

texts.en:
Victoria is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. She is a 63-year-old widow with eight children, three of whom still live with her. She has a grocery store in her home, which she runs from 6am-1pm and 3pm-7pm each day, with the help of her children. She has had her store for the past eight years.

Victoria is requesting a loan of 1000 soles to buy more rice, sugar, flour and soap for her store. She dreams of opening a wholesale store in her home. Her husband was sick for a long time, so she didn’t have time to think about it seriously, but now that she is alone and working more, she is thinking about doing it.

loans.use: Buy rice, flour, sugar, and soap

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is a member of the Empecemos (“Let’s get started”) Village Bank. She is 40 years old and is the single parent of one daughter. Elizabeth makes different kinds of cake with her mother, father, and daughter and distributes them to local market vendors, grocery stores, and schools in a small cart. She has been working in her family business for the past ten years.

Elizabeth is requesting a loan of 600 soles to buy flour and sugar to make more cakes. She usually takes out slightly larger loans, but is taking out a small loan since she expects the summer months (January – March) to be slow for business, since many locals leave the city of Ayacucho to return to their hometowns in the countryside.

Elizabeth’s goal for the future is to expand her business and open her own cake bakery.

loans.use: Buy flour and sugar to make cakes

loans.name: Edwin Bernabe

texts.es:
Bernabé vive en la calle San Antonio de la ciudad de El Alto,

Trabaja  junto a su esposa, en su taller ubicado en su domicilio, como confeccionista de maletines y mochillas las cuales los distribuye al por mayor.

El crédito lo destinara para la compra de materia prima (tela, esponja y otros por cantidad).
 
Es el primer  crédito con Impro, la evaluación realizada le permite otorgarle el crédito
texts.en:
Bernabé lives on San Antonio road in the city of El Alto. He works with his wife, in his home-based workshop, making briefcases and backpacks which he distributes in bulk. He will use the loan to buy raw materials such as fabric, sponge, and so on in bulk. This is his first loan with Impro: our evaluation found that he qualifies for this loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy raw materials

loans.name: Angel

texts.es:
Ángel Q. Yucra vive en casa propia, en la zona  de La Portada, en la periferia de la ciudad de La Paz, con su esposa la señora Asunta Mamani y sus cinco hijos.
El señor Ángel trabaja como albañil, en construcciones particulares, y su esposa es comerciante ambulante.
Al presentarse las épocas de lluvia, su vivienda se encuentra en problemas ya que los techos se encuentran deteriorados y tienen filtraciones que dañan sus muebles.
El crédito será destinado a la refacción de los techos de su vivienda.
Esta es la primera vez que solicita préstamo y el análisis socioeconómico realizado lo califican favorablemente y puede acceder  a un  crédito.
texts.en:
Ángel Q. Yucra lives with his wife, Asunta Mamani, and his five children in his own house in La Portada, in the suburbs of La Paz. Ángel is a mason working in private construction and his wife is a street vendor. Now, in the rainy season, he is having problems with his home as the roof is damaged and the leaks are causing damage to their furniture. He will use the loan to fix the roof of his home. This is Ángel's first loan request and our socio-economic evaluation determined that he qualifies for a loan.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To make home repairs.

loans.name: Elyett

texts.es: La joven Elyett esta solicitando su 3er crédito a AFODENIC, para inventirlo en hecharle la ceramica a su casa, trabaja en la fundación José Nieboroswki, tiene 2 hijos: un niño de 7 años estudia su 2do grado de educación primaria y un bebe de 1 añito de edad, su esposo trabaja como mecanico dental y ambos comparten con los gastos del hogar y los compromisos adquiridos con AFODENIC, actualmente esta estudiando su ultimo semestre de la carrera de psicologia en la universidad Martin Lutero, esta joven tiene alto espiritu de superación profesional y laboral, su sueño es tener salud, trabajo y una vivienda bonita para que sus hijos se desarrollen en un ambiente sano y agradable.   Cabe mencionar que este  es el segundo crédito que Elyett solicita para mejorar su casa con el fondo KIVA, con el anterior logro construir los servicios higienicos.
texts.en:
Elyett is a young woman on her third loan with AFODENIC. She would like to invest in new ceramic tile for her home. Elyett works at the José Nieborowski foundation, and has two children—a 7-year-old boy in second grade and a 1-year-old baby. Her husband works as a dental technician and they share responsibility both for the household expenses and the agreements they have made with AFODENIC. At present Elyett is in her final semester in the psychology department at the university of Martin Lutero. This young woman has high career aspirations. Her dreams for her children, that they might have good health, good jobs and a nice place to live, are unfolding in a healthy and pleasant way. It is worth mentioning that this is Elyett’s second home improvement loan with Kiva. With the last loan she was able to upgrade the bathroom.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install ceramic tile in her home

loans.name: Jairo

texts.es: Don Jairo esta solicitando su 6to  crédito 6 para inventirlo en la construcción de una habitación, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Diriangen en colonia San Antonio, todos los dias tiene que madrugar para viajar a la 6:00 a.m. a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,  tiene 1 niño de 6 añitos de edad que actualmente acaba de aprobar su pre-escolar, su esposa trabaja como docente en la colonia Rio Plata, a pesar que son una familia de escasos recursos económicos son una familia muy unida; Jairo acaba de terminar de estudiar una licenciatura en ciencias de la Educación, su esposa actualmente esta estudiando una licenciatura en la universidad URACCAN,  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo y  salud para su familia.
texts.en:
Jairo is seeking his 6th loan, which he plans to invest in adding a room onto his house. He works as a teacher at the Diriangen School in the San Antonio district. He gets up at 6:00AM every morning so he can travel to the school and provide an education to the local children. He has one 6-year-old son, who has just "graduated" from pre-school, and his wife is a teacher in the Rio Plata district. Despite their lack of economic means, they are a very close family. Jairo has just completed his degree in Educational Sciences, and his wife is currently studying for her degree at URACCAN (a University in Nicaragua). His dreams include finishing the work on his house so his family can be more comfortable, working, and good health for his family.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Construction of a new room.

loans.name: Felix Alejandro

texts.es: Felix Alejandro  esta solicitando su 7mo crédito a la institución de AFODENIC para comprar ceramica y pintura para mejorar las condiciones del hogar, tiene 5 años de desempeñarse como gestor de cobro de la Curacao, se caracteriza por ser un hombre muy responsable, trabajador y ha a demostrado  buena conducta en el municipio, todos los dias don Alejandro tiene que viajar a las diferentes colonias del municipio a ejercer su trabajo,  este cliente tiene una hija  de 17 años de edad que actualmente acaba de terminar su bachillerato, su esposa trabaja y ambos comparten con los gastos familiares y los pagos de los compromisos adquiridos, ya que son una familia que dependen de un salario  pero que son muy responsables.
texts.en:
Felix Alejandro is asking for his seventh loan from AFODENIC to buy ceramics and paint to make home improvements. He has been a collections manager with Curacao for five years and is a very responsible man, hard-working and conducts himself well in the municipality. Every day, Alejandro must travel to different neighbourhoods in the municipality for his work. This client has a 17-year-old daughter who was recently awarded her baccalaureate. His wife works and both share in the household expenses and in paying their debts as they are salaried, but very responsible.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy ceramics and paint.

loans.name: Aura Ramona

texts.es: La profesora Aura esta solicitando su 8vo crédito a AFODENIC7para inventirlo en hecharle la ceramica a su casa, trabaja como docente en la escuela Deyling Olivas Betancurth, tiene 2 hijos mayores de edad a pesar que no los tiene a cargo, ella se encarga del cuido de un nieto, ademas cuida a su ancianita mamá, y le ayuda en los gastos familieres y compra de sus medicamentos, su esposo trabaja como agricultor en la finca de sus padres y le ayuda a sus esposa con los productos basicos del consumo nicaraguense; Aura Ramona todos los dias la tiene que viajar  media hora a pie para impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños campesinos de colonia la Esperanza, es una docente muy querida en su colonia por ser una persona de buen vivir y sociable, se caracteriza por ser humilde, reponsable y muy trabajadora en su comunidad, su sueño es mejorar sus condiciones de vida y de su familia.
texts.en:
Aura is asking for her 8th loan from AFODENIC to invest in installing ceramic in her home. She works as a teacher in the Deyling Olivas Betancurth school. She has 2 grown children, and while they are independent, she does have in her care a grandson and she also cares for her elderly mother and helps her with her household expenses and buys her medicine. Her husband works as on his parent’s farm and helps his wife with the basic products typical of Nicaragua. Every day Aura Ramona walks a half hour to teach the children in the rural area of La Esperanza. She is a beloved teacher because she lives a righteous life and is social; she describes herself as being humble, responsible and hard-working in her community. Her dream is to improve hers and her family’s living conditions.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install ceramic tile in her home.

loans.name: Maribel De Jesus

texts.es: Maribel esta solicitando su 3cer crédito a AFODENIC para inventirlo en hecharle el piso a la cocina, trabaja como docente en la Escuela Vigarmy Flores en la colonia Rio Plata,  esta profesora todos los dias tiene que madrugar para dejar hecho el desayuno a su hija y a su esposo y despues para viajar a la 66:00 am. a impartir el pan de la enseñanza a niños de esa colonia,  tiene una niña de 10 añitos de edad que estudia su 5to grado de educación primaria, su esposo trabaja en una empresa de cable y comparten con todos los gastos del hogar,  a pesar que son una familia pequeña los dos dependen de un salario bajo, pero son una familia muy unida y responsable; Mariebel actualmente estudia tercer año  en la universidad URACCAN,  su sueño es terminar de construir su vivienda para tener mejor comodidad, trabajo y  salud.
texts.en:
Maribel is asking for her 3rd loan from AFODENIC to invest in installing a floor in her kitchen. She works as a teacher in the Vigarmy Flores School in the Rio Plata neighborhood. Every day she wakes up early to prepare breakfast for her daughter and husband and then leaves at 6 AM to teach the children of the neighborhood. She has a 10 year old daughter who is in 5th grade in elementary school. Her husband works in a cable business and they share the household expenses. In spite of being a small family they are dependent upon low income, but they are a very united and responsible family. Mariebel today is in her third year at the URACCAN university. Her dream is to finish building their home in order to have greater comfort, work and health.

Translated from Spanish by Cindy Kendall, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Install a floor in her kitchen

loans.name: Mariela

texts.es: Mariela tiene 23 años, es soltera y vive en casa de sus padres. Se dedica a la venta de artesanías desde hace tres años atrás, ya que decidió vivir de manera independiente solventando sus propios gastos, quiere progresar haciéndose cargo de ella misma.  A Mariela le gusta vender artesanías, ya que logra buenos ingresos, aunque la parte difícil es traer la mercadería de otras ciudades, debido a que al estar elaboradas de yeso son muy frágiles y tienden a romperse, pero Mariela piensa que este es solo un pequeño detalle a comparación de todas las gratificaciones que su trabajo le da. Se encuentra en su sétimo préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma. Con el dinero solicitado podrá viajar a comprar más mercadería y así hacer crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Mariela is 23 years old, single and lives in her parents' home. She has been selling crafts for three years as she has decided to live independently and pay for her own expenses. She wants to continue to make progress with her plans to be self-sufficient. Mariela enjoys selling crafts and she makes a good income. The difficulty lies in bringing merchandise from other cities as the crafts are made of plaster, are very fragile and have a tendency to break: Mariela thinks this is a small detail compared to the enjoyment she gets from her work. This is her seventh loan with Microfinanzas Prisma. Thanks to this loan, she will be able to travel to buy more merchandise and thus increase her business.

Translated from Spanish by Laure Kwon, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy more crafts for resale

loans.name: Rosa

texts.es: Rosa tiene 42 años, vive junto a su esposo y a sus hijos en su casa propia. Con mucho esfuerzo ha logrado que toda su familia tenga su negocio propio de venta de productos lácteos y otras variedades de alimentos, es por ello que juntos preparan el yogurt que es todo un proceso de aproximadamente 60m litros por semana, tienen clientes fijos, como una escuela técnica de policías que siempre consumen sus productos por la calidad que han demostrado tener en la producción, esto anima bastante a Rosa que también ha incursionado en hacer néctares y panecillos, lo que es algo difícil por no disponer de un horno panadero, ya que a veces el horno que alquila le envía los panecillos quemados, por lo que Rosa se ha propuesto implementar su cocina. Es la  cuarta vez que solicita un préstamo con MFP, demostrando ser muy puntual en sus pagos de devolución de  capital, además Rosa tiene gran habilidad trabajar en equipo, como lo hace en su banco comunal. En esta oportunidad, el dinero requerido es para comprar un horno y mejorar su producción de pasteles, así como en la elaboración de los yogurtes y néctares. El horno está valorizado en aproximadamente 2000 soles y  con lo que resta comprará mayor cantidad de insumos e ingredientes.
texts.en:
Rosa is 42 and lives with her husband and children in a house which they own. Through a lot of hard work, the family has succeeded in building their own business, which sells dairy products and other types of foods. They produce about 60 liters of yogurt every week. They have regular clients, including a police academy that always selects their products because they know they are high-quality. Rosa is very inspired by this and now she is also trying her hand at making nectar drinks and baking loaves of bread, which is difficult because she does not have a bread oven. Sometimes the oven she rents burns the loaves, so Rosa is considering installing one of her own. This is the fourth loan Rosa is requesting from MFP, and she has been very prompt with her repayments. Rosa is also very good at working with a team, as she does with her village bank. She plans to use this loan to buy an oven, so she can improve her baking proces, and to support her yogurt and nectar drinks production. The oven will cost about 2000 soles. The rest will go toward supplies and ingredients.

Translated from Spanish by Jill Heske, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To purchase an oven to make baked goods

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Delia

texts.es: Delia tiene 38 años de edad, de su relación conyugal tuvo dos hijos que son la razón de su esfuerzo. Labrar la tierra es parte de su rutina desde su niñez, sus padres eran agricultores, y cuando se comprometió con su pareja, se dedicó aún más a esta labor, hace como cinco años atrás, adicional a sus otros cultivos, comenzó a sembrar flores, y está muy contenta con su trabajo y con la producción de sus sembríos. El mes de octubre que pasó vendió sus flores a un buen precio, debido a las fechas que conmemoran el día de los muertos, cada fardo de 12 docenas cuesta entre 70 a 80 soles, pero cuando baja llega a costar 20 soles. Debido a este factor, Delia trata de sembrar en fechas indicadas para cosechar en esto meses donde se cotiza mejor, pero también dependerá de la lluvia, del riego y más aún del abonado. Asimismo no deja de sembrar verduras como zanahoria y espinaca, de ese modo alterna los ingresos económicos para su hogar. Delia viene de trabajar cinco créditos con MFP sin problema, asimismo se compromete a pagar este sexto préstamo puntualmente. Con el dinero solicitado comprará abonos para volver a sembrar flores, porque sin abono la tierra no producirá, porque comenta que la siembra de flor empobrece la tierra.
texts.en:
Delia is 38 years old, and marriage has given her two sons who are the reason for all her efforts. Working the earth has been part of her daily routine since childhood. Her parents were farmers and when she got engaged to her husband, she devoted even more time to this work. About five years ago, in addition to other crops, Delia began to plant flowers, and she is very happy with her work and what the fields she sows produce. Last October she sold flowers at a good price because of All Souls' Day. Twelve dozen flowers sold for between 70 and 80 soles, but at other times of the year the price drops to only 20 soles. Due to this factor, Delia tries to plant at the proper time to harvest in those months when the price is better, but much also depends on rainfall, irrigation and fertilizer. She also continues to plant vegetables like carrots and spinach to provide an alternate source of income for their home. Delia has taken out five loans with MFP without a problem, and has promised to repay her sixth loan on time. With the money she has requested, she will purchase fertilizer for the flowers. Without fertilizer the earth does not produce, Delia says, because planting flowers exhausts the soil.

Translated from Spanish by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizer for flowers

loans.name: Eufracina

texts.es: Eufracina tiene 53 años, es casada y no tuvo hijos, vive acompañada de una sobrina que le acompaña. De soltera se dedicaba a la venta de carnes rojas, y cuando se casó continúo con la misma actividad, pero después acordaron con su esposo que se dedicarían solo al cultivo de papa en grandes cantidades. Al principio a ella no le agradaba esa actividad, pero después se dio cuenta que era mejor apoyar a su esposo, y así fue los dos trabajaban y los dos llevaban sus productos a los diversos mercados de la ciudad, lo que le permite ganar mucho más, y le es muy rentable. Por ello que preparan su carga cada fin de semana y depende del precio que ofrecen por los productos, los llevan a una u otra ciudad. Ahora la papa tiene un buen precio, y les motiva a seguir sembrando de forma alternada. Este es el 6to préstamo que tiene Eufracina con MFP, y ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos, además está muy agradecida con todos aquellos que la apoyan con su actividad. Todo el dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes para el cultivo de sus chacras de papa para que tenga una buena producción y logre recuperar las plantas débiles.
texts.en:
Eufracina is 53 years old, married with no children, but a niece lives with her. When she was single she sold red meat for a living and she continued doing this when married, but later on she and her husband decided to grow potatoes in large quantities. To begin with she did not like this activity but later on she realized that it was better to support her husband, and they both worked and took their products to different markets in the town, and earnings are growing and business profitable. Therefore they prepare a load to be sold every week-end at the town where the price is highest. At the moment there is a good price on potatoes and they are motivated to continue planting alternately. This is Eufracina's 6th loan with MFP and she has been punctual in her payments and she is very grateful to all the people that have supported her with this activity. The loan requested will be invested in buying fertilizers for the farming of potatoes so the production will be good and she will be able to make the weak plants strong.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for a potato farm.

loans.name: Priscila

texts.es: Priscila tiene 51 años de edad, es casada, tiene solo un hijo, quien es el motivo de sus desvelos. Desde joven trabajaba cuidando niños, luego se enamoró, se casó y se fue a vivir al pueblo de su esposo; desde entonces se dedica al cuidado de su casa y apoya en la siembra y el cultivo de la chacra a su esposo. Luego del paso de los años a Priscila le llegó a agradar mucho la actividad en la chacra, y ahora, hace como 8 meses, comenzó a sembrar flores, motivada por sus vecinos, y porque las ganancias son muy buenas, pero en un inicio no atinó con la época exacta de sembrar la flor para cosecharla en la temporada del buen precio. Pero no ha perdido las esperanzas de seguir sembrando, porque dice que el dedicarse a la chacra le es muy rentable en ciertas ocasiones y sobre cuando se siembra de todo. Este es su sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, y en todo este tiempo ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos. Con el dinero que está solicitando comprará semillas de flores, asimismo los fertilizantes para el abonado correspondiente de la chacra.
texts.en:
Priscila is 51 years old, married with one son for whom she makes all her efforts. When young she took care of children, then she fell in love, got married and went to live at her husband's village. Since then she has been taking care of her house and helping with the farming of her husband's land. Throughout the years Priscila has come to enjoy this activity and for the past 8 months she began planting flowers, motivated by her neighbors and because earnings are good, but at the beginning she was not exact with the planting season in order to harvest when prices were high. But she has not lost hope to continue sowing as she says farming is very profitable on certain occasions, especially when you do not plant the same. This is her sixth loan with Microfinanzas Prisma and she has always been punctual with her payments. With the money requested she will buy flower seeds as well as fertilizers for the farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase seeds and fertilizers.

loans.name: Juana

texts.es: Juana tiene 41 años, vive con su pareja, su hijo y unos inquilinos en casa. Para labrar la tierra hay que tener arte dice Juana, desde niña hizo las labores agrícolas, se levantaba a las 4.00am ayudaba a preparar el almuerzo a su madre, y hasta ahora hace la misma actividad, pero en esta vez es para su esposo e hijos. Esta familia siembra de 5 a 7 hectáreas de zanahorias y lechuga al año, y además  compran chacras sembradas de lechuga y espinaca de los vecinos para llevarlas a los mercados ganando por cada viaje de 200 a 300 soles, depende de cómo cotizan los productos en el mercado. Juana está muy complacida con sus cultivos y las reventas de los productos, por las gratificantes ganancias que obtiene cada vez que va al mercado, no cuenta que los precios de las verduras no tienen un precio estándar, hay épocas, como en el verano que la lechuga y la zanahoria llegan a costar hasta 50 soles el saco, pero a veces baja mucho como a hasta 20 o 25 soles por saco. Durante cinco préstamos consecutivos viene trabajando Juana con MFP, asimismo se compromete a pagar con la misma puntualidad este sexto crédito. Con el dinero solicitado comprará fertilizantes para el cultivo de sus próximas chacras de zanahoria, y también está muy agradecida con MFP por el dinero que le confían.
texts.en:
Juana is 41 years old and lives with her husband, her son, and some tenants in her house. Juana says that plowing the land is an art. Since she was a child, she has done agricultural work. She used to wake up at 4:00 am to help her mother prepare lunch, and now she does the same thing, but this time it is for her husband and children. This family sows 5 to 7 hectares of carrots and lettuce every year and then they buy plots sown with lettuce and spinach from the neighbors to take them to the markets. In each trip to the market, they earn 200 to 300 soles, depending on how they price their products. Juana is very pleased with their crops and the resale of the products, because of the rewarding earnings that she gets every time she goes to the market. The vegetables don’t have a standard price. There are times, like in the summer, when the lettuce and the carrots cost as much as 50 soles per sack, but at times, the prices are as low as 20 to 25 soles per sack. Juana has worked with MFP for five consecutive loans. As such, she will repay this sixth loan with the same punctuality. With the money she is requesting, she will buy fertilizers for the cultivation of her next plots of carrots, and she is also very grateful for MFP because of the money that they loan her.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy fertilizers for her plots

loans.name: María

texts.es: María tiene 42 años, es casada, tiene tres hijos, actualmente vive tan solo con dos de sus hijos, su esposo vive en otra ciudad porque trabaja en una mina. Los padres de María se dedicaban al labrado de la tierra y ella los apoyaba en todas las actividades agrícolas; pero desde que se casó se dedicó al cuidado de sus hijos, y después con el apoyo de su esposo puso una bodeguita en su propia casa, donde se ocupa desde las 6.00am hasta 10:00pm todos los días, solo cuando tiene que ir de compras cierra su negocio. A María le agrada mucho conversar con la gente y de paso se va ganando unos soles, argumenta muy feliz, el tiempo le ha permitido ganar mucha clientela, por lo que ha ido surtiendo de a pocos su tienda, ahora inclusive, piensa complementar sus ventas de abarrotes con otros artículos. Ella esta muy contenta con su negocio, el cual le es muy rentable, sobre todo le permite estar cerca de sus hijos, por ello es que está muy agradecida con Microfinanzas Prisma por el apoyo que siempre le brindan. A María, por sexta vez consecutiva, se le viene brindando el préstamo de MFP, y ella ha demostrado puntualidad en sus pagos en las fechas indicadas. Con el dinero solicitado va a incrementar una sección de papelería en su bodega, para de ese modo ser una tienda muy bien implementada.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, is married, and has three children. At present, she lives with two of her children. Her husband lives in another city because he works in a mine. María’s parents cultivated land, and she supported them in all of the farming activities. Since she got married, she has taken care of her children, and later, with the support of her husband, she put a small store in her house, where she works from 6:00 am until 10:00 pm every day. She only closes her store when she has to go shopping. María really enjoys talking to people and, at the same time, earning money. She has been able to earn many clients, because of what she had supplied little by little to her store, where she now complements her grocery sales with other goods. She is very happy with her business, which is very profitable. Above all, it allows her to be near her children. Because of this, she is very grateful for Microfinanzas Prisma for the support that they always offer her. María has been offered an MFP loan for the sixth time, and she has been punctual in her repayments. With the money requested, she will install a stationer’s section in her store. In this way, she will have a well-stocked store.

Translated from Spanish by Avni Shah, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To have a stationer's section in her store

loans.name: Melania

texts.es: Melania tiene 52 años, es casada, tuvo 7 hijos, actualmente vive con dos D. ellos y su esposo. DesD. niña, hasta los 18 años se dedicó a pastar los carneros D. sus padres, y sólo algunos días iba a la chacra a apoyar a sus padres. Pero desD. que se casó se incrementaron sus labores: ser ama D. casa, cuidar D. sus hijos, pastar el ganado y apoyar en la chacra a su esposo que es agricultor. Diariamente se levanta a las 4.00am a preparar los alimentos, y luego alista las viandas para cargar el almuerzo e ir a trabajar a la chacra, ella carga al hombro los pesados bultos D. la comida para todos los operarios. En esta temporada, y en las anteriores, han sembrado 3 hectáreas D. papa, para esta familia su única fuente D. ingresos económicos es la siembra D. papa y arveja, que siempre le son muy rentables. Primero siembran papa y en esa chacra, ya abonada, siembran arvejas y así se evita D. hacer una inversión adicional D. abono. Melania por sexta vez consecutiva acceD. a un préstamo con MFP, y hasta el momento no caído en morosidad. El dinero que solicita lo invertirá en la compra D. fertilizantes como nitrato y potasio para sus chacras D. papa.
texts.en:
Melania is 52 years old, married with 7 children. Presently two of them live with her and her husband. As a girl and until she was 18, she herded her father's rams and only some days she helped her parents at the farm. But when she got married her chores increased: being a housewife, taking care of her children, grazing the cattle and helping her husband, a farmer, at the farm. Daily she gets up a 4:00 am to prepare the food and get ready to carry the lunch and go to work at the farm. She carries the heavy bags of food for all the workers. During this season, and the previous ones, they have planted 3 hectares of potato. The family's sole income comes from sowing potato and pea which are very profitable. First they sow potato and in the fertilized land they sow pea and thus they avoid to make an additional investment for fertilizer. Melania has had six previous loans with MFP and up to now she has been punctual. The money requested will be invested in buying fertilizers such as nitrate and potasio for her potato farm.

Translated from Spanish by Lene Struck Christensen, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase fertilizers for a farm.

loans.name: Nieves

texts.es: Nieves tiene 59 años, acaba D. quedarse viuda, tiene 4 hijos, D. los cuales ahora vive con una D. sus hijas. Hace 5 meses murió su esposo, desD. entonces se encuentra muy triste, pero aún así continuó trabajando en sus campos, nos dijo con una leve sonrisa, por ello cuando llegó el momento D. regar su chacra D. zanahorias fue sin presagiar que sufriría una  caída que le provocó una fractura en el brazo derecho, desD. entonces tiene dificultades para realizar sus actividades, ahora depenD. D. su hija que se está haciendo cargo D. ella y D. sus cultivos. Nieves dedicó toda su vida a la agricultura, sembraba varias hectáreas D. hortalizas y después las transportaban a los mercados D. las ciudades aledañas. Esta actividad les ha sido muy rentable, ya que les permitió darles una educación a sus hijos, además a Nieves le agrada mucho la chacra, le ha dado muchas alegrías y ganancias que le han permitido vivir cómodamente, su única dificultad por le momento es no poder mover su brazo hasta que sane su hueso. Para Nieves este es el sexto préstamo con Microfinanzas Prisma, tiempo en el cual ha venido pagando sus cuotas sin caer en morosidad. Solicita el dinero esta vez para comprar fertilizantes y abono para su chacra D. espinaca.
texts.en:
Nieves is 59 yeas old, and she is recently widowed. She has 4 children, who now live with one of her daughters. Her husband passed away 5 months ago, and since then she has been very sad yet she still has continued to work in her fields, she told us with a slight smile. When it was time to return to her small field of carrots without forewarning she suffered a fall that caused a fracture in her right arm, since then she has had difficulties performing her tasks and now depends on her daughter who is taking responsibility for Nieves and her crops. Nieves dedicated her entire life to agriculture; she planted numerous hectares of vegetables, and later would transport them to markets in nearby cities. This activity has been very profitable for Nieves, given that it has permitted her to proviD. her children with an education. In addition, Nieves enjoys her small farm a great deal, it has given much joy and profit that have permitted her to live comfortably. Her only difficulty at this moment is not being able to move her arm until her bone has healed. For Nieves this will be her sixth loan with the Microfinanzas Prisma bank, a time during which she has paid her quotas without ever having any delinquent payments. Nieves is requesting this loan to purchase fertilizers for her small spinach plot.

Translated from Spanish by Mariela Cedeno, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Purchase of fertilizers for her crops.

loans.name: Channthol

texts.en:
Mrs. Channthol B. is a villager in Ba Thay village in Kampong Cham province. She owns a small restaurant where she sells Chinese noodles to the villagers and passers-by. Her husband, Mr. Som Yen, is a motorbike taxi driver. He now faces an obstacle because he does not have much money to repair his motorbike. Additionally, since Mrs. Channthol B.’s business is going well, she wants to expand it so she decided to ask for a loan to fix her husband's motorbike. She would use any remainder of the money to buy more chairs, plates, and glasses for her business.

Mrs. Channthol B. is the 48-year-old mother of three children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while the others are enrolled in the local school. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to fix her husband's motorbike

loans.name: Pouchh

texts.en:
Mrs. Pouchh M. lives in Kaung Kang Tie Bey Village in Kampong Cham Province. She and her husband, Mr. Him Vin, are farmers who own a plot of land where they cultivate vegetables. They now face a problem because they do not have enough money to grow cassava on their field. Thus, Mrs. Pouchh M. decided to ask for a loan for this purpose. She hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

She is 27 years old and the mother of two children, one of whom is attending the local school while the younger one is too young to work or study. Her husband is also in the picture.

loans.use: to buy cassava to grow in their field

loans.name: Bean

texts.en:
Bean K., 29, who lives Kompong Cham Province, Cambodia, earns a living selling groceries from her house, selling items such as cooked food and sweets for kids. She has experience in this business for a long time. K. is married and currently takes care of three children, all of whom are single and also attend school, whilst her husband is a local motorcycle taxi driver.

K. works hard every day and is very responsible with regard to her family. Recently, she sold all her groceries from her store, and because grocery-selling is K.'s main way to earn an income to support her family, she would like to ask for a loan to purchase a range of groceries for sale. Any remaining money would be used to build additional grocery-selling space.

loans.use: to purchase a range of groceries for sale

loans.name: Mrs. Meng Korn Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of sixteen members is located in Preak Phum village in Kandal province, and they plan to use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mrs. Meng K. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. She sells bananas. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land where she cultivates both rice and vegetables.

In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is infertile. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase fertilizer to amend the field to make her crops more productive. She would use the rest of the loan to buy piglets to start breeding pigs. Her husband, Mr. Ly Kruy, is a security guard.

Mrs. Meng K. is a 34-year-old mother with five children; four children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and piglets

loans.name: Mr. Pengphalla Sok Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Nineteen people in Kouk Trab village in Kandal province make up a village bank and Mr. Pengphalla S. is the village bank president. He and his wife own a small restaurant where they sell Chinese noodles with soup, coffee, and rice. Since their business is going well, they want to expand it. Thus, Mr. Pengphalla S. decided to ask for a loan to buy Chinese noodles and ingredients to make delicious food for his customers. He hopes to increase their income and improve their living conditions with this loan. He is 36 years old and the father of a child who is attending the local school.

Two members in this group have end-of-term loans and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows tH. to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to buy Chinese noodles and ingredients to make delicious food

loans.name: Mr. Reth To Village Bank Group

texts.en:
This village bank which consists of thirteen members is located in Kouk Trab village in Kandal province, and they plan T. use the loan which they obtained for different purposes. Mr. Reth T. is the village bank president who has been selected by the members. He is a palm juice collector who gathers juice T. process inT. palm sugar or wine. In his business, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough bamboos T. support his business. Thus, he decided T. ask for a loan T. purchase more bamboos T. tie T. the palm trees in order T. climb up T. gather juice. His wife, Mrs. Phun Sok Khan, sells palm sugar. Mr. Reth T. is 48 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another sells ice-cream and the others are enrolled in the local school.

One member in this group loan has an end-of-term loan and the rest have monthly payment loans. The EoT loans are not required T. pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial T. Cambodia’s poor. It allows them T. repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able T.. Most clients start T. make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase more bamboo to tie to palm trees in order to climb up to gather juice

loans.name: Yoem

texts.en:
Yoem C., 33, is a resident of Kompong Cham Province.  He is a local construction supervisor that manages employees to provide his service.  He has been constructing for a long time and currently earns an average of $4 per day.  

Yoem is married to Heng Phalla whom is 30 years old.  She runs a little store in front of her house to sell items such as dessert, sweets, and ice-cream. She can earn $2 per day from her business.  Phalla is a good mother of four children; three of the children are single, and one child is married.  Two of her children work as dealers in a casino. 

She is a very responsible lady to her family; she's always providing them with what they need.  To earn additional income, Phalla and C. request a loan of $1000 to purchase different kinds of merchandise like rice to store and re-sell. 

(C.'s wife and his daughter are pictured, because Yoem was unavailable)

loans.use: To purchase different kinds of merchandise like rice to store and re-sell

loans.name: Mrs. Rat Seang Village Bank Group

texts.en:
15 people living in the Tropang Tonlorb village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan group, and Mrs. Rat S. is the village bank president.  She is a farmer who owns a one-hectar field to cultivate rice.  Her husband, Mr. Meach Thun, is a palm juice collector.  Unfortunately, they currently do not earn enough income to provide a good life for their family.  In order to improve their living, Mrs. Rat S. decided to request a loan to buy a piglet to start breeding pigs.  She is 35 years old and the mother of four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school.  The youngest child is too young to work or study. 

10 members in this group have end-of-term loans; the remaining 5 members have monthly payments loans.  Borrowers with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because they are the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy a piglet to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Pien Horm Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of nine members, is located in Tropang Tonlorb village in Kampong Chhnang province.  They plan to use this loan for a variety of purposes.  Mrs. Pien H. is the village bank president whom has been selected by the members.  She is a chicken middleman whom buys chickens to re-sell.  In this business, she still does not earn enough income to support her household.  In order to improve her living, she decided to ask for a loan to buy three piglets to start breeding pigs.  Mrs. Pien H. is a 34-year-old widow with a child that helps the mother's business. 

Seven members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans.  Members with end-of-term loans are not required to pay any principal on their loans until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start making payments several months before the end of their loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy three piglets to start breeding pigs

loans.name: Mrs. Arn Men Village Bank Group

texts.en:
11 people in Thlouk Vien village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan, and Mrs. Arn M. is the village bank president.  She sells firewood, and her husband, Mr. Suos Dean, is a farmer who owns one-hectar field of land to cultivate rice.  In addition to his plantation, he is also chicken breeder.  Since his chicken breeding business has been successful, he wants to expand it. Thus, Mrs. Arn M. decided to request a loan to buy more chickens for breeding. She is 61 years old, and the mother of a child that works as a farmer.

Five members in this group have end-of-term loans, and the rest have monthly payment loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start making payments several months before the end of their loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK has a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy more chickens for breeding

loans.name: Mrs. Mao Hun Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, which consists of thirteen members, is located in Kouk Sdau village in Kampong Chhnang province, and they plan to use their loans for multiple purposes. Mrs. Mao H. was selected by the members to serve as the village bank president.  She is a farmer that owns a plot of land to cultivate rice.  Her husband, Mr. Pul Sarom, is a fisher.  Even though they both work very hard, they still do not earn enough income to provide a good life for their family.  Thus, Mrs. Mao H. decided to ask for a loan, which will be combined with her savings, to build a house for her family.  She is 51 years old, and the mother of two children whom are employed in a garment factory.

All of the members in this village bank have end-of-term loans; therefore, they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term.  End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor.  It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to.  Most clients start making payments several months before the end of their loan term, and almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.  AMK H. a delinquency rate of only 0.09%, and AMK H. a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To use in combination with her saving to build a house for her family

loans.name: Krub
