texts.en: Krub K. is 52 years old, married, and has eleven children, one who is married and ten who live at home. He grows vegetables and rice, and sells them to other sources for income in Khnar Village in the Siem Reap Province. He has been working with his wife almost 30 years earns around $3 per day. Two of his sons are employed as construction workers and another raises pigs and poultry for sale. With his large family, K. works almost everyday to generate revenues for to support his family's living. Because of his family relying on vegetable growing and rice farming, K. needs a loan to purchase insecticide to for his crops and with his saved money, to buy a motorcycle for the family.

loans.use: to purchase insecticide to use for his crop and remaining to plus with his saved money to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Nhor Nao Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Eight people in Kouk Sdau village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan and Mrs. Nhor Nao is the village bank president. She and her husband, Mr. Van Bang, are farmers who own a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, they face an obstacle because their field is infertile and they do not have enough money to buy fuel for a pump to water the field. Thus, Mrs. Nhor Nao decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field. She is 42 years old and the mother of five children, three of whom are employed in a garment factory while the others are attending the local school.

All the members in this village bank loan are end-of-term loan so they are not required to pay any princiP. on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the princiP. whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy fertilizer and fuel to support the field.

loans.name: Song

texts.en: Song S., is 33, married, and has three children. The family lives in Kompong Cham Province in Cambodia. Her husband's Thy Torn, 33, is a motorcycle taxi driver. She is a garment worker. She currently receives a salary of $80 to $100 per month. Recently, Torn’s current motorcycle has had mechanical problems and with the frequent problems, has had a decrease in clients. They are requesting a loan to purchase a new motorcycle.

loans.use: to purchase a new motorcycle

loans.name: Mrs. Chorng Tul Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank, consisting of eleven members, is located in Kouk Sdau village in Kampong Chhnang province and they plan to use their loan for different purposes. Mrs. Chorng T. is the village bank president selected by the members. She sells Banh Chhaev which is made from sticky rice with bean and pork. Since this business is going well, she wants to expand it so Mrs. Chorng T. decided to ask for a loan to buy sticky rice to make more cakes. She is a 43-year-old widow with four children. One is employed in a garment factory, one is a fisher, another helps her work and the other is attending the local school. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan to buy sticky rice to make more cakes.

loans.name: Choeurn's Group

texts.en:
Mr. Choeurn T. is a group leader of four members who all live in Khna Kandal village in Kampong Chhnang province. He is a farmer who owns a piece of land to cultivate rice. His wife, Mrs. Hun Hon, is a pig breeder. Mr. Choeurn T. is 55 years old and the father of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory while another is a laborer and others are enrolled in the local school. Since the second child's workplace is far from their house, Mr. Choeurn T. decided to ask for a loan for his second child to pay for transportation to work. 

Three members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the other has a monthly payment loan. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To ask for a loan for his second child to pay for transportation to work.

loans.name: Rethy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Rethy N. is a group leader of four who all live in Choeung Khnar village in Kampong Chhnang province. She sells fruit and vegetables in the local market. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell. She hopes to increase income and improve her living conditions with this loan. Mrs. Rethy N. is a 28-year-old widow with two children who are too young to work or study. 

Three members in this group loan are end-of-term loans and the other has a monthL. payment loan. The former are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financialL. able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To purchase more fruit and vegetables to resell.

loans.name: Leng

texts.en: Leng B. is 29 years old and lives in Kompong Tom Province, Cambodia. She is married and the mother of five children, all of whom are single; some of them are attending school. She currently earns a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind her house, raising them for their offspring and for slaughter. She also earns income in rice farming. She has been running both her businesses for more than eight years and is currently earning approximately $6 each day. Her husband helps her in her businesses. The children also help her in raising pigs. B. hopes to start new business of selling clothes. She is requesting a loan to help build a medium sized store and begin selling clothes.

loans.use: to build a medium store and begin selling the clothe

loans.name: Mrs. Pao Uy Village Bank Group

texts.en:
Fourteen people in Damnak Khey village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan and Mrs. Pao U. is the village bank president. She makes baskets to sell in the local market. Aside from this business, she is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she does not have rice seed for growing on the field. Thus, Mrs. Pao U. decided to request a loan to bU. rice seeds for cultivation. She is a 29-year-old widow with four children, three of whom are enrolled in the local school while the youngest is too young to work or study.
 
Eight members in this group loan are end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds for cultivation.

loans.name: Chen

texts.en: Chen S. is 39 years old and lives in the Kompong Tom Province. She earns a living raising pigs in a stall behind her house and sells them for slaughter six months after she begins raising them. Her husband, Yoeun Sok, 38, is a construction supervisor who has employees help provide his building service. He earns an average of $7 per day. She is widely known and can raise at least two pigs per year. S. has been raising pigs for over three years and is currently earning $4 a day. They have five children, all who attend school. S. is requesting a loan of $1000 to buy more piglets to raise for profit.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Mamlakat

texts.en: B. Mamlakat is 38 years old. She is married with 3 children. She lives in Khujand and trades in the local bazaar by selling shoes, women's and men's clothing that she brings from Istaravshan. She goes purchasing twice per a month and she brings an assortment for any age and taste. She is very polite and she has a lot of repeat customers. Mrs. B. applies with the request of the business development loan of 1800 STJ for 2 months for the new seasonal wear and importing a wide assortment.

loans.use: the new seasonal wear and importing a wide assortment of clothes.

loans.name: 12- Đông Sơn Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 12 consists of 6 poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward of Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Lan is the lead borrower of the group. She is 47 years old, married, and has three children: a 25 year old son who drives vehicles for a private company, a daughter who is studying foreign languages at Hanoi University and a 17 year old daughter at high school.

This is Mrs. Lan's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she will use it to buy supplies for her restaurant business.  The restaurant previously only catered to the breakfast crowd and she will use the funds to expand her lunch and dinner business.  She currently serves about 100 breakfasts, 40 lunches and 10 dinners.  With the profits from her loan, Mrs. Lan will pay for her children's education.  Her goal is to see her children in stable employment.

The loan will be split equally between all 6 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:
* Mrs. Sau is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong to buy  material that she will use to make and sell women's clothes.
* Chau will use her loan to buy pork and rice to make Bún Chả (a popular dish made of bacon and rice) for resale.
* Mrs. Ha will use her loan to buy pork, shrimp, chicken and rice to cook lunch and dinner and resell from her house.
* Phuong and Mrs. Dung are borrowing money to buy screws, aluminium pots, etc. to resell in Dong Thanh market.

loans.use: To buy pork, shrimp, rice, etc and assorted hardware articles

loans.name: Kheun

texts.en: Kheun K., 40, lives in Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He is a very responsible man to his family and is always providing them with what they need. He is married with four children; all of them are single and are going to school. He works on a staff of a non-governmental organization (CMAC). He currently receives a salary of $180 a month, and has been working since 2001. Hs wife's, Noeun Yorng, 36, is a local tailor. She provides clothes for the local village, and all her customers recognize her excellent service. For additional income, she is also a rice farmer. K. and his family's living conditions are not great because the house is too small for them. He would like a loan to repair and decorate his old house and for additional money for his wife's rice farming.

loans.use: to repair and decorate his old house

loans.name: Meerwaise

texts.en:
Meerwaise is the son of A. K.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan and is married with four children. Meerwaise would like to make a small loan. He is a mechanic and he wants to improve his family's lifestyle.

He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for a term of 12 months. He would like to expand the size of his business by increasing his inventory.

He is very happy with this small loan process in Afghanistan because it provides a chance for poor people to expand his/her business.

loans.use: To increase the size of his business.

loans.name: Nuri

texts.ru: Орипова Нури женщина в возрасте 51 года , мать троих детей.Все дети уже взрослые.Она с молодости работала продавцом а универмаге.После распада Союза она начала свой бизнес.Нури торгует на рынке мужской одеждой,в основном мужскими рубашками.За товаром она ездит с сыном.Для расширения бизнеса Нури решила получить кредит.
texts.en:
Nuri O. is a woman of 51 years of age and a mother of three children. All her children are grown up. She has been working as a sales person in a supermarket since she was young. After the collapse of the Soviet Union she started her own business. Now Nuri sells men's clothing, mainly men's shirts, on the market. She travels with her son to buy the merchandise. To expand her business Nuri decided to apply for a loan.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To expand business

loans.name: Ngov

texts.en: Ngov S. is 58 years old and a resident of Siem Reap Province where she has owns a plot of land in her village. She is a mother of one child and is married to Moth Set who is a local brick layer and earns about $1.50 per day to help meet with his family's expenses. She is widely known in her business of growing rice crops and vegetables, which she plants twice a year. She earns an income of approximately $2 each day. Ngov works hard at her business activities every day and never wastes time. Growing is S.'s main source of income to help sustain her family and especially make sure her receives enough food. S. has requested a loan to help purchase equipment to repair her old house. The loan will make her family's living conditions more comfortable.

loans.use: to repair her old house

loans.name: Safiallah

texts.en: Safiallah is the son of A.. He lives in Kabul, Afghanistan in a big family. He has a reconstruction company. He needs money to expand his business and to bring some changes in his business. He has requested an individual loan of 50000 Afghani for the term of 10 months. He is very pleased and states that the loan procedure is the best because it can support a person to expand his/her business.

loans.use: He needs money to expand his business

loans.name: Elmira

texts.ru: Шарафутдинова Эльмира женщина в возрасте 54 года имеет одну взрослую дочь.Муж работает электриком.Эльмира арендует помещение в центре г.Худжанда и занимается реализацией лекарственных препаратов.Её аптека не такая уж большая, для увеличения товара она решила получить кредит.На сумму займа Эльмира хочет закупить самые необходимые лекарства при гриппозных состояниях человека.Сейчас время гриппа,и население имеет спрос на лекарственные препараты.Эльмира заранее благодарна, за помощь и поддержку.
texts.en:
Elmira S. is a woman of 54 years and has one grown daughter. Her husband works as an electrician. Elmira rents a space in the center of Khudjanda city and sells pharmaceuticals. Her pharmacy is not so big and to increase her inventory she decided to apply for a loan. She wants to use the loan to buy all the necessary medicine for the treatment of flu. Because right now it's a flu season and the residents are in need of these drugs. Elmira is very grateful for the help and support in advance.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pharmaceuticals

loans.name: Oloviddin

texts.ru: Оливиддин парень 26 лет женат имеет одну маленькую дочку.Оловиддин работает в колхозе на поле.На дому он откармливает скот , в основном у него дойные коровы, которые доит его жена и продаёт молоко в своей местности. Оловиддин хочет купить ещё пару дойных коров.Он кредитуется  второй год.В начале у него было всего три барана,а на сегодняшний день у него 5коров.Он рад что существуют такие займы для животноводства.
texts.en:
Oloviddin is a young man of 26 years, married and has one little daughter. Oloviddin works on a farm in the fields. He also breeds cattle at home. He mainly owns milk cows which his wife milks and sells the product locally. Oloviddin wants to buy another pair of milk cows. He has been taking out loans for the second year now. In the beginning he only had three rams and now he already has five cows. He is very happy that such loans are available for animal husbandry.

Translated from Russian by Elena Fedorchuk, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy two milk cows

loans.name: Osimjon

texts.en:
Osimjon B. lives in Khujand and he is married. He is 20 years old and he has been engaged in the business for 3 years. Osimjon is a student but he trades to support his young family and to help his parents, as he is an only son in the family. It is the family business and he trades in salads and pickles (Korean salads, pickled tomatoes and cucumbers). His young wife makes the stock and he trades in the bazaar.

Osimjon applied to KIVA to ask for the business development loan of 2300 STJ for 8 months for a trade outlet lease, as it is difficult to trade. He thanks KIVA for its support.

loans.use: Trade outlet leasing

loans.name: Mavjuda

texts.en: Mavjuda O.  has been a client of our program since 2008 and she recommends herself as a serious client who trusts the MicroInvest loan procedure. Mavjuda is engaged in commercial service and sales so she has an outlet in the local bazaar selling men's and children's wear. She brings her assortment from Kyrgyzstan and Uzbekistan. She has the good assortment that shows she has good taste. She has 15 years' experience in business. Mavjuda is asking KIVA for a business development loan of 1000 TJS for a month to import a new seasonal assortment.

loans.use: to import a new seasonal assortment

loans.name: Shavkat

texts.ru: Шавкат отец троих детей , возраст 36 лет работает колхозником в колхозе.Жена домохозяйка, помогает мужу по уходу за скотом.Сам Шавкат очень любит заниматься купля продажей мелкорогатого скота.Он кредитуется уже третий год в Микроинвесте. Сейчас у него кроме баранов имеются ещё две коровы.Для закупа корма для скота и ещё двух дойных коров он хочет получить 3000 сомони.Сейчас на рынке скот подешевел, поэтому скотоводы хотят приобрести скот.
texts.en:
Shavkat is 36 years old and the father of three children. He works as a rancher on a kolkhoz, a collective farm. His wife, a housewife, helps him care for the cattle. Shavkat himself really loves the buying and selling of small-horned cattle, and this is the third year he has had a loan with MicroInvest. In addition to rams, he now has two cows. Shavkat wants to take out a loan of $875 (approximately 3000 somoni) in order to buy feed for the cattle and two more dairy cows. The market price of cattle has dropped, so it is a good time for ranchers to buy livestock.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Chan

texts.en: Chan S. is 29 years old and her husband's Mouy Tiey is 32. They currently live in Siem Reap Province in Cambodia. The couple has two children, both of whom are teenagers and attend school. They earn a living by raising pigs in a pigpen behind their house, raising them for slaughterer and also for offspring. They started their business three years ago. They currently earn about $3 each day. They always work hard and are very responsible for both their children, paying for school fees, food, clothing, and medical care. Because pig raising is the main source for family's income, S. and Tiey are applying for a loan to buy more piglets for raising.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to raise

loans.name: Pech

texts.en: Pech S. is widowed, 58 years old, and has five children. Two are married, the other three of whom are single-one is a driver, a policeman, and the other helps in S.'s business. S. sells groceries from her house in Banteay Meanchey Province. She has been selling since 2000, earning around $5 per day. She sells a variety of products to her customers such as soft-drinks, cake, candy, food ingredients, etc. Her business has been going very well because there is no competitor in her area. With her success, she would like to expand her business, and is asking for a loan to purchase additional grocery inventory for sale.

loans.use: to purchase grocery inventory for sell

loans.name: Chhit

texts.en: Chhit C., 30, lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She is married and the mother of four children, all of whom are single. Her husband, Cheng Chaiy, 39, is a local construction worker. She owns and uses a plot of land in her village. She grows rice crops and specializes in growing cabbages, which she plants twice a year.  She is earning an average of $3 a day. Her husband also works with his wife to grow vegetables. C. has been doing this for eight years now and never wastes time at her farming activities. She normally hires a cow from a neighbor to help her do her farm work. Now she hopes to own her own cow and is asking for a loan to purchase a cow to use for plowing on her farmland.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to use for plowing a farmland

loans.name: Yang

texts.en:
N. is a 33 year old rice farmer who lives in Saravon Village in the Pursat Province. For an additional source of income, she raises pigs for sale, while her husband buys chicken to resell in the market. N.'s business is going well and she can earn around $2 per day. To support her family in living sufficiently, N. and her husband work hard everyday to help generate profits. Raising pigs can take three to four months before she can sell them for slaughter.
Because of the success in her business, N. is requesting a loan to purchase piglets to raise and the remaining amount will be used for her husband’s business. The loan will greatly improve the family’s income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise

loans.name: Leang

texts.en: Mrs. Leang K. lives in Krauk Koeut village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a dessert seller. Her husband, Mr. Nhem Thanh, is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. Even though they try to work hard, they still earn a small income which cannot provide a better life and they also live in an old house in poor conditions. In order to improve these conditions, Mrs. Leang K. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to build their new house. She is 58 years old and the mother of three children, two of whom are employed in a garment factory while the other is attending the local school.

loans.use: To add to her savings to build a new house.

loans.name: Phoeurn

texts.en: Phoeurn L., 42, and is married to Nhov Yeng, who is 41 years old. They live in a rural area of Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. They have eight children; six of them are single and the other two are married. Three of their single children are employed and help with family's needs. Phoeurn is a local cultivator. She grows different kinds of crops, including rice, vegetables, and fruits, and sells them to a reseller at the market three months after planting. Her husband sells wood carving. He carves from wood from the forest, using a cow-cart as transport, and then sells the items at clients’ houses. Phoeurn is applying for a loan of $1000 as capital. The loan will allow her to buy two cows and a cart to use for her farm work, as well as for her husband’s wood transporting.

loans.use: to buy two cow and a cart

loans.name: Horm

texts.en: Mrs. Horm K. is a villager in Lor village in Kampong Chhnang province. She and her husband, Mr. Hong Suor, are farmers who own a piece of land to cultivate rice. In the plantation, they get little revenue to earn their living. Thus, Mrs. Horm K. decided to ask for a loan to buy a plot of land to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. She is 40 years old and the mother of six children, two of whom are construction workers while another is employed in a garment factory. One is a farmer while the others are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy a plot of land to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Sochea's Group

texts.en: Mrs. Sochea N. is a group leader of five who all live in Svay Khoy village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a pig breeder. Since her pigs are bigger and bigger, she does not have much money to support them so she decided to ask for a loan to buy pig food. Her husband, Mr. Chhuon Vanna, is a vet in the local village. Mrs. Sochea N. is 34 years old and the mother of two children who are enrolled in the local school.

loans.use: To buy pig food to feed her pigs.

loans.name: Hun's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Hun A. is a group leader of six members who all live in Sre Sa village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces an obstacle because her field is far from the irrigation system. Thus, Mrs. Hun A. decided to ask for a loan to add to her savings to buy a pump in order to water the rice field. She hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. Her husband, Mr. Keo Oeun, sells firewood. Mrs. Hun A. is 47 years old and the mother of three children who are attending the local school. 

This is a group loan where four members have end-of-term loans. They are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time.

loans.use: To add to her savings to buy a pump in order to water the rice field.

loans.name: Mrs. Phanny Seng Village Bank Group

texts.en:
ElevE. people in Soupy village in Kampong Chhnang province have formed a village bank loan and Mrs. Phanny S. is the village bank president. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding pigs business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy two more piglets for breeding. Her husband, Mr. PhE. Yun, is a basket maker. Mrs. Phanny S. is 24 years old and the mother of two childrE. who are too young to work or study. 

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy two more piglets for breeding.

loans.name: Hean

texts.en: Mrs. Hean K. was born in 1972 and she now lives in Thbeng Kpos village in Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice. In this plantation, she faces a problem because she usually pays a lot of money to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the field. In order to save some money, Mrs. Hean K. decided to ask for a loan to buy an ox to add to the old one to plow the field. Her husband, Mr. Men Suot Treng, is a construction worker who can make a little money to support the family. Mrs. Hean K. is the mother of three children who are attending the local school.

loans.use: To buy an ox to add to the old one to plow the field.

loans.name: Mr. Tom Nguon Village Bank Group

texts.en:
The village bank loan group consists of twenty people who live in the village of Nor Neam Toteung village in Kampong Chhnang province. Each of the members will use the loan for different purposes. Mr. Tom N. is the village bank loan group president selected by the members. He is a bed maker, which he makes from timbers. In his work, he faces an obstacle because he does not have enough money to buy the timbers to make beds. Thus, he decided to request for a loan to buy timbers to make beds to sell. He hopes to increase income and improve living conditions with this loan. His wife, Mrs. Kong Ren, is a basket maker.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loans term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time.

loans.use: To buy timbers to make beds to sell.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Phan

texts.en: Phan P. is 37 years old lives in Siem Reap Province, Cambodia. She currently lives with four members in the family and is the mother of three children who are still in school. She runs her own farmland and grows rice crops, which she plants twice a year. Her husband Loun Chon is 37 years old and drives a taxi. All of his income provides for his family's needs. P. plans to buy a motorcycle to make his family's transportation needs easier. She is applying for a loan to purchase a motorcycle for her husband.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle

loans.name: Yam

texts.en: Mr. C. is a 25-year-old carver for the National Culture Department in Siem Reap Province. He is married to Yoeurng, 23, who grows vegetables and flowers to sell and raises pigs to sell as another source of income. The young couple just married recently and do not yet have any children. After they married, C. and his wife planned to live away from their parents. To live independently they need to build a house, but they lack the money to carry this out. Hence, C. would like to ask for a loan to purchase wood for building a house.

loans.use: to purchase wood for building a house

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Thy A. is a group leader of six people, all of whom live in Nor Neam Toteung village in the Kampong Chhnang province. She is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. She faces an obstacle because her field has infertile soil. In order to deal this problem, she decided to ask for a loan to buy fertilizer to support her field and make her crop more productive.

Her husband, Mr. Tun Chantha, is a teacher in the local school. Mrs. Thy A. is a 51-year-old mother of six children. One is a teacher in the local school, while another is employed in a garment factory. The other four children are enrolled in the local school.

All the members in this group loan are end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal on the loan until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the term. Almost all of AMK’s clients make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to improve the soil and make the rice crop more productive.

loans.name: Pop

texts.en:
Mrs. Pop C. lives in the village of Lvea Sor Kandal in the Kandal province. She sells rice soup to earn income to support her household. She is a 50-year-old widow with three children, one of whom is a motorbike taxi driver while another is a farmer who owns a plot of land to cultivate rice, and the remaining child is too young to work or attend school.

Mrs. Pop C. is requesting a loan for her second child to buy rice seeds and fertilizers to cultivate rice. She hopes to increase the family income and improve their living conditions with this loan.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds and fertilizers to cultivate rice on a child's land.

loans.name: Yen's Group

texts.en:
Mrs.Yen C. is a group leader of five residents who all live in Peam Tonlea village in the Kampong Chhnang province. Mrs.Yen C. and her husband, Mr. Sum Kuoy, are farmers who own three hectares of land and cultivate rice for a living. The couple now faces a problem because their field is quite far from an irrigation system. They do not have enough money to buy fuel for their pump to water the field, so Mrs.Yen C. decided to ask for a loan to buy fuel for this purpose.

Mrs.Yen C. is 44-years-old and the mother of four children. Three children are attending the local school while the youngest one is too young to work or study.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to do so. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% on Kiva.

loans.use: To buy fuel for a pump in order to irrigate the rice field.

loans.name: Long

texts.en:
Mrs. Long T. is a villager in Preak Ta Ong Tie Muoy village in the Kandal province. She makes nets to earn income to support the family. Her husband, Mr. Va Kimhok, is a farmer. He now faces a small problem because he does not have enough oxen to plow the field. Thus, Mrs. Long T. decided to ask for a loan to hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and cultivate rice. She will use the rest of the loan to buy fertilizers to improve the soil and make the crop more productive.

Mrs. Long T. is 56-years-old and the mother of four children. The oldest is a fisherman while the other children are attending the local school. Her husband is on the right of the photo.

loans.use: To hire a laborer with two oxen to plow the rice field and to cultivate rice.

loans.name: Chan

texts.en:
Mrs. Chan S. is a widowed farmer who lives in Prey Veng province, about 62 miles southeast of the Capital, Phnom Penh. She lives with her husband and five of her children. She typically earns $2 a day and is supported by two of her children who work as a tailor and a mechanic. The rest of her children are students. 

Thach Sichan, 22, is the oldest daughter and has been running a tailoring business since 2007. She is the one who most strongly supports the family expenses. On average, she earns $5 a day. To expand her daughters tailoring business, Mrs. Chan Sava is requesting a loan from Kiva to help purchase more decorative cloth and tools.

loans.use: Purchase more decorative cloth and tailoring tools.

loans.name: Dany

texts.en:
Mrs. Dany M. was born in 1967 and lives in Lvea Sor Leu village in the Kandal province. She is a pig breeder. Since her breeding business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, she decided to ask for a loan to buy more piglets and will use the rest of the loan to purchase pig food. She hopes to increase her income and improve the living conditions of her family with this loan.

Her husband, Mr. Long Savorn, is a farmer who owns a small piece of land and grows vegetables. The couple have four children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others are attending the local school. Her husband is also present with her in the picture.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and purchase pig food.

loans.name: Neak

texts.en:
Mr. Neak R. is a farmer in Tadork Porng village in the Takeo province. He owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. His wife, Mrs. Chhoem Saur, sells clothing. Since her business is going well, she wants to expand it. Thus, Mr. Neak R. decided to ask for a loan to purchase more fashionable clothing for his wife’s business. He hopes to increase their income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

He is 63-years-old and the father of five children, one of whom is employed in garment factory while the others are attending local school. His wife is on the right in the photo.

loans.use: To purchase more fashionable clothing for his wife’s business.

loans.name: Than's Group

texts.en:
This small loan is being requested by five borrowers, all of whom live in Kok Rolosh Commune in Siem Reap Province. The group leader, Mr. Than P., age 37, makes a living driving a taxi motorcycle, picking up his passengers in and around his community.

Mr. Than P. is currently earning an average of $3 a day and has been running his service for a long time. He is a father of three children, all of whom are teenagers and attend school. His wife, Neam Nim, sells used clothes at the market. She is also a good housewife who cooks delicious meals. She runs her business very well and has a lot of customers who buy clothes from her. To expand the business, P. seeks a loan for his wife to purchase additional used clothing for sale.

The four other borrowers include Phen S., age 40, who is a motorcycle taxi driver. He needs a loan to buy souvenirs for his wife to sell. Dok P., age 39, sells vegetables at the market. She is asking for a loan to purchase various kinds of vegetables for sale. Phan P., age 55, sells Khmer noodles. She is requesting a loan to buy ingredients to make the noodles. Phen T., age 31, is a staff member at a company. He is applying for a loan for his wife to enlarge her souvenir business.

loans.use: Purchase additional used clothes for sale

loans.name: Sruo's Group

texts.en:
Mrs. Sruo A. is a group leader of five residents who all live in Por village in the Kampong Chhnang province. She owns a small store where she sells rice and other foods. Her husband, Mr. Long Sambo, is a farmer who owns a plot of land and cultivates rice. He faces a problem because he does not have enough rice seeds to plant in the field during the dry season. Thus, Mrs. Sruo A. decided to ask for a loan to buy rice seeds. She hopes to increase his income and improve the family's living conditions with this loan.

She is 51-years-old and the mother of four children, one of whom is employed in a garment factory, another is attending the local school and the others stay at home.

All the members in this group loan are committed to end-of-term loans so they are not required to pay any principal until the very end of the loan's term. End-of-term (EoT) loans are AMK’s main product because it is the most beneficial to Cambodia’s poor. It allows them to repay portions of the principal whenever they are financially able to. Most clients start to make their payments many months before the end of the loan term. Almost all of AMK’s client make their payments on time. AMK has a delinquency rate of only 0.09% and a default rate of 0% with Kiva.

loans.use: To buy rice seeds.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a new horse for his business

loans.name: Mut's Group

texts.en:
This small loan group is composed of three borrowers; the group leader, Mrs. Mut M. is 29 years old and sells different kinds of vegetables: cabbages, morning glories, onions, and Carrots, etc. She can earn an income of approximately US$ 2.50 per day, and she has been running her business since 2002. She is married with two children: both are still young and go to school. Her husband is a motorcycle taxi driver, who is earning an average of US$ 2.50 to help meet his family's needs.

M. is working hard every day to make sure both her children get higher education. Recently, M. sold all her vegetables and she plans to buy more vegetables for re-sale; that is why she is applying for a loan of US$ 300.

The other two borrowers are:

Mot R., a widow, is a local seamstress who is applying for a loan to repair her old house.

Taing L., 35, sells Khmer cake. She faces difficulties with her living conditions: her house is not so good and too small for them, thus she is asking for a loan to repair her old house.< P> The borrowers live in Prek Pras Sdac Commune in Battambang Province.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables for re-sale

loans.name: Kong

texts.en: Mrs. S. is a 54-year-old rice farmer who lives in Boeng Bassac Village in Kampong Cham Province. She has been farming since 1990 and can earn around US$ 2 per day. Her husband, Mr. Lim, 54, works at farming rice with S.. They have two children, both of whom are young and are in school. For another source of income, S. would like to ask for a loan to purchase piglets to raise for sale and pig feed. She expects that the loan will help to increase the family's income.

loans.use: to purchase piglets to raise for sale and pig feed

loans.name: 07- Dong Son Group

texts.en:
Loan Group 7 consists of 5 poor women, all of whom live in the Dong Son ward, Thanh Hoa City. Thanh Hoa City is the provincial capital of Thanh Hoa province, one of the poorest provinces in Vietnam. It is located approximately 150 kilometers south of Hanoi, the capital of Vietnam.

Mrs. Thanh is the lead borrower of the group. She is 43 years old, married, and has two children: a 19-year-old son who is studying physical education and a 14-year-old daughter who is at secondary school.

This is Mrs. Thanh's first loan from the Fund for Thanh Hoa Poor Women ("FPW") and she will use it to buy the ingredients with which to make bun pho, a popular dish in northern Vietnam made with chicken, beef, or pork. She will sell the bun pho on the street outside her house. With the profits from her loan, Mrs. Thanh will pay her children's school fees and provide for her family.

The loan will be split equally among all 5 borrowers. The other borrowers in the group will use their share of the loan as follows:

* Mrs. Duy is borrowing 1,626,900 Vietnamese Dong (~ US$ 93) to buy various foods for her stall: onions, garlic, ginger, mushrooms, peanuts, sugar, sauce, etc.

* Mrs. Ty will use her share of the loan to buy beans to make tofu that she'll sell from her house.

* Mrs. Binh will use her share of the loan to buy lots of small items that she'll sell from the front room of her house: candy, cookies, beer, sugar, cigarettes, bread, and other such items.

* Mrs. Doai will buy 2 small pigs to raise that she will then re-sell.

loans.use: buying pork, beef, beans, rice to cook and sell

loans.name: Abduhamit

texts.en:
Abduhamit F. is a 26-year old man. Abduhamit and his wife, who is a housekeeper, have been married for almost 4 years and have two wonderful kids. Abduhamit has been running his own small business for one year. He has a store that sells shampoos, detergents, tooth-paste, brushes and other items. Abduhamit is very friendly and polite which attracts clientele. He is requesting a loan of 3000 Somoni ($ 875 USD) so that he can purchase more goods to sell and increase the range of products for sale. Abduhamit promises to pay his loan during a 10 month time period and thanks everyone who decides to support him.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International Tajikistan is perhaps best known for its rich history, which includes a key post along the Silk Road; the end of Alexander the Great's rule; and with it’s famous great thinkers, philosophers, scientists and poets such as: Rudaki, Ibn Sina (Avicenna), Firdousi, Omar Haiyam, Jomi, Mavlavi Rumi and many others. The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, contains epic mountain passes, and is a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC. And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics. The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy. In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable. These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. While the people of Tajikistan are working to improve its agricultural production and manufacturing sector, nearly two-thirds of the population still live in abject poverty. IMON's History Since December 2007, IMON International has worked closely with Kiva and Kiva lenders to ensure that poor and low income clients represent a viable business proposition. Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they need. To learn more about IMON International's work, please visit: www.imon.tj

loans.use: To purchase goods for sale and to expand offerings.

loans.name: Ernest

texts.en:
Ernest A. is a 64 year old man. He is a married with six children. Three of his children are fully independent and the other three are currently in senior high school. Ernest is an agro-chemical seller, who sells various kinds of chemicals like weedicides, fertilizers, and pesticides, as well as spraying machines, to the local farmers. Many local farmers patronize his products because of the current farming season, during which most farmers actively planting their crops.

Ernest wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines to better serve the needs of his customers. He hopes to raise enough income to sponsor his children's education. With the loan he believes he can have another branch in the next town to serve them rather than those customers coming to him. He feels it’s quite a distance for them to travel. Ernest would be grateful for your support.

loans.use: To purchase increased supplies of weedicides, fertilizers, pesticides, and spraying machines.

loans.name: Thon's Group

texts.en:
This is a small group that has three members joining together to ask for a loan. Mrs. B., 52, is the leader of the group. She is a widowed rice farmer who lives in Donsok Village in Siem Reap Province. She has five children, three of whom are married. The other two are single and live in the family's home. The two single daughters are employed as garment workers in Phnom Penh City and help to generate revenue to support the family. To alleviate their farming work and to gain profit in the future, B. would like to ask for a loan to purchase an ox to breed. <> The other two members are:

Mr. V., 25, a fisherman who needs a loan to purchase an ox to use; and Mrs. C., 25, who is a fisherman and needs a loan to purchase an ox. The people all live in Siem Reap Province.

loans.use: to purchase an ox to breed

loans.name: Jamoliddin

texts.en:
Jamoliddin is a 51-year-old man who is married with two children. He dedicates his time to driving a taxi and a microbus. He currently relies on the microbus for his public transport business, which he drives personally. His usual itinerary is the Kanibadam-Isfara route. Jamoliddin has about 10 years of experience in the public transportation field, and the competition is rather high but there is also a great demand. Jamoliddin is counting on your help and requesting a loan of 3500 Somoni ($1025 USD) for the term of 12 months. With the loan he’ll purchase spare parts for his microbus. With your support, Jamoliddin will continue to progress. 


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

The country is home to communities that still speak the ancient Sogdian language, epic mountain passes, and a civilization that dates back to the 4th millennium BC.  And, even today, it is a complex mixture of the Islamic faith, Soviet culture, New West culture and Central Asian traditions. 

Tajikistan is also the poorest of the former Soviet republics.  The civil war, which ignited soon after its independence from the U.S.S.R., further damaged the already weak economy.  In addition, 93% of the country is mountainous and only 7% of the land is arable.  These conditions have resulted in high levels of unemployment and have forced hundreds of thousands to seek work in other countries, mainly Russia. loans.use: To purchase spare parts in order to repair his microbus

loans.name: Fahriddin

texts.ru: Фахриддин мужчина в возрасте 36 лет имеет 6 детей , жена домохозяйка.Сам работает гидротехником в колхозе "Дусти".В выходные дни он занимается купля продажей скота, т.к его заработной платы не хватает на проживание.Фахриддин говорит что кредиты ему помогаю поддерживать его бизнес .Для увеличения числа коров он хочет получить следующий кредит.В настоящее время у него4 больших коров и 10 баранов.Он доволен работая с Микроинвест.
texts.en:
Fahriddin is a 36-year-old man with six children, and a wife who is a housewife. He himself works as a hydraulic engineer on the Dusti kolkhoz, a collective farm, but on his days off he buys and sells livestock. However, his income is not enough to live on, and Fahriddin say that the loans help him to sustain his business. He would like to take out another loan in order to increase the amount of livestock he owns. At present, he has four cows and ten sheep. He is pleased with his business relationship with MicroInvest.

Translated from Russian by Joyce ., Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: Cattle

loans.name: Rosina

texts.en:
Rosina F. operates a grocery store in her neighborhood. She started her operation three years ago. She is a 60 year old divorced mother with nine children. Seven of her children are independent while the rest are learning trades.

Rosina trades in products like rice, canned foods and drinks, assorted cooking oil, assorted biscuits, candies, and evaporated milk. With this loan, Rosina wants to buy cartons of evaporated milk, bags of rice, canned foods and drinks and cooking oil to increase her stock of goods. She also hopes to increase her savings to support two of her grandchildren in school. She would appreciate it very much for that assistance.

loans.use: To purchase increased inventory for her store.

loans.name: Daler

texts.en:
Daler A.  is a young father who has devoted himself to independent agriculture tasks for the past 7 years, cultivating potatoes, onions and carrots. He is also engaged in raising livestock and receives help from his brother and father. His daily efforts in caring for his fields assure him a good harvest as well as profits. Daler dreams of expanding his land and would like to obtain a loan to invest in his current parcel by purchasing seeds and fertilizer to earn a greater yield and profits. He thanks everyone supporting him and promises to repay the loan with no violations.    


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Toufic

texts.en:
Toufic is a 36-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife and their five children. He has been working as a blacksmith for sixteen years. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from A. Majmoua in order to install a new light system for his shop, and he also wants to paint his house. This is the first time that Toufic has requested a loan.

Toufic is speciA. in his work because of his professionalism and his commitment. His clients are engineers, companies, friends and others. When he first started, he hadn't done a lot of networking, and it wasn’t easy to deA. with people. He has been working as a blacksmith for sixteen years and that’s how he got his experience. In the future, Toufic plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to install a new light system for his shop and paint his house

loans.name: Wissam

texts.en:
Wissam is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, southern Lebanon, with his wife. Wissam is newly married. He has been working as a barber for five years. In his salon, he also does facials and he sells gel for men. Wissam has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his salon, and he also wants to do maintenance work in his house. This is the first time that Wissam has requested a loan.

Wissam is special in his work because he does nice haircuts and he is does a good job. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he faced the lack of cash. In the future, he plans to purchase a salon of his own.

loans.use: purchase merchandise for his salon and  do maintenance work in his house

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza D. , who grew up in a home whose principal work was, and is agriculture, learned her skills from her parents when she was very young. Farming has become her principal source of income and she dedicates most of her time to the attention and care of her agricultural products such as tomato, cucumbers etc. Through her daily work, she looks to provide her family security and economic reliability. However, due to unexpected difficulties, she cannot cover all of her expenses, and she is now requesting a loan to improve her products and increase her sales with the objective of constructing her house. All of this can be possible with your help.

More about Tajikistan and IMON International

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer for growing seasonal vegetables.

loans.name: Sophie

texts.fr: G. Sophie s’est mariée avec De Souza Francois. Elle était scolarisée jusqu’au 3ème. Elle est née le 19 septembre 1963. Elle a 5 enfants, âgés de 27, 25, 22, 13, et 11.  Les derniers quatre enfants sont tous a sa charge, et tous scolarisés. Elle a commencé il y a 28 ans en ayant vendu les tissus. Actuellement, elle vend les pagnes et les basins, et elle est ambulante. Elle commande ses produits au marché Missébo. Elle a vu une mévente de ses produits. Ses autres crédits de Kiva lui a permis de faire entretien a sa maison pour ses enfants. Dans le futur, et voudrait louer une boutique et prendre le crédit plus vite qu’avant.
texts.en:
Sophie G. is married to Francois De Souza. Born on September 19, 1963, she was provided with schooling through the 9th grade. Of her five children (ages 27, 25, 22, 13, and 11), the last four are in her care and are all in school. She started selling cloth 28 years ago. Currently, she sells "pagnes" (colorful West African cloth) and damask door-to-door, acquiring her goods from the Missébo market. Presently, she has seen a drop in sales. Her other Kiva loans have allowed her to maintain her house for her children. In the future, she would like to rent a shop and borrow money more quickly than before.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy pagnes (traditional Beninese clothing)

loans.name: Mahmoud

texts.en:
Mahmoud is a 26-year-old man who lives in Saida, in southern Lebanon. Mahmoud has owned a telephone shop for a year. He has requested a loan of 1000 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase new phones and also accessories for telephones. This is the first time that Mahmoud has requested a loan.

Mahmoud is special in his work because he has a good reputation and knows how to treat his clients. His clients are his friends, neighbors, and others. When he first started his business, he had difficulty finding the right place to open his shop. Mahmoud has learned how to maintain phones. In the future, he plans to expand his business.

loans.use: to purchase new phones and also accessories for telephones

loans.name: Mahkam

texts.en:
Mahkam I.  is a 67 years old married man and has 4 adult children. Mahkam is a hard-working man who has fought to provide for his family and educate his children, who today are working adults. Mahkam is an experienced farmer that grows grapes. After gathering his yield, Mankham dries them and sells them at the market. Each year Mahkam increases the crop yield and is sufficient for family consumption and for selling. The business is the main source of income for the family.  Mahkam needs to purchase mineral fertilizer for the upcoming season and is requesting a loan  of 3200 Somoni ($ 925 USD). The loan will be repaid in 12 repayments over 11 months. Mahkam and his family are counting on your help.


More about Tajikistan and IMON International

Funds raised through Kiva have already been distributed to thousands of IMON International's clients and will continue to provide thousands more with permanent access to the varied financial services they offer.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Helena

texts.en:
Helena A. is 52 years old. She is married and the mother of four kids. Currently, the kids are all in school. She has been sewing for thirty years now. In addition to that she also bakes pastries.

Helena is a specialist in female wears. Her skills and designs have class. She sews various kinds of styles that give her customers a new look. She sews children's school uniform, church attire, kaba and slit, wedding dress, funeral clothes, and more.

She wants to use this loan to buy increased supplies of sewing materials, like linen, threads, and thimbles, to increase her output and efficiency. Through her dedication and hard work Helena has two apprentices whom she is training in sewing as their future sources of livelihood. Helena believes in education and she hopes that the loan would improve her business enough to increase her savings and provide her children with quality education. She would be grateful for your contribution to making her dreams come through.

loans.use: To buy increased supplies of sewing material, like linen, threads, and thimbles.

loans.name: Eman

texts.en:
Eman is a 32-year-old woman who lives in Bourj el Barajneh, in the southern suburbs of Lebanon, with her husband and their two children. Eman has owned a clothing shop for five years. She has requested a loan of 700 US dollars from Al Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for her store. This is the first time that Eman has requested a loan.
Her clients are her friends and neighbors. When she first started her business, she faced livelihood expenses.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her store

loans.name: Zahriddin

texts.en:
Zahriddin I.  is a taxi driver and in his free time he helps his father with farming. His father has a big garden where together they grow grapes every year. After getting their yield they dry grapes and sell them at the market. He and his father work hard in the field hoping to have a good crop yield. He is proud of their farm because it is allowing him to feed and educate his family. He wants to borrow 3200 Somoni ($ 925 USD). He will use the loan to buy fertilizer and pesticides, and will make a small investment in land preparation. He was born and raised in Istaravshan, but he hopes his children can gain an education and move to a bigger city. His main short term goal is to make all the lands he owns productive.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Yoem's Group

texts.en:
This group is comprised of four members, and they are asking for a loan from Kiva.  Mrs. S., 46, sells noodle soup and porridge in the her local market in Battambang Province.  She has been selling since 2005 and can earn around $4 per day.  She is married to Von, 48; he is a doctor for the army.  Her business is going well because it is located near a crowded market.  She cares for four children, all of whom are young.  In addition to her soup and porridge business, S. buys watermelon fruit stocks from growers and wholesales to her customers for profit.  Now is the time for this business, but she lacks capital to do it.  Therefore, she needs a loan to carry out her business activities.  

The other three members will use the loan in specific ways.  Mrs. Y. N. is widowed and sells soy-bean juice.  She needs a loan to expand her business by purchasing ingredients to make soy-bean juices.  Mrs. S., 28, is food seller and needs a loan to purchase ingredients to make food.  Mrs. R., 60, is grocery seller and needs a loan to buy more groceries.

loans.use: Buy watermelon fruit stocks

loans.name: Moustapha

texts.en: Moustapha is a 31 year old man that lives in Bourj el Barajneh, a southern suburb of Lebanon.  He has been working as a car electrician since 2003.  Moustapha requested a loan of $1000 USD from A. Majmoua in order to purchase merchandise for his garage.  This is the first time that Moustapha has requested a loan.  His clients are his friends, neighbors and others.  When Moustapha first started his business, he faced sociA. and economic conditions.

loans.use: Moustapha will use the loan to purchase merchandise for his garage.

loans.name: Nury

texts.en: Nury M. lives in Khujand and is married with four children.  Nury first applied to MicroInvest in 2005 when she decided to open a small wares selling business.  She trades shampoo, soap, hair color, creams and other items.  She has a trade outlet, and she works directly with the suppliers so her prices are lower than the bazaar prices.  Nury is applying for a loan from Kiva for 200 STJ for a loan term of four months.  She will use the loan to enlarge her trade area , which will allow her to increase business assortment and turnover.

loans.use: Enlarge her trade area

loans.name: Yuldosh

texts.en:
Yuldosh J. has been an agricultural producer for the past 10 years. He is the father of three children and he is focused on their education. His wife is a very hardworking woman who supports Yuldosh in his production activities in order to improve their lives. Aware of the needs of his family, Yuldosh requested and received a loan from IMON International a year ago. He used the loan to buy seeds and mineral fertilizer for his harvest. He comes to IMON International today again to ask for a loan that will allow him to go on with his business and support his family.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer

loans.name: Hortense

texts.fr: K. Hortense s’est mariée avec SOSSA Paul. Elle est née le 3 février 1963 et ils ont un enfant scolarisé de 15 ans. Elle a commencé son activité avec le charbon il y a trois ans. Actuellement, elle fait le stockage de charbon et les vivres comme le riz, le mais, les haricots, et la farine. En ce moment elle a vu les difficultés de vente. Heureusement avec ses autres crédits de Kiva, elle a pu mettre l’argent a coté, et dans le futur elle pense a acheter une parcelle. Au lieu d’acheter au Marché Tokpa, elle voudrait acheter les produits qui sont moins chers au village.
texts.en:
Ms. Hortense K. was born on February 3, 1963 and is married to Paul SOSSA. They have a 15-year-old in school. She started her charcoal business three years ago and now stocks charcoal and staples, such as rice, corn, beans, and flour. These days, she has seen difficulties in sales. With her other Kiva loans, she was fortunately able to put aside some money. Instead of buying goods at the Tokpa Market, she would like to buy goods that are less expensive in town. And in the future, she is thinking about buying a parcel of land.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy staple foods

loans.name: Abena

texts.en:
Abena F. is a 36 year old local restaurant operator. She is married and has five kids. Four of her children attend school while her last born has not yet started school. She prepares and sells local foods like "fufu," "banku," and other local dishes in the lorry station at Agogo, the city where she lives with her family. She has being in this business for the past five years now. "Fufu" is prepared from cooked and pounded cassava and plantain with mortar and pestle, which is taken with all kinds of soup. "Banku" is prepared from corn and cassava dough boiled and taken with hot pepper or soup.

Abena says that the prices of raw materials have gone up significantly and she needs the support of a loan to enable her meet her production costs. With the loan, she wants to purchase more raw materials, like bags of maize, baskets of cassava, plantain, meat, fish, vegetables, and firewood, to prepare her meals. She would be grateful for that assistance.

loans.use: To buy ingredients like maize, cassava, plantain, meat, fish, and vegetables.

loans.name: Shahnoza

texts.en:
Shahnoza J. is a woman who on a daily basis seeks the betterment of her three children. She works with great effort for them and wants to continue to do so to build a prominent and promising future. Ever since she was a little girl, she has been dedicated to farming activities. She was raised this way and farming has been a stable source of income until this day. She must start very early in the day with the chores that this activity demands. Now that it is sowing season she works diligently to sow and tend the fields. To continue to work and to obtain a very good quantity and quality of onions, potatoes and wheat, Shahnoza is requesting a loan to purchase seeds and fertilizers. Let’s show solidarity to this self-less mother that looks for what is best for her children.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Bunyod

texts.en:
Since Bunyod was very young he has been in the agriculture business. He has experience in this business as he has always helped with the cultivation of crops in his home community of Istaravshan, Tajikistan. Now he is the father of two kids who are the main motivation for him. Bunyod has managed to improve his family’s economic situation thanks to the help received from IMON International through a loan that he has used directly for his agricultural business. On this occasion, Bunyod is looking for IMON International’s help so that he can benefit from technical assistance in his farming so that when harvest time comes around he can improve his economic situation.

loans.use: To purchase seeds and mineral fertilizer.

loans.name: Chum's Group

texts.en:
This loan group consists of four members.  Mrs. T., 40, raises chickens to sell at the market, and her husband is a rice farmer.  It only took her four months to start her own chicken raising business.  Her business is going well, and it is the main source of income for the family.  She cares for two children, all of whom are young.  In order to grow her business, Mrs.T. requests a loan to purchase more chicks to raise, which will increase her income.  

The other three group members will use their loans in various ways.  Mrs. B., 45, is tailor; she needs a loan to purchase more materials.  Mrs. T., 44, is a housewife and needs a loan so her husband can exchange his business motorcycle for a driving taxi.  Mrs. V. is widowed fish seller and needs a loan to buy more fish.  The group members live in Chamkar Samrong Village in the Battambang Province.

loans.use: To purchase more chicks

loans.name: Amélie Huberte

texts.fr: K. Amélie Huberte est nee le 2 Novembre 1979. Elle s’est mariée avec SOSSOU Albert. Ils ont deux enfants, âgés de 13 ans et 8 ans.  Elle a commencé son activité il y a 10 ans avec la restauration devant sa maison. Il y a 8 ans, elle a ouvert une petite boutique pour les divers. Elle vend l’huile, la pate alimentaire, les arachides, et les autres produits. Le crédit lui a donne plus de fonds de roulement. Grace au crédit, elle ne devrait pas s’inquiéter. Elle voudrait développer son activité avec la vente des cartes de recharges.
texts.en:
Amélie Huberte K. was born on November 2, 1979 and is married to Albert SOSSOU. They have two children, ages 13 and 8. She started working in catering ten years ago in front of her house. Eight years ago, she opened a small shop for sundry items. She sells oil, pasta, peanuts, and other goods. This loan has provided her with more working capital, and thus, thanks to it, she should not have to worry. She would like to develop her business with the sale of rechargeable phone cards.

Translated from French by Dan Kuey, Kiva Volunteer

loans.use: To buy food

loans.name: Arofat

texts.en:
Arofat S. is a farmer. She is 40 years old, and is married with two children. She puts a lot of effort into the development of her farming efforts because she is aware that they can help her children. The unconditional support that she receives from them provides her with optimism, and despite the financial shortcomings at home, she tries to alleviate those shortcomings efficiently. Her wish is to improve the living conditions of her family and is requesting a loan to increase the quality and quantity of her products. She requests 2000 Somoni ($ 600 USD). She wants to purchase seeds for wheat and onions and mineral fertilizer. Arofat is very grateful to everyone who is helping her to achieve her dreams.
